Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious rooms close to Disney property”
Reviews.Author: DessertsDivaFL
Reviews.Content: If all you want is a clean room close to Disney, this is the place for you. You won't spend an "arm and a leg" to stay here. If you want "bells and whistles", stay elsewhere. I just need a clean place to sleep and shower in the morning. This place worked out perfectly! Stayed here for $50/night- bought on Kayak.com.

Reviews.Title: “Worst front desks ever!”
Reviews.Author: hotelsmart4lyf
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay with HOTWIRE (as we always do), and upon checking in, the front desk said he couldn't find our reservation in the system. We showed our confirmation email from the smartphone but he still didn't know what to do. After almost 30 minutes of figuring out what to do, he let us stay.. Then the next day, when we're checking out, the front desk again, said she couldn't find our booking in the computer. So I called Hotwire and let the customer service talked to her. Still nothing. I asked that Hotwire to just fax it to the hotel but even the fax machine had problems. And worst of all, the front desk was speaking Spanish to the other staff there with a frown on her face. I felt so insulted. I have worked with a few companies and I know they can be fired for doing that. I don't blame Hotwire for the whole mess since they have been kind enough to help the front desk people the best way they can. Giving instructions as specific as they can. I'll never go back at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay......”
Reviews.Author: cjb71870
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 weekends in October for Halloween Horror Nights. And, we had an amazing time....when we had a question or something that needed to be handled, Reinaldo Alvarez took care of it immediately!! Thankful for that. We stay in the tower rooms for the view and we love it. The rooms are clean and quiet and the A/C is unbelievable! Which is great after a day at the parks. Can't wait for our next weekend there, which will be soon.... :)

Reviews.Title: “4.5/5--would definitely visit again!”
Reviews.Author: RaKerr
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay in the Tower rooms, but the standard room was great! The Tower rooms are likely incredible if the lobby is any indication of what they're like. The only reason I'd go with 4.5 instead of 5 is because the AC was a little loud. Other than that, everything was perfect. The room was incredibly clean. Housekeeping was so courteous--the kids often left stuffed animals in every corner of the room and housekeeping made the beds and put the stuffed animals up there so they were ready for bedtime. We were hardly there during the day but when we left in the mornings there were always people sweeping the walkways, cleaning the pools, making sure the garbage cans were emptied. The food was so good too--and a great deal. The breakfast buffet and drinks for 2 adults and 2 kids was only $25. The room had a mini-fridge and the hotel has mini-golf, basketball, and laundry facilities on site as well. We never took the complimentary shuttle to the parks, but it is offered. We had a rental car and the drive was honestly maybe 5 minutes. For the price we paid, I really wasn't expecting what we got. I probably recommended the hotel 7-8 times while chatting with other park guests in stroller lines and long lines and I would certainly recommend it to anyone reading here.

Reviews.Title: “dont let other reviews scare you away”
Reviews.Author: Ni45373
Reviews.Content: While the hotel wasnt perfect it isnt what people make it seem. If your looking for a place to stay thats inexpensive and decent you can stay here. If you are expecting to stay in an upscale place for cheap, go somewhere else. Its clean and the beds are comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “smelly and dirty....had to move rooms...”
Reviews.Author: Sandy W
Reviews.Content: We purchased a voucher online for 2 nights at the Ramada Gateway in Kissimmee. Upon arrival we were initially very impressed, but upon entering our room we were greeted with a horrible smell. Like that of old man cologne. We tried to get used to the smell, however when we looked into the bathroom we realized that the toilet was dirty, the tub had dirt all over it and the sink still had toothpaste at the bottom!! Gross! We went down to the front desk and were told that housekeeping would be in immediately to clean the room. We went back up to the room and waited. 30 minutes passed, we were waiting to go out for dinner, and no housekeeping. I attempted to call down to the front desk, however, our phone cord was broken!!!! I went downstairs and spoke to the manager and they moved us to the room next door. I believe the gross men's cologne smell is actually their cleaning products, hard to imagine, because the second room smelled as well. Our carpet in the second room was wet in one area. Gross. It is convenient to the Disney resorts, but that is all it has going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Ramada Gateway tower rooms”
Reviews.Author: sfabiano
Reviews.Content: From ck in to ck out everything was perfect. All of the staff, the res agents,the front desk clerks & even the very friendly girl at the deli are all some of the most helpful,professional & caring employees that I have ever encountered. As for the rooms,I can only rate the tower rooms & the tower building as I did not have occasion to stay in or see any other room type. Everything seemed brand new from the carpeting in the hall ways to the elevators to the rooms themselves. The room was quit large,well furnished and had a great flat screen tv, a small frig & a microwave. This was a great hotel with a great location and a great staff.

Reviews.Title: “It was Ok”
Reviews.Author: Junyer561
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed but it was expected. He tried to place me in the nasty looking area which I declined. We stayed at the towers which were OK. The fridge didn't work and and the view was horrible. But..... For the price it cool. Very close to Disney and btw the guy in the lobby lied to me about a timeshare tour. That was a waste of my whole morning which he stated was not a timeshare tour. I would stay there again. No bugs or anything like that. They just need a makeover.

Reviews.Title: “Ramada gateway”
Reviews.Author: chocolatebean34
Reviews.Content: My family +I found this hotel originally in 2005-2006 (after hurricanes Francis+Jean) hit our area and had to evacuate. Ever since then we have been staying there. We visit Disney approx. 3-4x yearly, and find the rooms are clean, staff professional, rates are very affordable. We always request a tower room, very nice for the value. Cudos to everyone, especially last stay when we had a room reserved but was not able to stay due to an emergency on the hotel's end. They went out of the way to get us a room across the street AT NO CHARGE to us at the busiest time of year, (Christmas, New Years). In fact, we have reservations for 4-19/4-20 2012. Could not ask for more for after a hard day @ Disney, or any of the attractions in the area!

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel in the Disney area”
Reviews.Author: kristian l
Reviews.Content: I saw this Hotel on the Chipostay.com website. I paid $169.00 for 4 days and 3 nights. This is the best hotel I have stayed in the Disney area. The room was amazing. The Front Desk staff were professionals and they did care about my stay. I love the idea that they have a restaurant and a cafeteria next to it. The prices were great and even the cafeteria food was cooked in the restaurant and stays open until 11PM. The best thing for me is that the Disney Parks were 5 min from the Hotel. I recommend this Hotel to anyone. Is the best

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Spanky1964
Reviews.Content: This was the 2nd year in a row we stayed here and this year we got a room on the lower level next to courtyard/pool and we loved it. Staff always great and room was clean . Very close to our Spring Training games @ ESPN Wide World Of Sports Complex Just a Great Hotel!!! We will be back next year!!! Great Price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for your Disney-overdose.”
Reviews.Author: SiMaKy
Reviews.Content: We booked this place in advance, December 2011. Got a great rate at $55 per night, including taxes. We had read reviews and booked a "tower room", and not one of the low-lying ones down the back. That was a good decision! We really liked our room. Spacious, little kitchenette with fridge, coffee maker and microwave, sizeable bathroom, and all the things you otherwise expect (flatscreen, wifi, etc.). We requested a higher floor, and had great views over the attractions further away. Fireworks in plain sight was great. Ample parking, huge lobby and restaurants/bars on the premises or close by. We were happy to've picked a higher floor, as in the evening there would be Karaoke sessions, which were quite loud. You would probably hear them on the 1st or 2nd floor rooms.... A lady in the lobby (the "concierge") sells your cheaper theme park tickets, but in order to get them, you have to go through a gruelling 3 hour time share presentation at a nearby property (Westgate resort, also owner of the Ramada, funnily enough), which was said not to take more than 90 minutes...... Yeah right, Big mistake from us Dutch people, looking for a bargain. We saved over $200 on 4 parks, but in the end I'd rather pay up...... Apart from that, no major dramas. We enjoyed our stay, and actually booked another night, as we "were not done yet" with the theme stuff...... Oh, and as usual (I wrote about that before): the airconditioners in the States are made out of jet engines. They generate lots of noise..... At least you cannot hear people talk in the hallway anymore!

Reviews.Title: “bad experince”
Reviews.Author: Tracy M
Reviews.Content: First of all, I booked this trip with Special T Travel 407-396-4400 for the days of 3/22/2012- 3/25/2012 and i paid $167.00. I arrived at the Ramada where they put me in a room that was horrible. I went down to purchase another room to upgrade which was twenty dollars a night. I had to call a maintence man because the toliet was stopped up. The first time the maintence man came he brought a plugger to unstop the toliet which didn't work. Then after the second time it was fixed. After I experience with the room, I had to sit threw a hour and a half of them trying to sell me a timeshare. I will never come back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Book at your own risk-could be great or could be awful! We experienced both.”
Reviews.Author: Madmaam
Reviews.Content: My son and husband were traveling over spring break as part of a group and a stay at this hotel was on their agenda. My daughter and I were traveling separately and planned to meet up with the group there. I booked a Deluxe Tower room two months before our anticipated stay. We got to the hotel about 10:30pm and upon check in we were told that two entire floors of the tower had been shut down due to an electrical problem; there were no tower rooms available and they would have to put us in the older motel-style rooms. They "graciously" took $10 off the price of the standard room. I told them I didn't want to be placed where people would be walking by the rooms all night (each room has a very large window and the doors open onto the exterior walk-way). She put us on the second floor, facing the pool and told me it would be quiet because there were lots of empty rooms down the hall. When my husband and his group arrived, I found out all their rooms were in the Tower part. We walked over and rode the elevator to every floor. There was power and people on all floors. We also saw people, not with their group, coming in with suitcases, like they had just checked in. I went back to the desk and there was a different attendant there. I expressed my displeasure and told him what the first person had told us about two floors being closed. He said that she had "misspoken" (read: lied), that they had electrical problems but only in a few rooms and no, they couldn't move us that night, but to check back in the morning with the morning manager on duty and see what he could do. He gave us free breakfast vouchers for our stay. We went back to the room and I went online (with my 3G, could never find the WiFi). I pulled up the hotel reservations and the "deal" they gave me was actually $15 more per night than the advertised AAA rate, which was how I booked the first room. Also, it showed they were sold out. I think they overbooked and since I arrived late at night, I got whatever they had left. That night was the worst I've ever had in a hotel. I'm no prude or diva when it comes to the furnishings, etc. The room was rundown and a little musty smelling, but it was clean. The shower ran hot and the TV worked. However, the beds were awful-would have been more comfortable on the floor, the air conditioner blew forcefully and directly on my bed closest to the door, but if you turned the air off, you could hear everything in the adjacent rooms. Our neighbors came in after us. It was the middle of the night by then and they stood on the walkway outside our room smoking, talking loudly and banging on the metal railing. Their baby was crying for a long time. I called the desk and they had to send someone to shut them up. There were also people walking in front of our room and because of the large window and no insulation, you could hear everything. Neither my daughter or I slept all night. The next morning we went back to the desk and I talked to a third person about the situation and was basically told that it didn't matter that I had a reservation for a Tower room, that the reservations really meant nothing other than confirmation that you'll have some kind of room! Wow! This totally shocked me that he admitted that. When we realized that my husband's room had a king bed and a pull-out that could accommodate us, we told the desk we would be checking out early due to dissatisfaction with the room and moved into his room. Fortunately, they checked us out with no argument, but also showed little concern over our poor experience the previous night. The breakfast buffet was average. The pool looked nice, but we were gone during the day when it was open, so we never used it. Great proximity to the parks. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Guillermo L
Reviews.Content: My familiy and I have visited in several opportunities this hotel in this year, and the services of DARIO a Front Desk Assistant has been very kind and special. All his recommendations have been very good, he is a person who takes care and make feel very comfortable the clients. He is a very good representative of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here”
Reviews.Author: Kaye R
Reviews.Content: Do you ever go to a resturant and the owner comes by, I love that..Well, at this hotel, I saw the manager several times, at the pool, at breakfast, at the desk. And he was very nice. His name was Andrew Schiabone..When I checked in, there was a man who was talking to him really nasty when I walked up to the counter. He yelled and the manager asked him to see any form of confirmation on the room he insisted he booked.He had no paper or nothing. This man got very ugly at the manager and the entire time, the manager stood there and let him yell, and he tried in vain to make him happy. But there was no pleasing this man at all.I was very impressed at how this manager conducted the entire meeting of words. My husband and I stayed 7 nights and the service was perfect, rooms were great, and the food was good too..Everything was close by as well..We will go back for sure The price was great too..K.Reheiser

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Stay....Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Younger_Traveler27
Reviews.Content: First of all, we "won" this trip to Orlando and the Ramada Gateway was the hotel we apparently "won" a stay at.....Our room was directly on the parking lot toward the front desk area of the hotel. We were in the older motel looking part on the first floor. I'm not sure if the rooms in the tower of the hotel are better but the older motel style rooms are bad....Old decor, carpet, and finishings. I don't think there's any insulation in the walls because we could hear every single car or person going by our room at all hours of the night! Also, the people above us doing what people do in hotel rooms :) We asked for an extra blanket and were told by the front desk it would be there in 10 minutes. After an hour of waiting I personally walked to the front desk to see if I could just grab an extra blanket. Nope....I was told they don't have a key for the closet and I would have to wait for the security guard to bring it. Eventually it did come about 20 minutes after I returned to the room. It rained one day (luckily it was our last day) and water was dripping down in the ceiling onto our bathroom light...doesn't seem to safe. The cafe/deli are was ok...good chicken wrap. We bought a good looking pudding cup from the fridge and it had mold in it.....we didn't eat at the cafe/hotel anymore :) I felt bad for the lady working the counter. She was really nice and the best part about this place. WiFi in the lobby only. I know I won't return to this place.....

Reviews.Title: “OK not great Do not pay much for this place”
Reviews.Author: mmemichele
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be sold CHEAP .Basically NO SERVICE .Rooms are a little ...a lot faded but it is quiet You will be given a map to find your room and to shlep your luggage .Note no elevator so if you have luggage stay downstairs .Not too many restaurants around ...we did not rent a car There is a shuttle to main attraction ...1 PER DAY Ours was at 7;55 OUCH ...why so early but we did use it to SEAWORLD WE did enjoy Orlando just the same.Do not pay much for this place It does Not deseve 3 stars ...more like 1 but it is adequate as sleeping quarters ..a little too musty for me

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Fond du Lac, Wisconsin, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great customer service but need to update rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jamie W
Reviews.Content: I was very worried about staying here with my family after i read reviews on the hotel (Read these a few days prior, booked through expedia and stayed for the great price) but I was happy not to run into any major problems. We had 2 rooms that faced the parking lot and we were given the choice of ground level or first story. In one of our rooms we had issues with the toilet not flushing right. But it was minor in my opinion. We had no problems with bugs, housekeeping, or any smells. My family drove from WI and had to stay an extra day because of the severe weather that was hitting the mid west the were very accommodating through out the situation. I will stay here again. People need to remember you are not staying in a 4or 5 star hotel so its not going to be perfect. I would hope in the future the add a continetail breakfast and start updating the rooms a bit. For the price I paid me and my family were happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great except for smell”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer E
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for a few days to go to Disneyworld and Universal Studios. They let us check in early at 10am which was really nice. After looking at the reviews on this website we decided to go with a Tower room, the room was very clean, but the bathroom had a weird sewage smell. We weren't in the room enough to really care about it but it was definitely annoying. When checking out, we heard other guests express the same problem in their rooms. One thing I want to tell people going is that the shuttle to and from the Disneyworld parks is NOT continuous, they have one pick up time in the morning and then traveled to a few other hotels before heading to the parks, and then a late night pick up time. But once you are at the parks it's easy enough to travel by bus or monorail to the other parks, so plan on being there ALL day. Staff was friendly and we had no other problems.

Reviews.Title: “Yet again Amazing visit,”
Reviews.Author: janie0032
Reviews.Content: Returned home today from a 2 week stay, This time we stayed in a Tower Room overlooking Disney When we arrived the check in was simple and the room was clean and well presented very impressed with the Towel Swans on the bed, Its little touches that make holidays special. The Wifi in the rooms was quick and great, The beds were huge and comfy, The small kitchen area was great as it gave us a chance to make our own lunch when back from the parks for a rest, I have never seen so many towels in one room, each day they were changed and the rooms cleaned, We ate in the restaurant for an evening meal and breakfast on a few occasions and the food was great, Just wish they had Eggs Benidict on the menu, The pool area was clean and tidy and the grounds very well kept. The gift shop is a bonus as sells Disney products at a much reduced rate. I cannot understand some of the comments on here, about this hotel, We did have one mall problem which when reported to the Hotel manager it was dealt with promptly. I will be back and will be recommending this Hotel to friends,

Reviews.Title: “Waiting on us to arrive”
Reviews.Author: Chris C
Reviews.Content: When we stay here Feb 2012, my husband was having a hard time unlocking our door. So we got back in the car went by up to the front desk he explained the problem and was told someone would be there to help in a few minutes. When we drove back to our room I did not expect for maintance to be there waiting on us to help us. He got us into our room no problem (my husband had the card turned the wrong way "user error" lol). Everyone was nice and a lot of place for the fam to just hang out. Rooms were clean, not up to date but clean and worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: JulesScotland
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home after a 10 day stay in this hotel. Pool view room on upper floor was more than adequate (some of the furniture and fittings were past their best BUT were spotless) - housekeeping did a great job every day. The beds were comfortable and the towels were plentiful and fluffy. Wi-fi in our room was very temperamental in comparison to our last visit 9 months ago when it worked perfectly every day. The pool was busy in the evenings and could be noisy but that's to be expected when kids are having fun. Love the location and the grounds were pretty. Security on duty at gatehouse on entering hotel car park. For the price we paid we were happy with the service provided and I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A lot better than I anticipated”
Reviews.Author: Missy J
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews here, I wasn't expecting much when I got to the Ramada but I had to write this review because it was actually better than I thought. My friend and I arrived about 10pm at night and when we checked in, we had to wait for about 15-20 minutes whilst they tried to locate our booking. We had booked through British Airways so maybe there was a hitch in the records, but this wasn't great after a long transatlantic flight. After the wait we were given our keys and then we went to our room. The room was in the older part of the hotel which is the motel part, but it was actually quite ok. It was clean and huge with two big double beds, I've never seen twin beds that huge. The beds and pillows were comfy. Towels, Shower caps, Shampoo, Bar Soaps, Conditioner and Lotion were provided and replaced/changed daily. Rooms were cleaned thoroughly daily so definitely no complaints from me. We had a coffee maker, fridge and an old style TV which had 26 channels, not sure if they all worked…but one of them gives information about Disney all day (pretty helpful if you are planning a trip there). I believe some rooms have microwaves but we didnt have one.There was plenty of free parking which was good because we had hired a car. (Make sure you get a display ticket when you check in) We ate breakfast in the restaurant and opted for the $9.99 buffet which was ok consisting of hot and cold drinks, fruits, scrambled eggs, streaky bacon, pancakes(shop bought), scones, toast, small sausages, cereals and porridge, made to order waffles and omelettes. Some days the breakfast was better than others. Gratuity is included automatically in the bill so for two people you end up paying about $24. Staff were friendly and willing to help. Lovely pool area but never got to use it as we were out all the time. There are lots of good restaurants along the 192…Kobe (Japanese) and Sizzlers in particular were very good. Internet was only available in the foyer for us since we were not in the Tower rooms. Only small complaints….walls are a bit thin and we could hear people talking late at night on our first night, secondly the fridge in our room made a humming noise which can be annoying if you are a light sleeper but after the first day I hardly ever noticed it. Overally great value for money hotel, would stay there again and possibly try the tower rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: penny p
Reviews.Content: First time to stay. Will came again next year. Good value. Easy, friendly check in and out. Beautiful courtyards. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Linda S
Reviews.Content: We ended up here after our first hotel choice was terrible...Natalie (sp?) was awesome at the front desk helping us get a room. She gave us one with a view facing Disney so we could see the fireworks. The room was so nice...the bed was comfy...the refrigerator was terrific...nothing like having a cold bottle or water, etc. I can't say enough good things about this hotel and the staff. We would definitely stay here again when visiting the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously planning to stay here?..go ahead ENJOY!”
Reviews.Author: KermitFroggyStyle
Reviews.Content: Holidays in Orlando can be pretty amazing, especially spending a few days at one of my all-time favourite places..Walt Disney World. BUT...luckily my holiday wasn't ruined by this hotel, which was such an experience that after just one night, I stayed elsewhere! This all seems good for budget accomodation, but believe me I would rather be 'ripped off' by Disney which infact isn't true considering this attrocious excuse for accomodation. First off.. the staff are unbelievably rude, after leaving me to wait 25 minutes at the reception, they respond with a nasty attitude Yet again I will be negative...the room service DOES NOT clean your room....hence why our room quite filthy! At night all you can hear is constant noise, so bad that our neibouring rooms along with us all complained, but not without rude responces! Suddenly...just before we were about to go shopping, my friend spotted a cockroach..YES A COCKROACH and at that we checked out immediately! If you think you are saving money..THINK AGAIN....you are ruining a potentially fantastic holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location & service”
Reviews.Author: Jackie N
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed here for 2 weeks. It was great! The complimentary shuttle service to Disney, Universal, and Seaworld made it extremely convenient to get to the parks during our stay. They offered multiple shuttle times in the morning to go to Disneyworld and had several return times as well. The rooms were clean and front desk staff was very friendly. We were only in the room for relaxing after a fun day at the park and resting and for that, the hotel served its purpose. Really enjoyed the great location & value of the hotel. We didn't stay in the "tower" but I imagine, it could be just as great if not better.

Reviews.Title: “Great price great location”
Reviews.Author: marc291
Reviews.Content: Just stayed a week in this hotel. A little intimidated on first arrival but soon relaxed. The hotel has two areas a tower and motel style rooms. I stayed in the cheaper motel rooms. When booking I was offered a free upgrade I thought this meant to the tower but no was just to a pool view rather than a parking view, pros and cons with each the pool side can get noisy so if you want peace parking rooms better also if you have a car great to be able to drive right up to your room, The rooms quite large two double beds air con and flat screen tv. Coffee maker and basic bathroom with shower. Note wifi not in all rooms do ask for a wifi room if you need this or access by pool, courtyard and loby all free and fast. I must say the cleaners do a great job here the room was spotless and cleaned every day. Although a basic hotel the cleaning standards in the room were excellent! Shuttle service to all parks and outlet shops all free limited times but works well. And saves a fortune on car hire parking and taxis. Nothing much in the area other than quick service buffet restaurants a few discount shops etc. I would stay here again as a great stop for Disney. The hotel is great base for exploring, if your looking for a luxury resort to chill in for a week this is not the product on offer here! But does a great job as a Place to sleep after a days fun at the parks and attraction. Finally value for money is excellent we paid less that £20 a night. The free shuttles alone paid for this (last time in Orlando we paid £9 a day each for shuttles!)

Reviews.Title: “Affordable hotel that is conveniently situated.”
Reviews.Author: LeonKay
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to the area and we found this to be the best hotel we have stayed at. Our check-in at reception was prompt and handled in a friendly way. We found our room to be spacious, neat and clean. The heated swimming pool as well as the surrounding area and gardens are well maintained. We found the maintenance response also good when we reported a faulty tap. (faucet, I think is what the Americans call it!) The complimentary shuttle service provided to the Disney parks was very efficient. The front desk staff were very also very attentive to our needs. They offered Disney 5 day park hopper tickets at a cheaper rate than the Disney gate price. We did not make use of their dining facilities as it is just a short walk down the road to Ponderosa, that offers an incredible buffet breakfast for $4.99 Just past Ponderosa one can enjoy a fantastic buffet dinner that includes a decent size steak for $8.99 at Sizzlers. There are also several factory shops within walking distance where you can enjoy good shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel , nice price”
Reviews.Author: RAULTAIB
Reviews.Content: Its the second , to estay here in diferent year , but this hotel need a remodelation nearly , i estay in the tower , i prefer this ones, microweare and mini frigidare, the rooms ist good, free internet not breakfast incluid thas for the price in other same hotels in Usa incluided for exaple (fresno, LA,S fco.)

Reviews.Title: “UPGRADE TO TOWER ROOMS”
Reviews.Author: XPSmith
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Florida for first time in mid-february. Got a reasonable deal through BA for this hotel so arrived there fairly open minded about what to expect. ** Don't take too much notice to the comments saying its disgusting/terrible as it certainly wasn't. It is a perfectly fine hotel, but in need of refurbishment. Some people obviously expect the finest accommodation for a reasonable price.. We had paid for the basic motel-style room overlooking the parking area. However, we asked for an upgrade (free) when we arrived, which meant we were instead looking over the pool. When we got to our room we were not overlooking the pool, but the courtyard area which is undercover. This meant the rooms were very dark inside as no daylight was getting in. We opened the door to the room to be smacked in the face with a very pungent smell of damp. Therefore, we insisted on moving to the Tower rooms (an extra $16 per room a night!!!). Couldn't really find a fault with the rest of our 2 week stay. The rooms were cleaned every day and fresh towels were left daily. Staff were very pleasant. The hotel restaurant was good, but wouldn't recommend getting the breakfast buffet for $9.95. You would be much wiser walking a short distance down the road to Ponderosa for a much cheaper and larger range of food to choose from. If i go back to Florida i would happily stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: farky
Reviews.Content: When we arrived here we were allocated a room round the back of the hotel on the ground level which opened out directly onto the walkway and car park, this was not acceptable so we went to reception and asked for a room change. The new room we were given was fantastic, it was on th 7th floor in the tower part of the hotel and overlooked the main road and disney parks so we saw the fireworks every night. The room had 2 king size beds in it as well as a microwave, fridge freezer and kitchen sink. The en suite was nice with an over bath shower. The staff were great, the reception staff are so helpfull, nothing is too much trouble. There is also a security guard on the gate and every night we came back he always gave us a wave and a smile. Will definitely book again

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: poulins85131
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff are friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean. They are a little rundown but they are good for the price. It is a good budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “thanks”
Reviews.Author: Jason V
Reviews.Content: natalie and reinaldo at the hotel were great helped us out and made our stay great will be back for sure

Reviews.Title: “4th stay”
Reviews.Author: jerry b
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 4 times over the past few years and will be staying again. It is an inexpensive hotel with nice facilities. The front end staff always went out of their way to be of assistance. In fact, I can not say enough good things about the front end staff that I have spoken with. That being said, we have run into issues with the maid staff & have a family game called "Maid Roulette" in which we try to guess upon returning to the room what, if anything has been omitted by the maid staff. Sometimes it is a towel set, soap, or shampoo. I understand that they are busy but...I recommend that if you stay here you do so with your eyes open. As the old saying goes "you get what you pay for". In this case, I can put up with the inconvenience of a missing towel or soap in exchange for the nice facility, great staff & inexpensive price.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ana Claudia C
Reviews.Content: Great location ( next to Disney, Premium outlet Vineland), great service and very polite people. We have gotten grate taxes also, call Reinaldo Alvarez, he is a great, handsome and efficient manager, and he will certainly help you with everything you need. The room was huge, clean and the bed was awesome! Hope you enjoy too!!! Bye Ana e Alex from Brazil

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, great for Disney World trip”
Reviews.Author: nworock
Reviews.Content: Booked here as it's an inexpensive hotel with decent reviews, and it was pretty much exactly what we were hoping for. First off, biggest positive is the location. Unless you're staying in the Disney World resort area, don't think there's any hotels closer to the parks than this. Really quick drive to any of the parking lots. Room was fine. Tiles in the bathroom were a little oldish and the white color was getting a little dirty looking, but really, overall (especially for the price) it was fine. Beds were comfy and clean. We booked in the Tower to get WiFi and the connection was really good, no issues there. Can't really think of anything else to say. Wouldn't expect a luxury resort if you're booking, but if you're on a budget going to Disney World, can't recommend it more!

Reviews.Title: “A+”
Reviews.Author: slashdotjeo
Reviews.Content: After a disappointing experience at a local very popular 2-star hotel with cockroach filled rooms and a shower head that flew across the bathroom and knocked me on the head I decided to upgrade my stay on this vacation. I tried the Ramada Gateway and... OMG! Firstly they have courteous, friendly, well spoken hotel staff. Secondly I had booked my room online but checked in late and there were no more value rooms. so guess what ? my room was upgraded I had a fridge, a microwave and I got to stay in one of the deluxe rooms in the main building and all this with no hassle.This is the place to stay with kids. You dont spend much and the area was great. Ramada Gateway I will surely be staying here again. Special thanks to Reinaldo Alvarez and Natalie for making my family's vacation a special one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Extended Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kristina V
Reviews.Content: My husband and his Mom and myself stayed here recently for 19 nights in the older, motel section, of the hotel. We have stayed both on and off Disney property for many visits to the Orlando area and found this to be unbeatable for the value. Our room was plenty big enough for the three of us to spread out all our stuff, comfortable big beds, two very nice pool areas and a lovely courtyard that we sat out in and enjoyed coffee many times. Restaurant is okay, but the take out place was the best!!! Any staff that I encountered, from front desk to food service to housekeeping was extremely nice and friendly and helpfull. We were even, at arrival, given an upgrade from parking view to pool view and that was awesome. We arrived a full day early due to trying to beat weather here in the northeast and they were great about putting us in the same room so we wouldn't have to change the next day. Can't beat how close to Disney it is!!!!!!!! Dunkin Donuts nearby. Not far to anything you need such as a WalMart or Target or Publix. If we don't end up moving to Florida in the next 6 months like we'd like to, we'd end up staying here again for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “No internet in rooms.”
Reviews.Author: tbgbcga
Reviews.Content: Just checked in . So far, so good, except for the fact that the advertised "internet available throughout the hotel" is only available in the lobby. Not so good when you require the internet for work.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Deanna D
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel that was conveniently located to Disney World. The only lackluster part was the food at the hotel. The hotel was clean and the staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: yolajack
Reviews.Content: For the cost that I paid to stay here, I wasn't expecting a 4 or 5-star quality. I was only interested in having somewhere to sleep for a few nights. However there were a lot of maintenance issues that should be addressed at any hotel. It took 30 minutes for the iron to turn on, and once it did, it clicked and popped! I called the front desk and they brought another iron and they brought another one almost immediately, but it did not work any better. There was black moldy looking stuff on the walls of the bathroom. The faucet dripped profusely. Plugs would not stay in the power sockets - they kept falling out. The heater was very loud and had a strange smell that gave me a headache. There was a creepy spider hanging from the ceiling over the toilet that almost landed on my nose! Please don't let the picture of the hotel fool you. Right behind the "tower" rooms, are rooms that look more like a cheap motel, which is where my room was located. People were constantly talking, running, laughing outside my door throughout the night, and the flooring outside is tiled, so every time someone rolls their luggage to and from their rooms, it makes a horribly loud noise - all hours of the night! So if you are just looking for somewhere to sleep at night without all the bells and whistles, I still would NOT recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca B
Reviews.Content: The rooms were dirty and poor maintance. The room we were staying in had a broken air conditioner which was not noticed until we woke up in the middle of the night covered in sweat. After calling the front desk they brought us a key to another room. I was traveling alone with 3 children. They did not bothered to help me move our things to the next room. They did not offer a discount or an appology. After getting to the new room the TV was older and the room was smaller. To me that is a downgrade. They only offered complimentary breakfast for 2 to fix the problem. First of all, we were a party of 4. Secondly, why would I want to eat at such a dirty hotel. I know it was a cheap hotel but can't you at least do routine maintance or clean?

Reviews.Title: “Awful, awful, awful! Makes Motel 6 look like the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: grandmahenry
Reviews.Content: Awful. Dreadful. Dirty. Gross. Disgusting. Need I say more. Hotel room 1 was a 1980's cheap motel room that smelled and that we couldn't stay in because the tub was being fixed. Hotel room 2 was the same but had a broken security lock which they came and fized immediately. After the repair we turned down the bed and found mouse poop in the bed!!! I picked it up and went to the front desk (who were not overly concerned). I asked for a got an "upgrade", which was the same room with a view of the pool. The lamps were mismatched, the bathroom door had no striker plate for the lock, it was dirty, chipped furniture, stained carpet! My husband and I slept on the bed in our clothes and checked out the next morning - 6 days early! We were not even asked why we were checking out, they obviously didn't care. We have contacted both Ramada and American Airlines Vacations about rating this a 3 star hotel and are waiting for a response. We recommend avoiding this place like the plague. We have numerous photos, far too many to publish and none good!

Reviews.Title: “For the budget minded!”
Reviews.Author: foodfreakftmyers
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the price of this hotel, but just keep in mind - you get what you pay for. If you're going to be gone all day and just need somewhere to sleep, then this place will suffice. As soon as we opened the door, we detected the musty smell of the room. On the negative side, the bathroom faucet needed to be turned tight to keep from dripping, the knob fell off the lamp on the nightstand, there was an old tv (not flat screen) so picture quality wasn't what we were used to, and the bed was hard. On the positive side, the room was huge. We had a king bed, but it could have fit two queens easily. There was a small refrigerator and the usual table and two chairs. The shower was very good (nice shower head), and there was central air (no noisy wall unit). We had a nice view of the pool from the second floor. There was a restaurant in the lobby and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. The location is great; close to Disney attractions, restaurants, gift shops, etc. This is a great place if you just need somewhere to sleep and won't be spending much time there. Bottom line, the place needs some serious updating but is a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “About what I expected”
Reviews.Author: GraceMary72
Reviews.Content: The lobby is clean and attractive, the staff is pleasant and helpful. We asked to see a room and our request was immediately granted. The rooms are older, but we found them clean. The mattress was comfortable. We took an outside room rather than an atrium. We found it better and the chlorine smell from the pool was absent. The front desk accepted our traveler's discount coupon and would honor it for two nights. This resulted in a cost of a little over $49.00 a night, tax, and all those other extras included. Would we stay there again? Yes. For one or two nights it is fine and the location to food, etc is within walking distance, and we liked that.

Reviews.Title: “Second time around and want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: djw0105
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here last year in a tower room, I was excited to return. Found a great deal and booked for a week's vacation. This time we stayed in Pool view room...actually it looked onto the courtyard and there was some coming and going, but not that noisy and everything settled down by 10 a.m. Rooms were comfortable, cleaned daily and staff very friendly and helpful. I really can't find fault with the Ramada Gateway. Free shuttles to the parks every day arriving in time for opening. We didn't eat there this time around, and unfortunately the Black Angus Steakhouse next door was closed for refurbishment, but there are so many places to eat nearby, it didn't really matter. This is a great location and I look forward to coming back soon!

Reviews.Title: “The Best for your money!”
Reviews.Author: Mayra C
Reviews.Content: my family and i were there and i have to say that i was very surprise by the way we were treated, the service felt like a 5 star hotel, very clean (1st time that i see a bathroom so clean in a hotel) and neat and smell free :8) Edmundo Delgado was very nice and Raymundo too (i dnt remember his last name). i will stay there everytime i'll go to orlando!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible !!! Never again !!!!”
Reviews.Author: natalie b
Reviews.Content: I am usually very easy going.. this was the worst experience ever !!! people at the people at 7 am .. loud and acting crazy !!! Racoons in front of the room in the trash can , went to the frint desk .. Jennifer (clerk) says : u really do not want to move becuase of a racoon r u ?? i am like really .. !!!! She still wanted me to pay 20 $ for an upgrade.. Depsite the fact, all old appliances, bed is so stiff, everything is worn out .. The only good this is the location ! The only good thing is the location ..

Reviews.Title: “OK if it's only one night...”
Reviews.Author: MrsEggs2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and that was too many. We were in the motel part and near a boiler room, which made it very loud. The room was not very well maintained and it did not seem very clean to me. Some of the lights did not work right. The tv does not get very many channels. From my experience the only good thing about this place is the location and the price. It's a five minute or less drive to all the disney and universal parks, but of course you get what you pay for. There's also free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if booked for the right price.”
Reviews.Author: Muriel S
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went to Orlando and stayed at this hotel for Christmas break and New Years. The only negative aspects were; small queen beds and no wifi in the standard rooms. If attending this hotel, stay in the tower.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New Jersey in the shadow of GWB
Reviews.Title: “The Real Retro”
Reviews.Author: ren1hoek
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in the motel part. This is the real retro. I expected to wake up and pull back the curtains and see Vista Cruisers and Ford Granadas in the parking lot. Beds were comfortable. I had no problem with hot water like another reviewer. The place is bigger than expected, The two level motel parts are laid together making two courtyards, with two pools. If you are expecting a Westin or even Hampton Inn experience, this is not it. The bedspreads are ugly, the carpet can be buckled, the tile may not line up perfectly, but for a comfortable bed, a drive-up motel room, and the possibility of catching Legionaires, this is the place. I will be back for a $45 night!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: b00zysusie
Reviews.Content: We were at the Ramada for 15 days at the beginning of January 2012. We had rooms in the tower which are bigger, cleaner and better equipped than the older motel-style rooms by the pool. Pool and surrounding area well-kept and the water is heated so pool is usable even in January! The hotel is literally 1 mile away from Disney parks and free transport is available, although the timings are not terribly convenient. For me the only downside was the reception staff - totally ignorant and downright rude at times - the only good point being that safety deposit boxes are free of charge!

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is.”
Reviews.Author: Dave C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ramada for 5 nights in the beggining of Jan. '12 for the Disney Marathon. We stayed in the older rooms by the pool and not in the tower. First the good... -Great location -Nice clean room -Good price -The restaraunt/bar staff were very friendly Now the Bad... -Don't stay here if you like hot showers! We had lukewarm water all but one day when we had hot water for one shower only. I guess you have to beat everyone else to the shower. -The web site says free wifi but they do not mention that it is in lobby only if you are in the old section. From reading other reviews we were expecting this. -The front desk people are rude and do not care if you have a problem. -Food in the restaraunt was sub-par, eat somewhere else. Over all the stay was acceptable because we did not spend too much time at the hotel and it saved us a lot of money to spend at the parks. However, I do not think we will stay here again unless we try the tower rooms. I value having a good hot shower at the end of a long day. I don't expect much from a cheap hotel but hot water is a must.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Alana D
Reviews.Content: The Ramada Gateway was an affordable price, had great customer service, and is situated in an excellent location. It is very close to the Disney parks and is only a 15 minute drive from Universal/Islands of Adventure where my friends and I were visiting. The rooms were clean and the beds were extremely comfortable. Our room came with a nice flat screen TV as well as a nice sized mini fridge to store drinks and food for our trip. Rooms also have free wi-fi which is a huge plus in my opinion. Overall a great place to stay!! I will definitely go back the next time I visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: winegen
Reviews.Content: Across the street from Disney and easy on and off from I 4. The back lower section is an older style motel, rooms around the pool. It was cool when I was there but the music was still on at the pool and I can see where it might be a bit noisy at times. The wi-fi in the room only worked for a few hours then said it was connected but no internet service. Food, drinks(expensive), and service was good. We had to ask for breakfast discount tickets. Overall, it would be a good home base for a family going to disney.

Reviews.Title: “It served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: jenster68
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Ramada Gateway for 7 nights from 26 December. We did not stay in a Tower Room so our room was facing the car park. The room was spacious but there was no ventilation and so smelt very musty, Each time we entered the room we had to leave the door open for a while to get some fresh air in. The beds were comfortable but the pillows needed replacing as they were worn out and limp! The carpet definitely needed replacing and I did not feel comfortable walking on it in bare feet - it was a bit sticky! The bathroom was OK but I didnt like the fact that the fridge was in the bathroom. The TV worked fine. We had trouble getting the lamps to work properly as the plugs were very loose in the sockets. Another negative was that we did not get wifi from this room and we would have liked a safety deposit box in the room too. We didnt really make use of any of the facilities at the hotel as we were purely using the room as a base for our Orlando experience. We did have the buffet breakfast the first day but were not overly impressed and found we could better quality and cheaper just down the road at Dennys. The Reception staff were polte and helpful. The main advantage of this accommodation is its location. So close to the Disney parks and the I4. There were lots of restaurants nearby and within walking distance too. We paid a very low price to stay at the Ramada Gateway and so our expectations were not set too high. Would we stay here again? We would if it were just to sleep but if we wanted to spend more time at our accommodation and relax we would probably upgrade to a more luxurious alternative. Tip for the hotel: Please renovate the non-Tower rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: WarmVacations
Reviews.Content: I am writing from my room on Jan 11th, so this review is live. I am here attending a 5 day conference at a nearby resort, and wanted to save money. I booked this with Southwest Airline and got a great deal. Sometimes you get what you pay for. Not in this case. Here's why... The good things.. GREAT location near the Magic Kingdom entrance, lots of restaurants nearby, easy access to highways, and they have a very, very nice staff. I stopped dropping names due to concern for them, but the front staff and the breakfast staff are nice, friendly, and helpful. You can get a USAToday with Breakfast for free, and my room in the 300's section was VERY quiet. The maid service kept the room clean and did not touch my stuff. It has two pools and can handle kids easily. For those on a tight budget, this place has great value. It is a bit huge in that there are over 400 rooms by my calculation, but you don't feel it walking around. Some rooms are two story outside door entrance, and they also have a 8 floor tower for more money. Since I had a first floor outside room in the back, I was near an ice machine, and I could park my car 4 feet from my door. Speaking of Parking, a number of hotels charge to park in their parking lot, even if you pay to stay! This hotel does not, so you can save even more money with their free parking! Also, the entrance is gate guarded, so people can't just enter the location, unless you have a room or are checking in. Now for the bad.. if you are a light sleeper, do not take a room pool side as the music stays on loud and clear until 10p. The facility is old, and the walls porous for noise. You can hear people talk next door, or hear them walk down the sidewalk past my room outside; especially if you take a room pool side. Being in the back dropped the noise and traffic immensely. When I checked in they put me in the 100's area and asked to be moved to the 300's.. and the staff were great and supportive. Upon getting ready for bed, I laid out my towels, only to find big bugs jump out of the bath floor towel and a face towel. The front desk offered to move my room but I stayed and asked for clean towels for all areas. That was 3 days ago, and no bugs since. After much thought, I am finding many locations are designed this way, outside doors, where the cleaning person leaves the towels and doors open for bugs to come it. So, if you want a inexpensive room, you must accept this as happening. Or you can go to another hotel for twice the price, and pay for parking. My two female colleagues were aghast and would have demanded changes. But they stayed in plush hotels and more than twice what I paid. I did not demand anything and I am okay. There are not bedbugs here. Speaking of Beds, the mattresses are hard and not soft. I had a solid bed, and no shaking.

Reviews.Title: “Value Hotel - Close To Disney”
Reviews.Author: Dave34705
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights from January 3, 2012 to January 6. The main attraction for this hotel is the fact that it is located on Highway 192 just several minutes drive from the Disney World gates. This makes travel to and from the Disney Theme parks a short and easy drive. The hotel is basically divided into two different types of accomodation. First, inside access "tower rooms" and second, a grouping a two story buildings with rooms either facing the parking lots or the courtyard pool area. These rooms have outside access. I stayed in a non-tower room facing the courtyard. The room was value priced at $43.00 per night plus tax. Upon entering the room there was a definite strong cleaner/bleach smell - but the room was clean. The bed was comfortable with decent linens and the towels in the bathroom were thick and fluffy. The non-tower rooms are older but my room was very spacious with a table and chairs to work or eat. WiFi is only available in the tower rooms or in the hotel large lobby area. I asked for a room closest to the tower/lobby area and had no trouble connecting to the internet. I was surprised by finding a more up-dated flat screen TV however there was no microwave and the cube style mini-fridge was located in the bathroom area. Many hotel amenities were available including gift shop, fast service deli, and full service restaurant. I appreciated being able to get a fast start to Disney in the morning by ordering from the ala-carte breakfast menu and receiving very quick service. There is also a $9.95 breakfast buffet with a station for custom omletts. This was too much food for me in the morning! Over all this is a decent value priced hotel - close to many eating places - and has an excellent location for a very short drive to the Disney Parks.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Drew E
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Ramada Gateway before and had a good experience. That's why I booked with them again. I booked my reservation through Travelocity. Upon arrival on december 29, 2011, the staff asked for my credit card to have on file for room damages, etc. This is fairly common practice at hotels, so I obliged. However, my credit card was charged for the room fees a a second time, when I had already paid through Travelocity. I noticed this on my bank statement my first night at the hotel, and had them reverse the charge. Unfortunately it took 9 days for the charge to clear. I was told it would only take 3. This inconvenience caused be to be much more depleted in my spending money for Disney. I stayed in one of the Tower rooms. On the 1st night the wifi did not work at all, although this was later corrected. However the signal is very WEAK. The rooms were clean every day, except my last night in the hotel, where I returned to my room to find that it had been "cleaned." To be honest, it looked more like an 11 year old through the room together very quickly. I checked out of Ramada Gateway being ensured that my money would be returned to me. However, the charge didn't come through until 2 days after I returned home, making the money quite useless for the vacation. The price is good for the rooms, but even with low fare, I still should not be charged my room a 2nd time and wait nearly 10 days to get back. The whole experience? Tolerable. But only just.

Reviews.Title: “Tower rooms were fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: Angie B
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the hotel and im a very picky person. I traveled with my husband and two kids and we loved it!!! We stayed in the tower on an 8th flr.let me start by saying The rooms were very clean, didnt have to worry not one bit.No bed bugs, no mold,no weird bugs in the room. The amenities were great .Microwave was not old and fridge was perfect,TV was a flatscreen Bathrooms were clean as well and towels were always available. We stayed 5 days. Most importantly was the fact that it was super close to Disney which was our reason for the vacay. Everything was so convenient! A plus to the tower was if we came back early we can see the fireworks from all the disney parks from our room.which was fabulous. So do request the view towards the disney parks. I would definately recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Happy vacations with ramada gateway”
Reviews.Author: Rodolfo R
Reviews.Content: Very. Gooooooooood. We been there for 10 days and the service is good the rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable very good price for all they bring make sure to choose the tower rooms because are the best.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Reserved Through Groupon”
Reviews.Author: qmarlene
Reviews.Content: I agree with viator805 GROUPON contract included: FREE Welcome Drink (Beer, Wine, Non-Alcoholic Beverage) FREE Continental Breakfast Buffet (2 adults/2 children) FREE WIFI, Fitness Center, Orlando Attraction Transportation FREE 2pm late check-out THEY DID NOT TELL US ABOUT THE AMENITIES and nether the breakfast was not a continental all it was a bagel/fruts/and a drink that what they told us. The room we checked into had a strong humidity smell, it was horrible but after the second day we got use to it, but in the hallway the smell was more stronger like a convination of an old place and humidity at the same time. My family and I suffer from harsh allergies and asthma. I even have to use my asthma medication because of the smell. The air conditioner at night was not working properly and we where hot. We also decided not to complain but my family and me will never stay in this cheesy hotel. I almost forget that the TV was cheesy too and the channels available where not many. In the other hand we did try the buffet breakfast and it was pretty good for $5 dollars more. But I think if we paid for a GROUPON with continental Breakfast it was because it was include. WIFI What! WIFI what are you talking about, I wasn't able to get no WIFI at all, they were blocking my personal server WIFI access.

Reviews.Title: “Ramada Gateway- a good stay!”
Reviews.Author: mya_myamya
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Ramada Gateway in Kissimee and I really enjoyed it. I went with a friend and our intentions were to choose a nice, clean, safe and economical hotel close to Disney, and this was a last minute choice, however, a good choice. The hotel is pretty big, with tower rooms on one side and rooms overlooking one of their pools on the other. Unfortunately, we didn't get to really venture out into the hotel and look around and see everything they had to offer, because Disney would tire us out and we'd leave early morning and come back late at night. Before staying here, I read the suggestions that the tower is the place to stay, and that's where we did. The room was nice and spacious for two young females. It came equipped with a fridge, microwave and storage space to put groceries; we definitely made use of each. A problem with our room was the ac...it would come on/off when it wanted. Honestly, the hotel was pretty bare. It wasn't really active; we didn't see it thriving with people, but that was fine with us. The only time we'd see a huge amount of people at one time was in the morning, waiting for the shuttle to Disney parks. There was a restaurant, and a diner type of food area, we didn't try either, due to the fact that we had purchased food at the Walmart, enough to last us the 5 days we were there for. The pool area that is overlooked by the pool area rooms was pretty bare-hardly anyone out there. In addition, I wanted to clear up some things that were said in some of the reviews: 1) Walmart and/or Target are not within walking distance, we actually had to drive about 15-20 mins to get to a Walmart. 2) The outlets (international drive) and universal are not close by. 3) We didn't encounter any "sticky fingered" maids, ours were pretty nice. If your intention is to go out to Citywalk every night be prepared to spend around 40$ on a taxi each way from this hotel. All in all the hotel was a great, economical stay, but if you search to have a night life and party it up, this area isn't really the best for that.

Reviews.Title: “You get more than what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: suzitravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ramada Gateway 2 nights last weekend. I am a travel agent but did not tell the front desk until I checked out. I am always looking for lodging properties for my clients- from the budget minded to the luxury properties. When I arrived I was met by a lot guard who checked my reservation. The lobby was inviting and decorated for Christmas. The front desk staff was courteous, professional and I was checked in quickly. The inconvenience occured when I had to go to the concierge to get a parking pass. I basically had no need for her services and had to wait for the current guest to finish talking, which they were in no hurry to end their conversation. I got a room on the first floor of the older section, which is where I wanted to be located. There was relatively little noise except for in the morning when guests were leaving, and this is to be expected. The room had a slight air-freshener odor but it wasn't bad. The most important thing is that the room was CLEAN. I have very high standards and expectations when it concerns cleanliness. The room is older, so there were structual issues like paint and tile & grout that were worn, but as I said before, it was clean. The beds were comfortable and no signs of any bed bugs. The sheets were clean, in good conditiion and fresh. There was a large, flat screen TV. The bathroom is small, but the sink area was separate. The towels were clean and the amenities were stocked. There was coffee and tea available. There was a small mini-fridge. The furnishings are basic. The room rate was very reasonable. The location is great if you are visiting Disney World. There is a variety of restaurants to choose from in the area. I will definitely recommend this property to my clients that are budget minded and I will also choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Magic ...without the expense”
Reviews.Author: janie0032
Reviews.Content: Returned to Gateway for a short visit, Again I cannot fault the service or the rooms, came with a group of friends, All single parents who had a fantastic time, they felt safe, and secure, The hotel were not aware we were a group party, as we wanted no special treats, With 7 children none of them had any bites from bed bugs, or any upset tummys, The staff were helpful, caring, and the restaurant staff very understanding when one of the children went into Disney Meltdown, They came and gave him a Disney Book, and sat and read to him, while we continued eating, This meant so much to his mum. Can I just say thank you to all the Staff, if you want a hotel that is affordable friendly and close to Disney this is it. Oh yes the Dragon by the pool was amazing...a Little boys description of a Baby Lizard.

Reviews.Title: “If you end up in the hospital, this is why!!!”
Reviews.Author: TeenagersMom1315
Reviews.Content: All I have to say is: "bed bugs". Rooms are infested with bed bugs. My children ended up in the emergency room due to the bed bugs rash...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, okay quality”
Reviews.Author: Pete83UK
Reviews.Content: We have been to Orlando several times and tend to stay on I-Drive, but this time we were only going to the Disney Parks so opted for this hotel. The rooms are pretty standard compared with other hotels in the same price bracket and area, reasonably clean and functional. There is a mini-fridge in the room that you dont get everywhere, along with the usual coffee maker etc. There are no safe's in the room, but there are deposit boxes (free) if you ask at reception. Interestingly there did seem to be a lack of lighting in the room, and on occasion a slightly odd smell, but nothing that was too bad. It was slightly noisy (we had a pool view room and whilst the pool wasnt noisy, we were next to a room with some sort of very noisy machinery in there, however this was easily solved by having the a/c on all the time I had no real issues whilst I was there, one day they took one of our personal towels away by mistake, but a quick trip to reception and they had it back with us in around 30 minutes. I do think the quality of this hotel is slightly lower than some others we have stayed in that were around the same cost (Fairfield Inn on I-Drive etc), and the pictures they show you are ones of the refurbished tower rooms, but the location is great and takes around 10 minutes to the Magic Kingdom parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the money”
Reviews.Author: Drew E
Reviews.Content: This review is very late, but as I'm staying here again in the coming weeks, thought I'd go for it, and then review it after my 2nd stay again. I stayed here in January 2010. I got the standard Inn room. Was pretty decent, room, cleaned every day. Basic room, fridge. Only gripe was that internet was in lobby only. If you want wifi in room, you need to upgrade to tower. Anyway, was very pleased with service, especially with the small amount of money it cost. Next time, I'm upgrading to a tower, just for the added amenities/

Reviews.Title: “u get what u pay for”
Reviews.Author: gina15
Reviews.Content: all in all pretty ok...great location. covered parking. free wifi if u stay in the tower. bedding soft and clean..carpet and bathroom so so. well worth the price...oh and the gift shop has great prices this is a must see. hotel staff was great!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: dannyj29
Reviews.Content: i arrived at this hotel on 2nd november for 5 nights. staff very friendly. checked in and headed to my room which was very near reception. the room was nice and clean and had a widescreen tv. pool area was ok although it did get a bit noisy with a convention going on that weekend when trying to sunbath, but that didnt bother me as everyone seemed to be having a nice time. definately need to have a car if you stay at this hotel as its situated on the highway. also i dropped 200$ on the floor of my room by accident and went out of the hotel for a few hours, I came back and the money was still there after the room being cleaned! well done and it goes to show how trusted the cleaning staff are! would stay again if i was in that area.

Reviews.Title: “just right for the parks”
Reviews.Author: karen b
Reviews.Content: just had a week at this hotel this year but it is our 4th stay only a few mins drive to all the disney parks you can walk to shops and great places to eat can get to all the things you would like to visit on the i4 or the 192 hotel clean with all the space you need in a room, pools great staff very helpfull

Reviews.Title: “Brear again”
Reviews.Author: Ferla
Reviews.Content: This is my 5 time in tuia hotel, and all the things still in the same way. Great and location, great price and gole rooms. Good choice for singles and couples.

Reviews.Title: “What do people expect when they want a cheap stay”
Reviews.Author: 910kev
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two weeks in September 2011, when we arrived we were given a room overlooking the car park, absolutely nothing wrong with the room but I thought it would be nice to look onto the pool for two weeks. I approached the reception to be greeted by a young lady, I explained the situation and was greeted with a superb response that they would be happy to give us a room looking out onto the pool. This holiday was a last minute booking and as far as I am concerned it was a very good cheap holiday. We could have paid a lot more but feel the accomodation, location and service wre absolutely fine. The reviews people write when they book a cheap hotel and expect FIVE STAR accomodation need to wake up to the real world and get a life.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but beware”
Reviews.Author: LeaseyLJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ramada Gateway for 14 nights in October. Basic hotel, but clean and tidy. Staff were very poliet and friendly, no room issues at all. The only dissapointing thing was that i noticed 5 days before the end of our holiday that i had a top missing from the draws in the room. We met with the duty manager and security who took a statement and seemed to take the issue seriously. We was told that they would be investigating the matter and would meet with us again before our departure, unfortunatley they did not, they have taken my email, phone number and address so i'm waiting to see if they do respond. Shame as up to the incident we were planning on rebooking for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Our new Disneyworld "home"”
Reviews.Author: Paul S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a Saturday night after spending the day at Disney. Check-in was effortless. We ate dinner in the hotel's restaurant (both had pulled prk platters):, the food and staff were wonderful and cost the same as our mediocre Disney hamburger lunch. We went back for the breakfast buffet - also very good value. The rooms are older and could use some "plussing" (i.e., extra pillows and blankets in the room) but the bathroom is very spacious. What made the stay extra special was the staff. IMO, from the check-in desk personnel to the restaurant staff - Disney of late could take some staff hiring /training lessons from the Ramada Gateway folks. We feel this is a wonderful value and plan to stay here for our monthly Disney/Orlando weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the gateway”
Reviews.Author: rickwal
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice at this hotel, once for 2nights before a cruise and then for 5 nights afterwards, hotel is easy to locate, checkin was a breeze, front desk staff are very, very helpful. we stayed in the motel part of the hotel and both rooms we had were pleasant, clean and tidy, we had thought about upgrading to the tower rooms but decided that we were happy enought where we were. The only downside of our rooms was that we could not pick up the wifi signal but I just took my laptop up near the pool and it picked it up, I only wanted to check flights etc so it wasnt a problem. We did not eat at the hotel but there was the usual eateries just a couple of minutes walk, most days we spent around the pool which was nice and really quiet and just wandered across to the 7/11 for some snacks. For part of this trip we had a car which made it really easy to visit walmart, International drive etc, for the other part we used the local buses, the hotel does provide transport to the parks, the day we went to downtown disney we had to go up to kissimmee oldtown to change buses for disney, just something for people to be aware of, but this is not a big deal with us. Overall, we had a great stay and I would stay here again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: Larry S
Reviews.Content: Love it, can't wait to go again and visit florida too. Love the atmosphere, warmt and friendliness. I would visit again for sure

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, shame about thieving maids!!!”
Reviews.Author: JadeyB_90
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 10 days. Such a lovely hotel, pool is amazing. Friendly staff, close to everything. Come to pack night before we were due to return home, to realise 2 tops were missing!! Security etc informed, found out the maid that cleaned our room that day, was using a different card, a maid that hadnt been working there for a few months!!! Now, having to claim the money back!! Nightmare!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for busy holiday to Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie2317
Reviews.Content: First time here. Rooms spacious and cleaned daily. Good value for the massive room we were allocated. End room so very quiet and relaxing. Perhaps needs some TLC in future years to come as bathroom small but was fine for the 2 of us. Didnt eat in the hotel as we were out most days, same as the pool used once at night to cool off but seemd clean, in good condition and nice to use! Only thing we didn't like was the timeshare reps allowed to set up in the hotel who offer 'cheap disney etc' tickets to guests as soon as they check in. Not something you want to get involved in a be pestered about after travelling for 14hrs :(

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mary1703
Reviews.Content: After reading previous reviews we were somewhat concerned about the hotel! We arrived and instantly impressed by reception staff who kindly moved us to a pool view room free as the hotel was quiet!! The room was clean and adequate, occasionally the cleaner forgot to top up tea and coffee but the receptionist came to the rescue!! We only used the main pool which was always clean and towels were available. We used the laundary room, would recommend buying cheap washing powder at supermarket instead of the 6 token box you can buy in laundry!! Had a good quality pizza and burger from the hotel diner but we did not eat in the restaurant or try the breakfast! The hotel is very close to all Disney and universal attractions, if you want 5* this is not the hotel for you this is a cheap hotel/motel where you sleep and shower!!

Reviews.Title: “would stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: bee b
Reviews.Content: I,m not sure about the other reviews about this hotel, but we have recently returned from our 3 week stay here, along with other family members. We read the reviews on here but we can not find and neither can my family, any fault with this hotel. Our family from our booking with BA in the UK, had complimentary upgraded us to the tower block, which we took; however the rest of the family all stayed, one in a room overlooking the pool, and the other round the corner, on the same balcony. All were clean, and fresh, and everything you needed, as for most part of your holiday is spent visiting and doing stuff. We all had lines over bath for washing, we all had fridges, iron and ironing boards, and hairdryers, and coffee machines. All showers had new shower heads, and worked properly. As for the air conditioning, they all worked well, and although they do make a sound, its barely noticeable, unless your an insomniac!! Rooms were cleaned everyday, and towels changed if you wanted them to be, by leaving them on the floor. Us with 2 children, had most time plenty of rubbish, in our bins, and messy sinks, and these were cleaned and new again every day. The hotel staff were helpful and courteous. The hotel small diner was brilliant for a quick meal. We had pizza, 14" for $8 and the chicken wings were great after a tiring and long day at the parks. The swimming pool was lovely and refreshing, not dirty or messy, and the towels were washed and put back reguarly. My Family said they had no problems with anything in their rooms or with staff, other than one room the tv didnt work, but that was resolved as soon as it was reported, and it wasn,t going to spoil the trip anyhow! There is also a laundry room, $2 for a wash and $2 to dry, and its clean and great for family who want to take a small amount of clothes to wear.This hotel i would recommend, and we would stay again. It is 1 mile from world drive to Disneyworld and parks, and 20 mins from Universal. The only difficulty we had was that we didnt hire a car- (now we spoke to the lady at the large desk who arranges taxis etc (not the wdw tickets etc lady/man!!) She arranged a Chrylser voyager 7 seater for just under 3 weeks with action rental car (locally) it cost in total $1007, and they came and picked us up to sort paper work, and dropped us back after we returned the car, very helpful and cheap. We would recommend a car, because although they do have free shuttles, you have to undersatnd that there is 2 in the morning, one for magic kingdom and one for epcot, and only 2 back, around 9.40 + so for us it was no good as we needed to leave the parks early to eat etc, also the disney water parks closed at 5, so it was then a matter to get from there, so i would get a car so you can do the parks at your leisure, unless of course you really don,t drive!!! As for supermarkets, this hotel is at marker 5-6, and walmart is up at marker 10, along with steak and shake, publix, walmart on 27, and super target,etc There is a bus that takes you into magic kingdom every 15 mins from outside hotel, you get the 55 to celebration,(2mile) and then the 56 into MK, only costing $2, so you do have another choice.
