There are perkins, bob evans, ihop and McD,s, shoneys, sizzler, and ponderosa, and golden corral, 7eleven, within 5 minutes walking distance. Beware of the heat, and not really loads of pavements for pedestrians, but you can do it. The local supermarket next door is handy for last minute bits, but i would go to the bigger stores for cheaper stuff. This hotel was greatly located and on our last night we got a local cab, to orlando,s miller ale house, a big A++++, if you like seafod and steak and ribs, a lovely family place, it cost us $9 one way, and its approx 3 mile up 192. We thought it wasn,t a bad price? We throughly enjoyed this holiday, no bad experience at all, and we had an 8 yr old and a 16mth old with us. They provided a cot after we requested it, and to note they allow you the extra time in the room til 12, if you need it then $10 an hour after, which we took advantage of cos we didnt leave til 2pm. We were here during the Skunk show and we didnt have any problems with them, or the skunks, and there was no noise or rowdy guests as suggested in other reviews. The hotel has security, and if you get a car just let them know and they,ll give you a permit for your car. All in all, if your from the UK, and you wanna be close to wdw parks, and the other parks, and supermarkets shopping malls, then this is the place for you..Don,t be put off by the reviews, some people spend too much time in their rooms nit picking, and trying to find fault, instead of enjoying florida. [Just as a side note: make sure you get your tickets in the UK, as they are hoppers, so you can hop into different parks on the same day, and they inc fast pass..This hotel is merged with wyndham, who have a new hotel/vacation club/timeshare right next to WD typhoon lagoon, my family of 2 adults took up their offer for a 90 min talk, with breakfast and free taxi to WDW parks or back to hotel; and you can either get $100 or WDW tickets, but this is not true, you end up staying longer than 90 mins, the free breakfast is some egg, bacon and croissants, its meager, and it cost my family $22 for the taxi to take them round the corner to typhoon lagoon. The tickets they requested was 10 day park hoppers inc water park visits, and they didnt get them. Instead they had to top up their tickets to hop as they were 1 park a day, at Disney which cost another $55 each so they were supposed to save $120 but in the end it cost them in time and money, which they are now complaining about here in the UK.] Don,t fall for this scam! It is not Ramada but Wyndham who are the offenders... You ,ll see this everywhere inc the 7eleven and in the supposed discount stores...

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Brett B
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews, I wasn't sure what to expect. I even read about 'resort fees' that some reviewers complained about, and I knew I wasn't supposed to be charged and called to confirm this. Upon arrival, the security guard gate was more than adequate and the surrounding area was fine. Upon check-in, the front desk agent and manager were very personalbe and accomodating, and did not even attempt to charge a resort fee. When I got to my room, there was a minor mix-up, so I went back to the front desk. After they immediately apologized, they corrected the problem and right before they gave me my new room, they upgraded me to the Magic Tower Suites free of charge. Overall, the service was excellent, the decor was old (late 80's early 90's) but very clean and organized. The room was extremely clean and comfortable, with everything functioning perfectly. with about 5 other Ramadas in a 5 mile radius, I'm not sure if the bad reviewers even stayed here. I would definitely return and would likely reserve the suite next time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Brenda and Don H
Reviews.Content: We too just returned from the Annual National Skunk Show. The hotel was absolutely wonderful, the staff very friendly and accommodating, and a great venue for holding a show or convention. The GM, Andy, and his staff couldn't do enough for us and went to great strides to help us do our show without any glitches. Having the restaurant on premises serving breakfast and dinner and the deli for lunch, snacks, beverages, etc. The breakfast staff always had a warm smile and pleasant "Good Morning" for you. The sliders and chicken parmigiana at the Smokehouse was delicious. Mulligans makes a mean Margarita. Being able to sit out in the atrium was a nice feature especially when you could access WiFi from there. The tower room we stayed in had a beautiful view of the Disney castle and nightly fireworks from the Magic Kingdom and Epcot. The room was spacious, bright and very clean. The tiled foyer into the bath area made a great place for housing our pets. There were plenty of parking spaces right in front of the rooms or in the parking garage. A short walk or drive down 192 got you just about anything you wanted from entertainment, shopping, etc. If you couldn't find it there, they didn't have it. The Disney parks were a very short drive and even Sea World and Universal could be gotten to quickly. If you didn't have a vehicle, the hotel has a shutte bus available to take you to the various parks. We would highly recommend this hotel for your next stay or any event you are planning. The Convention Center is very spacious and the dividers fold back against the wall to make one huge room which gave us plenty of room for our show. We plan to stay here next time we come over to Universal. In addition, we have already booked a date for next year's skunk show. To those that thought staying near the pool area was too noisy, what did you expect? Next time ask to switch your room instead of complaining, it's not the hotels fault.

Reviews.Title: “Great people for our event”
Reviews.Author: Flagirl1234
Reviews.Content: We held a big event with about 60 people...people at Ramada couldn't do enough for us. Hall was wonderful, service was fantastic. Tower rooms are the best. Great to have a big party and be able to stay at the same place. Guys at the front desk along with the General Manager were absolutely accomodating to our needs.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Everything”
Reviews.Author: JudySlade
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Annual National Skunk Show, a charity event sponsored by The Florida Skunk Rescue, and I can't say enough wonderful things about this hotel. (These are domestic pet skunks, folks, and no, they don't stink.) The international staff, lead by their GM, Andy, is exceptionally friendly, and have a rare "Please, let me do more for you" attitude. We felt very special as we arrived to find our group's name in lights on their marquee. The breakfast staff are amazing, and the breakfast buffet is really good. The Deli offers a wide variety of items, and is a great place to get lunch to take and relax by one of the pools. The ribs from their Smokehouse Restaurant will melt in your mouth, and the bartenders at Mulligans make a great Margarita. The atrium area adjoining the large pool has four nice pool tables and lots of outdoor seating. The whole place seems to be a Wi-Fi hot spot, and even my temperamental cell phone got great reception. My spacious room in the Tower offered a spectacular view of the fireworks from the Magic Kingdom and Epcot, every night. The room was bright, very clean, and had both a refrigerator and a microwave. The large tiled bathroom and adjacent area was perfect for my pets. The hotel offers parking facilities with a security gate, and there is plenty of parking close to every room. All the attractions are just minutes away. The Disney stuff is right next door, and even Sea World is no more than twenty minutes away. We had our own transportation, but the hotel offers a shuttle, as well. I would recommend the Ramada Gateway to everyone, and especially if you are planning a group event. The convention center is amazing. We are looking forward to having our show at the Ramada Gateway again next year. Judy Slade, President, The Florida Skunk Rescue "Finding Loving Homes for Domestic Pet Skunks" www.floridaskunkrescue.com

Reviews.Title: “I would rather sleep outside”
Reviews.Author: eloozhun
Reviews.Content: Stayed here once cause it was a cheaper package than the ramada main gate west across the street. We left the do not disturb on by mistake until 2pm when we got back we asked for towels or for the room to be cleaned as we were going out again. NOOOO the staff leaves at 3pm we cannot do it. WTF we got no fresh towels and got what we expected and saw why it was $33 a night ... don't ever stay here I would rather be outside in the rain.... I was ashamed to be a wyndham rewards memeber when I learned this hotel was part of it...

Reviews.Title: “would stay again, good value”
Reviews.Author: darkymark
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights, great position for Diz and close enough to restaurants and shops if you want to walk, reception helpful but didnt use bar or onsite cafe, we went out, fridge in rooms, which were clean and ok for money, we had stayed in several hotels on our 2 week vacation in florida, this was probably best value at $39 per night, i know there is more competition in Kissimmee though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dizzy118
Reviews.Content: GREAT GREAT GREAT- The hotel was a great pit stop after a hard day at the theme parks.The only bad thing is that we were right next door to the boiler room (on the top floor) & found it hard to sleep due to the noise. Rooms cleaned daily, beds made, clean towells provided, tea & coffee topped up. The staff were so freindly & helpfull & nothing was ever a problem. The rooms looking out onto the pool were ideal for us with the children & we met some lovely people from America who come to the same hotel yearly for a family reunion. The reasturant was good value for money & lovely food (take away menu was also very good), the staff here were so pleasent & i would especially like to say a big thank you to Robyn for being so freindly & caring, the children couldnt wait to go to breakfast every morning to see Robyn!!! The hotel is on the 192 which has plenty of shops to look around & food outlets. The drive to Disney took a mere 5 mins which is brilliant - they do run a shuttle to Disney from the hotel but the only down side is there are only 1 collection & return trip for these. The security guards on the gate were very freindly & made you feel safe. I would definatley recommend this hotel to stay in & would stay here again when we go to Florida again.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: afawcett1969
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here Sept 8th-11th for our Disney vacation. This hotel was great! Upon arriving, you're greeted by a security booth (which instantly made us feel safe-even though we had no prior concerns). We grabbed a deal that gave us our entire stay for $116!! The room was spotless. I'm one of those that pulls back the sheets and they were white as snow. VERY clean room. Simple, pleasant decor. It's not a Disney resort with all the animations and colors and views, but if what you want is just a place to sleep, it's perfect! We had a "parking" view and who cares!! We were at the parks!! Honestly, it reminded me of going to Disney in the 70's and everyone stayed in hotels such as these where your car is literally parked right in front of your room door! The Ramada Gateway may be my forever hotel!! The staff was also very pleasant. Check in/out a breeze. Incredible experience for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Only for a very low price...”
Reviews.Author: iluvspence
Reviews.Content: This hotel (which better resembled a motel from the location of our room) is not something to brag about. The rooms were dirty, old carpet and a gross bathroom. The ride to Disney is quite expensive via cab so renting a car is a much better option if that is the purpose of your trip. The pool area is the nicest part of the hotel and we were happy to spend the majority of our time lounging poolside (rather than sit in the dingy room). We spent evenings in the courtyard enjoying refreshments and that staff seemed to be okay with us doing so. If you stay here, you will survive the experience, but don't enter expecting too much.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: Ferla
Reviews.Content: I was here many times and all of them was good for me. In May 2011, the situation was a little different, cos I stayed on the backroom. These rooms are so old and the clean service it´s a little different from the front rooms. Some days the house keeping didn´t clean my room.

Reviews.Title: “It was really nice”
Reviews.Author: Patito31
Reviews.Content: It was really near the parks and the staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gabrielamagalhaes
Reviews.Content: We ended up in this hotel after leaving earlier from the Days Inn International Drive! We tried to find a hotel in International Drive again but everthing was sold out so we choose Ramada Gateway cause was nice and at same time close to Disney! I have to say I will happy go back there! The guy who help us in the check in were very nice and after the fire next door ( yes we were there during the fire that destroy the motel next door) he help us even more giving mask for m brother who has asthma! The facility is very clean and the only why I do not give 5 stars is because I have a problem using their computer and printer before leaving to the airport and the attendant did not wanna help me saying it has nothing to do with the hotel asking me to use the phone t contact the computer guy! Other than that great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: aidyrob
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great very clean and secure, do not read the rubbish about this hotel, we had a great stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean & more suitable for us”
Reviews.Author: debs_gu
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself & our 16 yr old daughter stayed here for 2 weeks-having been to Kissimmee 7 times before-previously in a villa on 2 occasions.This year we wanted more spending money so decided on a hotel instead of a villa as they are so expensive to rent-we have stayed in 4 different Ramadas over the past 9 years. We had decided to upgrade our room 6 weeks before departure to a pool view room for an extra £5 per night.Glad we did as part of the hotel is where the rooms overlook the car park & a building site (closed hotel) next door! However, when we arrived my daughter's bed had sheets with bloodstains on! We reported this to reception, who apologised profusely & the sheets were immediately changed.The room was very clean,all electrics were fine-we had clean towels daily & the beds were changed as & when we asked. Air conditioning was on all the time due to the humidity & worked great.The buffet breakfast was OK but we thought expensive for what was on offer, so we bought cereals/milk/produce as the fridge in our room was more than adequate. Food at the snack bar was excellent value & huge portions. Would maybe stay there again & would like to try the tower next time-location for the parks/Florida Mall are perfect & we found the staff helpful, obliging & courteous. Only big gripe I have is that the safety deposit box is not in your hotel room-it is at reception & when there were other guests checking in or being dealt with by reception staff we had to wait ages for attention. We definitely did not like that when you were accessing your safety deposit box in the small room behind reception that other guests are also allowed in this room at the same time. I thought that this was wrong that other guests are allowed in there at the same time and some of them just entered when we were in there without asking if it was OK.I feel that staff should have allowed access to the safe one room at a time only-this takes away the point of privacy/security when accessing your safety deposit box. We asked about this & staff told us that it was better for security to have safety deposit boxes at the reception desk instead of in the rooms-I completely disagree with this, we would rather have the privacy of the safe in our room-then only you have the access & view of what is in your safe.

Reviews.Title: “Hated It They Need 2 Close It Down !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: shimerathomas
Reviews.Content: They charged us 3x's..... we were suppose to have the law enforcement rate they put is in the parking lot while the hotel was basically empty ( all women and children) the rooms were smelled like cigarette smoke and chlorine.... the frig was nasty they had roaches,ants, and water bugs ( I have pics of them) the supervisor refused to speak with us we were force to upgrade because if u cancel they would had charged our card ( because u have to cancel 24hrs b4 check in ) security harassed us, the staff was very rude, had to get my own towels,the front desk did not answer the phones, they didn't know how to communicate well, they stole money from us, the shuttle was a night mare and the supervisor needs a GED .....The so called manager told me my family and we should had been in the hotel when it burned down ..... and his name is Andrew. S We will never go back and I will warn anyone who wants to spend money there not to ever go to the Ramada!!!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: BW1965
Reviews.Content: Stayed with some friends and family in several rooms for a few days. Read the ratings after we booked the room and were positively surprised after staying here for a few days. For sure you cannot expect a five star hotel for this rate, but it is a good hotel in a good area for visiting the amusement parks. Friendly people, clean pool.

Reviews.Title: “Decent base for hitting Disney”
Reviews.Author: 25yoldcanadian
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while traveling as a group of 4 adults, spending the night before a full day at Disney. The Walt Disney World Gateway is only a few minutes away by car, and they have a shuttle from the hotel as well (Although the shuttle hours will not get you to the park in time for the opening) Check-in was quick (but not perfect, see below) and they sent up extra pillows for us promptly. The room was clean and well-maintained but dark. They have a large pool in the courtyard which we expected to be packed with kids, but it was not busy at all. The room had a fan as well as good AC, and the bathroom was clean with nice supplies. Our mattress was partially off of its frame when we got in the room, and when we sat on the bed the whole thing lifted up. We were able to quickly jam our frame back together and it was fine for the rest of the night. There was one little snag: When we reserved the room in advance, we did not use our Wyndham rewards number because you can usually give them the number when you pay for the room. When we went to pay for the room, someone else had used their own Wyndham number to earn points on their own account. I assume that it had to be someone who works at the hotel or who handles reservations... When we gave them our card they told us that there was already a card number listed for the night, but when we insisted that we had not given our number, the attendant at the desk read out a different number, and then offered to change it for us. It made me wonder how many people do not question when they are told that their Wyndham number has already been listed at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good value”
Reviews.Author: Wmarine2008
Reviews.Content: I just checked out of the ramada plaza hotel on Saturday august 13th. I would like to say that I find some of the reviews misleading and down right rude. I loved my stay. The staff was more than willing to help and accommodate myself two kids and my fiancé. We were due to arrive the Saturday before but ran into a lot of traffic coming from Massachusetts. I called the hotel and told them we were running late. They told me no worries and they would see us when we got there. The check in procedure was very easy and went very fast. We arrived at 2:30am on Sunday. They got us into our room very fast as we were very tired. The security gaurd actually helped us find our room and helped us get in. I would agree it's somewhat of a maze but was happy for the help. We stayed in the motel side that night but decided to upgrade to the tower later Sunday. The room was fine but the kids wanted to use the elevator. The staff was more than willing to accommodate. The pools were very nice and the breakfast buffet was more than worth it having two children. ( kids eat free) the grounds were always kept nice and I saw no trash anywhere. We are already looking to book our next summers stay at the ramada plaza hotel.

Reviews.Title: “you can do alot better for the price”
Reviews.Author: nocrispy
Reviews.Content: My travel agent booked my son and myself into this hotel / motel. I took her word that it was a nice place. Even though I read other reviews before arriving....I read the good and the bad ones. I was willing to give them the benefit of the doubt. Mostly because of the no cancellation policy. When my transportation van arrived at the "gate" the security guard had to verify I was a guest. The van driver proceeded to tell me that he was relived that I was not staying at the property next door and that the surrounding areas was improving since that next door property burned down a few weeks ago. He said there was a lot of drug use and he believed that there was some sort of meth lab that caused the fire. Great to hear!!! Anyway, the front desk clerk asked if I wanted a 1st floor or 2nd floor. My original reservation from the travel agent was for a 2nd floor. I feel safer on the 2nd floor of motels. I told her 2nd floor please. She proceeded to check me in and gave me my room key for a room on the 1st floor ! I said I wanted a 2nd floor room. We got our new room key after a look of disgust from the desk clerk. This hotel / motel is like a maze. She told us we had to go past the first pool...which we did. But from then on....a complete maze with dead ends. Needless to say, after traveling all morning to get to this place I was not very happy about that. A little bit of warning would have been nice about all the dead ends. The room, when we finally found it....after passing all sorts of trash in the walkways, stunk. It had not been vacuumed in what appeared to be a very long time. I went to get a tissue from the bathroom and the tissue was discolored...and not because it was getting close to the end of the box. My son had his laptop with him and tried to get online but was unable to. I was told there was WIFI. If there is the signal is incredibly weak. I immediately called my travel agent and told her that I can not stay here. We tried in vain to get online to find another property. Travel agent was useless....but that is a whole other story. We went back down to the lobby. Hoping that the internet would be stronger there. It was not. We did find another property to stay at and proceeded to check out of this place. I will give this as a thumbs up though. The manager that was on that afternoon was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not a quality place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dancerchick90
Reviews.Content: I have never written a hotel review before, but felt compelled after our stay to write a review. The room we were first put into started off with a used washcloth in the room, a leaky faucet, and an extremely hot room. We choose to deal with the first few issues until the room became unbearable and asked for the air to be fixed. Someone came up to fix it and literally changed nothing, staying for only 2 minutes. We asked for new towels, never got them. We complained again and they put us in a different room. This room was exactly the same. Literally, our hotel room averaged out at around 83 degrees. Not acceptable. As well at these problems, the area surrounding our room seemed very sketchy. Overall, we were not pleased at all with our stay and will not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst "Hotel" Ever”
Reviews.Author: xhanaxrx
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ramada Gateway "hotel" during July/August 2011 for 10 nights and I can honestly say I wish I hadn't. I have never written a hotel review before but I felt compelled to do so. First I say I stayed at the "hotel" as despite being clearly advertised as a hotel, we stayed in the inn next to the hotel. Outside our room we had a view of the building site next door which was operating a very loud bulldozer and there were a gang of hooded teenagers hanging outside the door. After feeling a like a prisoner within the room, my parter quickly complained and we were moved to a room overlooking the swimming pool. In this room the furniture was very dated, there was a massive hole in the sofa and there were insects in the bathroom, however I felt that this room would be quieter and that I would get more sleep away from the building site. How wrong I was. The hotel likes to throw functions for birthdays/reunions and there are a few function rooms around the resort. What they don't tell you is that they arrange outdoor parties, in the area surrounding the swimming pool. Now I am a very deep sleeper, I have slept through alarm clocks and fire alarms, and yet these parties would constantly wake me up and continue until about 2.30am. I complained a few times to the main reception and nothing was done. They clearly care more about the funding taken from the parties than their guests. Now 2 in the morning may not seem late while you are on holiday but considering the shuttle to disney leaves at 7.40, there isn't too much time left to sleep. As for the "free" shuttle bus it was a disgrace. This bus was one of the main reasons we stayed at the Ramada Gateway and yet chose to pay for taxis, rather than use the shuttle service. Now the shuttle service operates for 4 different hotels, 3 of which are very close together. However, despite three of the hotels being in very close proximity to one another the shuttle driver actually drives past the Ramada Gateway (and another Ramada hotel) and drives to a hotel called "Champions World". This additional unnecessary journey added on about 30 minutes to our return journey and I am still baffled as to why the Ramada guests could not have been dropped off first. As the shuttle bus accommodates 4 hotels it was always packed. After our first night we decided to use the shuttle bus which would pick us up at 10pm from magic kingdom. When we arrived at the stop we were concerned with the number of people waiting and even further concerned when the bus arrived already full. When the bus stopped everyone scrambled towards it, everyone was pushing/shoving/swearing/shouting all in front of very small and tired children. The shuttle driver refused to come back and turned some families were turned away. The bus clearly drove with far too many people squashed onto it and it was an awful way to end a lovely day out. I am shocked at the standard of this hotel and I will never stay at a Ramada hotel again. The staff within the bar, cafe, and restaurant were lovely but I could not wait to get away from this place. I was disgusted!

Reviews.Title: “Would never go back”
Reviews.Author: colorblind66
Reviews.Content: Poor customer service; had to walk to get towels and wash cloths 4 days, room infested with ants, refrigerator door didn't close, no pot for coffee, ironing board stuck in up position; cord taped to back of phone which came out often. Offered a free breakfast when complaints voiced to management. Ramada across the street cleaner with better customer service

Reviews.Title: “Be careful before you stay here”
Reviews.Author: krd133
Reviews.Content: I thought a lot before writing this because I did speak with the manager and he resolved the hotel's issues after discussion, and I also called customer care (corporate) without much interest so I really think that people should be careful prior to staying at this hotel. It can be nice with some very specific cautions... Went to Orlando with my family for a really spur of the moment trip. #1 - Be very careful about the reservation process. I made a reservation while en route (was told very specifically that I would need to have this charged to my credit card since it was past the cancellation time which was fine with me since we were on the way) and also called the property itself so we wouldn't have any problems. When we arrived at 2am, the front desk informed me that the hotel was full and there were no rooms, even if I had a reservation. He wouldn't even help us find another location (at 2:30 in the morning). It was only after 45 minutes of begging that I was given a room, after calling central reservations and still being told that "yes, you have a room - you have a reservation". #2 - There are 2 very different types of rooms and hotels. You will notice in the pictures that there is a tower with very nice rooms, fluffy comforters, etc; however you may end up in the back with exterior corridors, old dated rooms, bad beds that move if you lay on the side, and not even an elevator if you are on the second floor. Apparently there is a rate difference for these rooms. #3 - Was told that we would have breakfast included when we made the reservation, but had to argue to receive that also. #4 When I spoke with the manager, I have to say that he did move us to a very nice "tower" room and gave us coupons for the breakfast, but he was VERY patronizing and tried to make sure that I thought he was doing something special for me. In actuality, he gave us what we reserved - a room with interior corridors, breakfast and queen beds at the rate that we reserved. When I arrived home and really thought about it, I called Ramada/Wyndham customer service. They wanted to refer me to the manager, so I declined since I already had spoken with him. Apparently corporate doesn't really want to know what is going on in the field or have any interest in hearing from their customers. I won't stay again at a Ramada or any other Wyndham brand.

Reviews.Title: “Ehh.....it was just ok BUT please read”
Reviews.Author: mika_nicole
Reviews.Content: This hotel definitely has good points and not so good points.....first the staff and the employees that work in the restaurants are wonderful and were all very nice. When you first walk into the lobby its beautiful and spotless and smells clean. BUT what they don't tell you is that there is a high-rise part to this hotel and an inn. They should tell you that if you pay a certain price you will be staying in the inn and not the high rise. Since I didn't know I stayed in the inn. The rooms in the inn definitely need updating...old dreary paint, smoke detector was falling out the wall, toilet didn't flush too good, and one of the outlets by the sink didn't work and meanwhile the others were very loose and had HOLES around them making me very cautious about charging my electronics. Also the coffee maker needed serious cleaning which I ended up doing myself. The iron was about the most updated thing in the room. We had the pool view so that was good, but if you plan on staying here anytime soon (in the inn), make sure you don't get the parking lot view because you will see a demolition zone and hear the noise all day! The pool was very clean and heated and they offered towels and plenty seating area. NOW the FREE SHUTTLE....well they don't tell you its first come first serve. They also don't tell you that the suttle picks up other people from other hotels which means that there are even less seats on the bus. Our first ride to Disney my 5 yr old son and 4 yr old niece had to STAND for the ride because there weren't enough seats and that was the ONLY SHUTTLE leaving to go to Magic Kingdom!! On our way back, the same thing except this time we got a seat but it wasn't without running to the shuttle before it even completely pulled into the lot! Finally there was no AC so everyone was dripping with sweat! SO when it somes to free shuttle, you definitely get what you don't pay for! So maybe if you're staying here for one or two nights and these things are not a big deal then I guess it's ok.

Reviews.Title: “Not as expected”
Reviews.Author: ss003d6768
Reviews.Content: July 22/11 to August 4/11 Room cleanliness very average no hover under bed.. Room bathroom had mould on bath/wall areas. Air conditioning very noisy, old system. Power points loose, plug connections poor and some not working. Gym equipment generally dated equipment and running machine faulty from the day we arrived, reported it, hotel staff said they had called out to get it fixed never fixed for two weeks. Room was tired carpets showing age. Swimming pool very tired needs a refurbishment. Landing outside and pool are dirty, need a thorough clean. Staff helpful and polite. Not the hotels fault but the hotel next door had burnt down and diggers working clearing rubble most days all day. Would not stay here again based on a two week stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Tonyscorpio
Reviews.Content: We rented this hotel through the Entertainment Book for $39 and it was worth it. The rooms were a little dated, bathroom was okay, pools were great. Breakfast buffet was good. It was worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in Kissimmee, FL!!"”
Reviews.Author: SusieQ198
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our two teenagers stayed in this hotel for a week for a family vacation and it was beautiful on the outside as well as on the inside! Very nice staff and great maid service! The rooms are clean and bright! A very nice swimming pool in a fenced in area with free towels for guests to use. They have a gazebo, tables and chairs, pool tables, restaurant, gift shop, arcade and within walking or driving distance to gift shops as well as nice restaurants. I would highly recommend this hotel to stay in while you're visiting Florida in the Kissimmee/Orlando area. We will definitely come back to stay here again on any future visits for sure!! A+++!!!

Reviews.Title: “Booked for price, last minute trip, Enjoyed our stay and this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NCAllen
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 days in advance and got a great rate. Began to worry about what we were going to get when we got there-We were happy. Teens enjoyed it. Has 2 pools, a game room, covered courtyard with pooltables-rent sticks, a couple of putt putt greens and a basketball goal. Old style 2 story buildings create a courtyard around the pools, landscaping is beautiful. The difference between tower rooms and courtyard is exterior entry doors. Towers are more up to date. We faced the main pool right off the main lobby. Was a little loud but it was sounds of having fun. Quite at 10pm when pools closed. Laundry facility onsite was nice. 2 restaurants, 1 snack bar and 1 bar onsite. No free breakfast. Breakfast buffet was pricey for our budget. McDonalds and Dunkin Donuts right there. Also Target down the road and a Publix. Close to Disney, 20 min from Universal, 1 hour from Kennedy. Overall, we enjoyed the room even though kids thought room itself was a little dated. Staff was nice, comfortable beds, nice water pressure. Security Guard in Booth at property entry. Property next door is being rennovated but you don't see that from the pools. Only if you stay on the outside rooms on the left side of the property. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and great price, can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: hongvn
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time. Nice people at the reception, the house keeping people are exceptional, the room is very clean, just been refurbished we think, a lot better than we had expected it. Everyone we met at the pool were agreed too, we will be back very soon with the whole family next time. Also the price is affordable. Please keep up the good work. Thank you for a lovely time. Hong from London PS: We really loved the bed (must be very new).

Reviews.Title: “Not so clean. Room needs massive updating. Will never stay again.”
Reviews.Author: dtkelrond
Reviews.Content: Made a transient overnight stay in this hotel. Luckily I did not book it as our main hotel. Anyway, first, as a positive comment, the front desk guy was very accommodating. Thats about it for the positive. The room, not so clean. The room we were given had the smell of strong body odor, the carpet also had an undescribeable smell. The bedding has a lot of stains on it, which I discovered in the morning(we arrived at 1 am by the way) which gave me the creeps. The blanket and comforter smelled like it has not been laundered. I'm a well travelled person and I have stayed in hotels in a lot of countries and I think this is the worst I have stayed in. As for the price, luckily, I had a discount from where I booked it. It's not worth the price they ask their clients to pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, good for price”
Reviews.Author: adencool
Reviews.Content: stayed for 14 days in june 2011 pros: cheap (as part of our package this cost less than £300) big rooms wifi in room tv service ok free parking close to loads of restaurants, i.e pondarosa, mcds' wendys, bk, bob evans, short ride to applebes, tgi's and target supermarket plus easy to get to walt disney (animal kingdon was about 2 miles away) two good warm pools (which even thou they both only had about 20 beds, were never full) bad points: air con, really loud - like having a jet engine on!, we was unable to sleep with this on, and could hear other peoples aircon when in bed (so not good if your a light sleeper) Side point: only had breakfast once in the hotel (about $10 per person), thou it was fathers day so one was free, but it was really poor. recommend that every body goto ponderosa a couple of hundred meters down the road

Reviews.Title: “Broken Toilet, Missing Phone, Bugs-stay in tower rooms or not at all”
Reviews.Author: PocahontasTraveler
Reviews.Content: Mom and daughters on Disney trip - found toilet to be broken. No maintenance staff available, we were told, perhaps the security guard can "take a look at it." Toilets are not optional for four guests. Move to new room. Second room has broken phone, bugs on carpet, bug in the bed under the covers, and dirty bedspread. Towel service inadequate for four people. Third room in the tower building - much nicer. Some of the staff were very nice about the problems; Others seemed a bit helpless as to how to respond. Booked this hotel for the price. If you go, stay in the tower rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price”
Reviews.Author: santasbiggestelf
Reviews.Content: First I have to say that I don't frequent a lot of fancy hotels, so my point of reference may not be the same as others. With five children, we pick what is cheap and in a decent area, and this one fit the bill. The room was large and clean, but I admit it was hard to really judge that as the carpet and bedspreads were extremely busy patterns. I was a bit suspect when the walls of the bathroom were painted yellow, but after careful inspection, saw that it was clean. There was a mini fridge in the room we took advantage of and it kept drinks and cheese sticks cold. The air conditioning worked great during a hot week and I was grateful for that! This particular hotel was very affordable and had some nice perks. The pool and play area in the center of the room groupings was very well designed and not really full. Most of the time we were the only ones using those facilities. They also had a great little basketball hoop area. The best part was a snack bar by the pool which was quite inexpensive. The TV only got 7 channels in our room. Two of them were in black and white for some reason. However, the free internet worked great and was something that was more important to us personally. Who goes to Orlando to watch TV anyway? That issue may have been solved by a call to the front desk, but we really didn't care, and didn't make that call. The service from the employees was great and I always found them attentive and anxious to be of help. All in all our stay here was pleasant and we will stay here again next visit. You do get what you pay for, but for us, we wanted to put the money into the attractions, not the room, and this room worked great for a family on that kind of a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing not what we expected!”
Reviews.Author: janie0032
Reviews.Content: On reading the reports on here, we were very unsure, However on arrival we were totally surprised how different to the trip advisor reports it was, The rooms are very clean , well presented, and furnished to a very high quality, We are staying in an apartement, and it is very clean, The staff are helpful, I cannot understand where some of the comments are coming from, I have attached some photographs of the rooms in the main hotel, the areas around the hotel, and the apartment we are staying in, The pool areas are well maintained and very clean, and have a secure gated area that children cannot run off from. The outside area is large and has tables and chairs and snooker/Pool tables. again it is very clean, There are ice machines dotted around the complex, there is a laundry should you need one again that is immaculate. There is a security system and staff on the compex and ID is needed to gain access at all times, I asked if I could see the rooms in the main tower block, and found they were of a very high standard with a Kitchenette with Microwave and fridge, The other great bonus is the fantastic views of the Disney area you can see Expedition Everest in the distance and the Tree of life , Another bonus is the free Wi Fi in the all the rooms and apartments, There are food options of a restaurant, and a clean a tidy fast food outlet, and the Sportmans bar, I would have no hestitation in recomending the Ramada Gateway to anyone,

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: cuqmil
Reviews.Content: this hotel is a place where you dont want to ever stay they dont clean and when you ask for towels they turn a deaf ear to you. they dont clean there rooms there rugs and sheets are horrible, when we try getting into another hotel there where none available since it was memorial day weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Come here every month and will keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: doneworkin59
Reviews.Content: Our group started coming to this hotel in the last year, moving across from the Maingate Ramada, while they were redoing their roof. We surveyed our Staff, as for us its work not vacation. Making a list of pros and cons for both hotels, we decided we preferred the Gateway over the Maingate. The rooms are clean, smell nice, they are mould free. The reception staff are constant, you know you will see the same faces each month. Robyn and the breakfast staff really look after our group well. She and Nalin anticipate our needs and preferences now and are always pleasant and accommodating. The even gave me a send off icecream cake at breakfast !!!!! All the staff at this hotel are courteous and will do whatever they can to make your stay a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: JulesScotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 3-10 June 2011. On arrival we were allocated a room at the back of the Inn. This room appeared to have been abandoned mid cleaning. The beds had been changed - we knew this because the dirty bedding was lying on the floor, apart from that nothing else had been cleaned. We telephoned reception - they apologised and asked us to come and be reallocated. We were upgraded to a room overlooking the larger of the two pools. In this room there were a few things which needed attention BUT they didn't affect our holiday experience. The bottom drawer runner was broken, the bathroom door handle wobbled and the sink/countertop had a large crack and wobbly taps - not very nice to look at but they still functioned as they should. The beds, bedding and pillows were excellent. Towels were thick and fluffy. Fridge, coffee maker and T.V. all worked. Room was cleaned every day - no compliants there. The grounds and the pool were kept in tip top condition, always plenty of towels at the poolside too. Staff were pleasant and there was a security person on duty at the gatehouse. It appeared some of the rooms were being refurbished so maybe they are working their way round them all. You get what you pay for - we didn't pay for 5 star luxury, we got a basic room which was adequate for our requirements. On previous visits to Florida we have paid a lot more and received a lot less from hotels, so we were happy with the Ramada.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cyndimelboourne_Fl
Reviews.Content: After leaving another hotel due to no air conditioning and dirty room, I was forced to find accomodations for myself and friend and our 3 special needs children in a hurry! I called the Ramada and Michael informed me "Room is Avail." Upon arrival Reinaldo Alvarez and Dairo were so accomodating! Roll Away Bed was in room before we were able to arrive in the elevator. Thanks so much for saving our trip. These gentleman deserve a special recognition for their kindness and consideration of our special needs children. You don't know how much this means to parents who must deal with stressful issues while trying to travel with our kids. Again, Thank you from the bottom of my heart.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable price and decent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: XtreasureX
Reviews.Content: This hotel room was good looking and beds were very comfortable. We stayed with a family of 4 and even though it was for 1 night, it was worth the price. If you are looking for a suite this is probably not your choice, but for the price that we paid it was good. The only thing we didn't like was the smell of the carpet, but that is normal since the AC is not on cold when it is empty. It goes away a little once the AC runs for a while. Very affordable rates. Not as bad as some peole write in their reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Lanisita
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its proximity to Disney and to save some money. Well... we paid the price. The hotel is very old and badly kept. The rooms are dirty, malodorous and the staff overworked. The bathroom towels were so old they were literally falling apart. Our room was not done every day. The room door got jammed multiple times both times it took them >45 minutes to fix... time we spent tired to death ( all day park hopping) waiting outside for it to be opened. Its a shame, the administration has spent zero in this hotel improvement for probably 15 years... The only positive is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Try it, you wont regret it!”
Reviews.Author: FrankDisney
Reviews.Content: The seven of us ( 5 adults and 2 kids ) stayed there from 5-21-2011 t0 6-3-2011 and we loved it. It is not a 5 star hotel so we were not expecting luxury, only a good bed, shower and a/c. We stayed in two rooms in the Inn side at the very back part of the hotel, with easy access to the parking lot and to the pool, which was nice. We had our room cleaned twice daily, around 8-9 am and then again at 1-2 pm. We didnt use the restaurant so I cant comment on that. The check in desk was a little bit busy but it was because there was only one person attending. Dairo checked us in and asked us if we wanted 2 separate rooms or 2 connection rooms and also he asked us if we needed a parking permit so he directed us to the concierge desk where a lady gave us the permit and asked if we had any time available to attend a timeshare tour. We simply told her that we were not interested and she didnt put pressure on us. The room was bigger than those at Disney's All Star and Disney's Port Orleans Riverside ( have been on both ), even though it needs remodeling: a spot in the rug, some mold in the bathroom, nothing big. There's an internet room which costs 20 cents for each minute and apparently there is wifi but I didnt use it. The a/c worked perfectly and the beds were very comfortable, it had a mini fridge which we used to freeze the drinks, tv with local channels and 2 or 3 hbos, There is a mini laundry which we used twice, ( two dollars each load, we bought the 3 in 1 Purex soap for 3.39 at Walmart and it worked perfectly ). We used the mini fitness center once, and the pool twice. There are many retaurants and shops nearby but a little bit far from HAO HAO Chinese Kitchen restaurant ( 5479 Irlo Bronson Hwy. ) our favorite restaurant, try it! They dont have late check out so we had to purchase an additional night because our plane departed at 2 am, so beware! I dont give this hotel an excellent rating because as I said, it needs some remodeling in the rooms, but for the price ( 494.00 for 2 weeks for one room) what else can we ask for! My recommendation is: if you only want a nice bed to sleep in, a shower and air conditioning, this is it, you can try the Ramada Gateway. If you are looking for luxury and five star attention, then this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “Thank goodness for the Ramada Gateway”
Reviews.Author: Roundabout1959
Reviews.Content: After a HORRIBLE experience at the Wyndham Orlando (see review), we drove all the way to US 192 to find a hotel. I spoke with a lovely woman named Susan to see it they had vacancies and we were pleased to hear that they did. Upon arrival, we stopped at a guardhouse with security who immediately asked if we had reservations at the hotel. We told him that we had spoken with Susan minutes ago, and he showed us the way to registration. We proceeded to registered, all of our information was ready to go and we went to our room. Grant it, I asked for one king size bed in the room but we got 2 queens. We were so tired from all the running around that we just decided to stay in the room. Included in our $59/day price was an awesome breakfast buffet with omelet station, all kinds of fruits, danish, breads, scrambled eggs, grits, sausages/bacon, oatmeal, cereal, pancakes...it's a long list of items. Our server, JON, was an absolute pleasure to deal with. He was extremely nice and accommodating. LOUISE was also a very nice person and I can say that everyone in the hotel we encountered was very nice and treated us like family. We will DEFINITELY stay there again, and we highly recommend this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Frankzie
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just recently stayed at the Ramada Gateway and we had a great time. The hotel was really nice and in walking distance from some shops and restaurants, which was very convenient. The hotel staff were super nice and would go out of there way for you. I would for-sure recommend this hotel to anyone, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay!!”
Reviews.Author: vanny64
Reviews.Content: I have read reviews on this hotel and dont understand where people are coming from, yes it's not 5* but the price reflects that, rooms were clean, staff at front desk were polite and always helpful. My wife and I stayed there for two weeks and we didnt have any reason to complain to any staff member about the rooms. The rooms in the tower side, were comfy, roomy and came with a fridge and microwave Pool area was clean and there was always hotel towels poolside to use. The location was fantastic, theme parks, restaurants and shops all close by. If you want something that is good value, great location, close to restaurant and shops and very good staff then you could do alot worse than stay here

Reviews.Title: “Great stay- Great price”
Reviews.Author: PghPens
Reviews.Content: I booked our Disney trip nearly 8 months in advance. I was really worried by all the reviews on this site that we were going to a crappy motel, but we were pleasantly surprised! I am guessing that the people who gave it bad reviews are expecting a 5 Star resort, which it is not. For a 2.5 to 3 Star hotel it was wonderful. Security at the gate made sure we were on the reservations list which was nice. The front desk staff are a little hit-or-miss. The man checking us in (Mr. Conti) was a jerk. We told him we did not have a car with us and then he writes us up a parking pass and does not give us the shuttle information! We had to go back down and get the suttle times. The gal who checked us out was very sweet and kind. I liked her. The free shuttle was something I was worried about because not many people had written about it on here, so here is my review. We took the early 7:40 shuttle each morning with no problems and easy transfers to all parks from Magic Kingdom. It was not crowded at all. For the return shuttle it only picks up from Magic Kingdom and Epcot at 10:00pm and 9:45 pm. That shuttle was very crowded and we were forced both times to transfer to different shuttles at the 2nd pick up. We were not very happy having to stand on the bus the whole way back. Also, you will have to take a taxi back to the hotel if you choose to see the Fantasmic show at Hollywood Studios at 9pm. They do not pick up there and there is not enough time to get back to Magic Kingdom in time for the 10pm pick-up. We ended up buying some breakfast items and our alcohol at the Kings Supermarket next door because it was WAY cheaper than eating or drinking at the hotel. There was a mini fridge in our room so we had milk, juice and cereal. We also ate at the Ponderosa the first night. It was pretty good. I found a 10% off coupon on their website and used that. Housekeeping did a great job and the air conditioner kept the room really cold. It was a little loud, but as others said, we were exhausted after spending 12 hours at the park so we slept fine. The carpet was clean and looked newer. We did not encounter any bugs or insects in the room. The shower head was a little bit low for my 6'1" tall husband. Our room was in the first section of the 'inn" with a parking view. Very easy to get to, just on the other side of the first swimming pool. The time-share people did not speak to us at all. We purchased our Disney tickets through Disney.com. That was the cheapest I found. The hotel is actually called the Ramada Plaza, so make sure you tell people the "Ramada Plaza Gateway" so they know where you are talking about. There is a Ramada Maingate across the street that the shuttle people tried to take us to. All in all, we had a wonderful time in Florida! So glad that this hotel was better than the other reviews stated.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean room - hope you don't need ice”
Reviews.Author: DISFAN315
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Ramada Gateway before numerous times. We've had some hit and miss rooms on our various visits. Since our last visit, they seem to have renovated some. There is now a guard in the guardhouse (never saw one before) and he was friendly and quickly sent me on my way to check in. Nobody was at the front desk when I arrived and it took about 5 minutes for the clerks to come out of the back room to assist the guests in line. Check-in went quickly after that and we were off to our room. The room was at the back of the property, so there were only a few other guests around, which made it very quiet (which was nice). The room looked to be freshly renovated, but we were missing a side chair for our table and the toilet was broken. Maintenance was able to fix the toilet in about 20 minutes, but took half of our towels with him and never had anyone come by to replace them. The mini-fridge is way too small. It's meant to only hold a couple of bottles and the freezer portion is an absolute joke. The bathroom was tiny, but clean. Beds are fairly hard, which we like, so we slept comfortably. If I need to stay more than one night in the future, I don't think I'll stay here again since the mini-fridge is useless to us and we bring lots of beverages from home to take to Disney. One other thing - I think there is only one ice machine in the non-tower room area that I have ever found to work. The guide map for the hotel shows a bunch of ice machines around the premises, but most are either non-existent or broken. From the back of the hotel, we had to walk all the way up to where the front pool was to get some ice. Overall - I would recommend the hotel for comfort reasons for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travelling_taffs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks and it was great. We had read other reveiws and were a bit sceptical about staying here. We needn't have worried. The place was clean, secure and the staff were very friendly. We didn't get bothered by the time share people or see the tail less squirel everyone mentions. The room was cleaned daily and we always had fresh towels and clean bedding. Dario on reception was very nice and couldn't do enough for us. We have stayed in the Kissimmee area twice a year for 10 years and this was the quietest room we ever had. We will be staying there again for certain.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect price!”
Reviews.Author: clare1009
Reviews.Content: Overall great hotel! Especially for the price.. if ur used to stayin in a hotel for 150/ night then this is not a place for u! U can't beat 39/night... 2 pools gym basketball court what more could u ask for! Could use tranportation to and from airport! But other than that overall great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great, Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rnschechter
Reviews.Content: We arrived late and the desk clerk was so friendly and helpful. The breakfast was super, a great value for the money. The facilities were really enjoyable. The location cannot be beat. The room was big, and most important was absolutely clean. Even had a fridge in the room. They have a great conference center, was not what we needed this time but would be great for any business meeting. I would really recommend this to any and all travelers. Great for the family and the professional too.

Reviews.Title: “OK room with great service.”
Reviews.Author: shelly729300
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and the service there was excellent! The neiborhood was great!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed thoughts on this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: imagechanel
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal since we are military and booked through a military site. We upgraded our room to the tower (was $15.00 extra) I didn't want to stay in the two story ones that you enter from outside. Long behold those are the ones by the pool! Rooms were okay, a little outdated and not so cozy, like I thought it would be. Service desk wasn't pleasant. The lady that works the little store in the lobby stares at you like your going to steal something. prices are HIGH! Don't buy there! go to other shops and purchase the same items cheaper! (Ponderosa across from the miniature golf place on International has TONS of things! Cheap too!) Pool was okay, kinda old. No hot tub. bummer. They played Jamaican music so you seem to be in the islands for something! We had to tell them to turn it on one evening! The restaurant is over priced. We walked in and the lady (Hostess/Waitress) finally came out and said 'I'm busy so your going to have to wait for awhile." What the heck??? So we left! There was only two families there and she was giving food to one family! There is a soda ice cream place attached to it, it was closing and the prices were high. We went to golden corral and ate! (that was expensive and pretty dirty just to let you know! but its a buffet, so you can only hope for so much!) We did actually go back in the morning for breakfast, and it was okay. Back to the hotel! It was an okay stay, tight parking so be careful parking and getting out of your spot. They have a guy that sits in a guard shack and checks to see if you are going to stay there or are staying there...but funny thing is...He leaves at 9pm?!?! whats the point?!?! Anywho...it is good to stay if you want to be super close to Disney and the attractions 9main entrance is just down the highway!) and don't want to pay a lot for a room! WI FI did not work, so that was a bummer...Seems not WI FI works in Orlando?! why is that?!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, Close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: joenjess
Reviews.Content: We read a lot of reviews before we got here and were a little worried about what we were going to get. We we got a great room at a great price. Our room was located in the far rear of the hotel it was quiet we did not hear much noise at all. Check in was very easy, it took no time at all to get our room. We arived before the 4 pm check in time ( at 12:30 pm) and they allowed us to check in at no extra cost to us =) The only problem we had was the refrigerator in our room was not working right. We went back to the front and told them and when we returned later that night we had a different working refrigerator. They responded very fast to our request and did not make a big deal about it they handled it in a timely mannor. The things I did not like about the room we had was it was tile floor ( Im a carpet person) The cleaning people did clean our room daily but the floor was not washed with a mop so our feet did get durty if we walked bare foot. no big deal bleach will rewhiten our socks. The cleaning person always left extra towels for us and took the dirty ones daily. We stayed in the motel type room but wanted to see a tower room ( we travel to Florida yearly so we will need a place to stay next year and had such a great stay here this time) We went to the lobby while we waited for our clothes to wash( they have a laundry room and its not priced bad $2.00 to wash and $2.00 to dry( you get 45 mins to dry)) while in the lobby we spoke with Renaldo Alvares he was the manager for that night. We were telling him how much we liked the hotel and how were wanted to see a tower room to see if that would work for us next year ( there will be 4 adults and 1 or 2 kids) Renaldo gave us the room key to a room on the 8th floor. It was nice a little bigger then our room the refrigerator was double the size of ours and it had 2 sinks a walk in closet and a flat screen tv. The beds also seemed more comfy. The view was amazon! We will stay there again next year I plan on calaling in the next few months to reserve our room. While there the hotel looked very full but everyone was helpful and nice.they were remodleing 2 rooms a few doors down from us and when I say remodleing I mean that. We walked past and the rooms were bear every inch taken down. the floor, walls cealing sink and toilet were removed along with all the fixings (beds, dressers ect) so whenn the remodle its done right. I did see on here about a tailless squirel , we did not see it but I had to ask. They really do have a friendly tailless squirel =)

Reviews.Title: “Not A Bad Hotel...stayed in the tower”
Reviews.Author: pungee
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was a little scared what to walk into. But Im glad I made the choice. Working in the houspitality industry for over 8yrs I kinda know what to look for and expect for what you pay for. I booked a two night stay atthis hotel for its location and PRICE. It was a steal at the price. My Girl and I just basicly just slept there. We didnt eat, use the pool or use anything else the hotel have to offer. The room was clean and bath room was clean aswell. The fridge and micro wave were a little old but we didnt even use it. The only problem I had was upon check in. after working for different hotels I know that the room by the pool always will have water bugs(roaches) and will have more humunity so it will have a greater chance to smell like mold. So I def made sure to book in the tower for the extra 10 bucks. Upon check in they stated a room by the courtyard(the pool) I said no they said I had to have some kind of proof to show I booked in the tower the confirmation number was not enough. I told them they should just be able to look at the rate and tell its not a pool room rate.. But luckly I had my I phone and show them their web page and their rates... So just didnt like the fact they were trying to get over on us.. But other then that the room was great...beds were clean, a/c worked a little noisey but after walking all day in disney we just wanted a bed and a roof over our heads to get rest for the next day. worked great for us...

Reviews.Title: “This is a motel NOT a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MamaBear63
Reviews.Content: I was so anxious about how the rooms would be against so many reviews. I wanted to give it the benefit of the doubt and claim the bad reveiws as isolated events. Well, that did not happen to me. For a Ramada it was a motel and NOT a hotel. The carpets were filthy! We stayed for a week during spring break. After a few days I discovered bites on my body which I attributed to the 7 mosquitos in our room. (Which is no fault of the Ramada, since my husband left the door open. We killed them all.) But it was the bites that showed up in places that were not exposed outside the blankets that puzzles me. Bed bug bites! If you remove the linen and look at the corner crevaces of the mattress, you can see the signs. The staff was nice, but not helpful with information about the hotel. The beds were comfortable but a very noisy hotel. Also to use the internet you have to pay 25 cents a minute! You do get what you pay for, but since this is a Disney Good Neighbor Hotel, I was very disappointed in the hotel presentation. The pictures are deceiving!

Reviews.Title: “A depressing hotel”
Reviews.Author: UKvisitors0411
Reviews.Content: Shabby, depressing hotel with grubby rooms and pool. Most of the time it felt like the hotel was empty ( and this is peak season) and the restaurant certainly was. The staff weren't particularly helpful and there is no information on the hotels facilities in the rooms. The only thing the staff in reception are interested in is selling Disney tickets, hounding you at every opportunity. Transfers ( not shuttles) to Disney and the other parks are only once per day, making it a very long day with children and impractical so you have to hire a car. The only good thing I can say is that I checked out 3 days into our 14 day holiday and, with the help of our airline we managed to get a refund.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay.............!!!!”
Reviews.Author: barjiash
Reviews.Content: For all those concerned travellers out there....... RELAX.......! This hotel is excellent......! Previous hotel guests that have given this hotel negative reviews must have been incredibly unlucky.....! I would agree that if you are used to staying at the Carlton Ritz hotel, then yes, this is not the place for you, however for a good value hotel it's actually very very good. We stayed from 31st March for 1 week. We reserved two rooms. Check-in was efficient and greeted with a smile. Nothing was too much trouble and the rooms we requested were provided. High floor with pool view...... Perfect.....! Within 10 mins we received a call asking if everything was to our satisfaction...... A nice touch. Both rooms were very clean with bath , shower, hairdryer,iron,coffee machine and fridge. The beds were huge and very comfortable.Daily maid service. We ate at the hotel for the first night which was adequate but nothing to write home about. Breakfast's are great and at $9.99 (kids eat free) you get brilliant array of choice......Then the chef will cook you fresh eggs or waffles to order. They just keep topping up your drinks......! No need for lunch after all that.......? The pools are clean and pleasant to swim in , especially the heated pool...... Very nice. Shuttle buses were provided to all the major parks , no problems there.....! The Black Angus Steak house is next door and a great place to eat. Lots of restaurants ........! Turn right from the hotel ....... Drive 2-3 miles and you've got Appleby's , Miller Ale House,The Red Lobster, Buffalo Wings.....All great eateries....... Also some restaurants on the door step so location is excellent. Checking out was easy and they even printed our boarding cards out for us. All in all a great place to stay at a very affordable price. Would i go back to this hotel.............. Absolutely...........Enjoy..........!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - don't believe bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: SnapesGirl
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 1 week stay with my mom. We arrived really late (close to 1am) as our GPS got us lost. Check-in was smooth and quick and staff was very friendly, even at that hour of the morning! The room was clean - no bugs, no rust, nothing wrong at all. Shower worked great and fresh towels delivered every morning. The hotel is around a bunch of restaurants, so there is always something to eat. We didn't use the shuttle service as we rented a car. Just be careful - directions can be a bit tricky, so I suggest using Google maps instead of a GPS!! Enjoy the hotel and don't worry about the negative reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Hideous room - lovely pool”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoBoomermom
Reviews.Content: The mildew smell was overwhelming. The room was spartan without so much as an alarm clock. Walls were cardboard thin and we were repeatedly awakened by the sounds of other guests playing basketball outside (at 1:40am), checking into their rooms well after midnight while screaming "spiders!", and rolling their luggage overhead. The sheets were clean and new but only 35% cotton so they had that slick poly feel. However, we stuck around the next day to relax by the pools and they were great, surrounded by gorgeous over-grown Florida landscaping.

Reviews.Title: “Ramada NO MORE!”
Reviews.Author: Laina_s
Reviews.Content: I WILL NOT stay at this hotel anymore.. I stayed here last year in the "unrenovated" rooms around the side of the hotel that you don't see..lol and they were disgusting! I wanted to sleep in my clothes! The floors were dirty the shower was dirty and the room smelled.. So this year I said, we would stay in the "Tower" rooms. These are the rooms you see in the picture when you first pull up the hotel online.. I'TS A TRICK! The Tower rooms are NOT that much better.. They smelled, the microwave was old, bathtub was peeling , the base board of the room where gross .. the only working ice machine was on the 6th floor! The elevator was dirty.. I mean for this to be the "Tower" I was NOT impressed! Every Ramada I have been to has left a bad taste in my mouth. Oh wait , when you call the phones are terrible! When you hit reservation it hangs up , then you call back ..I did at least 10x.. no answer. If you can stay somewhere else .. I would make this place your last resort.. I will say this the staff was very nice:0)

Reviews.Title: “Everything was fine - very pleased”
Reviews.Author: flavor777
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our vacation staying at this hotel for 7 nights with another family. We booked this hotel as a air/hotel/car package through southwest vacations. We chose this hotel because it was on the entrance of Disney and because it was very reasonably prices. We didn't want to spend a long time driving to get to the parks, and we wanted to have planty of money for lots of other things. We got a great deal and were very excited until we read the reviews on this website and few others. WE WERE SCARED! People were describing this place as a dump. HOW WRONG THEY WERE. The lobby was very clean and in very good shape. There was a small gift shop, a bar, a restaurant which we did not eat in, a coffee shop which we used a few times to purchase breakfast stuff, two pools with the closest being the largest and heated, which we used on our first day of arrival. We arrived at the hotel at 11:30 am and were able to get rooms. We asked for the rooms to be in the quiet section because we had small kids and we wanted them to take naps without too much outside noice. We received two rooms on the ground floor facing the 2nd smaller pool, which was practically deserted at all times probably because was not heated. The rooms were in the inn section, I believe building 4. We were so relieved to find the rooms very clean and everything working properly. We did notice that the tub needed to be repainted, but for an occassional shower it did not bother us at all. Also the internet in our rooms did not work. Couple of times during our stay we had to go to the lobby or garden section to use the internet, which was not a big deal. Over all we had a very pleasant stay, and we would not mind staing here again.

Reviews.Title: “A tail-less squirrel roams this property and I prefer its presence to the mannerless management here.”
Reviews.Author: caligirl702
Reviews.Content: We wanted to save $ this year and decided to chance staying at a cheap hotel. BIG MISTAKE. At check in the manager insulted me by saying something like "it looked like you were just winking at a kid next to you and it was weird"......?! And then he said something in Spanish to his co worker and laughed. It was odd and uncomfortable. Guest service is not a priority. Our first room had 2 double beds after we were told we couldn't stay in the tower bc we had requested a king. The AC wouldn't even turn on so we asked for a new room. The manager thankfully let us switch to a room with king size bed and working air, but there was one pretty major problem here - the door will not open unless you take a few steps back and then RAM into it with your entire body!! Carpet is old, dirty, and coming off the floor. Only one of 3 lamps work. It smells like soiled towels. This place is old and dirty and I'm sad that this is where we have had to spend part of our vacation. Do not believe the good reviews on this hotel. The rude manager probably wrote them himself. Spend the extra $20 to $30 a night to stay somewhere cleaner, safer, and more guest satisfactory. Last, but not least, there is a squirrel missing a tail that lives here and hangs out around the pool. It is not afraid of people and is kind of cute, but I think it is gross that it is always around. I'm sure it lives in a wall here. This place needs to be completely renovated and get a new manager before anyone else stays here.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and very clean”
Reviews.Author: boo0
Reviews.Content: Check in is at 4 i arrived at 2. The man at the desk was very nice and he got me in a room. Check in was very fast. The room was cheap, clean, the bed was comfortable, and the hotel is located close to everything even the disney parks. The staff was very nice and helpful. Make sure you stop by the pool (take a snack) and see the tailless squirell(friendly). Thanks for a wonderful stay to all the employees.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT DO IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ducci15
Reviews.Content: This place is a DUMP! DO NOT BELIEVE THE WEBSITE FOR PICTURES AND DESCRIPTION! Booked a KING; got a Queen. NO Coffee maker or hair dryer (as listed on the website). Refrigerator hummed and air conditioner BANGED all night=NO sleep. Arrived at 1100 PM and checked out at 700 AM only because I couldn't get a Disney onsite reservation until then. Only plus is good location to the Parks. If you have to stay offsite, STAY ANYWHERE OTHER THAN THIS DUMP!

Reviews.Title: “Sent Here in the middle of the Night!”
Reviews.Author: webtravelreview
Reviews.Content: We were sent here by the Ramada at the airport as they had given away our prepaid room. Arrived after 1:00 am to this remote Ramada location. The lobby was deceiving and we thought that it wouldn't be so bad, it only got worse! Room condition was poor, the bathroom area, carpet etc. were all sub-par. The beds squeaked all night. Anytime my husband or kids turned over it woke me up because the beds bumped up against the head board making a terrible noise. There was no lock on the door, so any staff member with a key could have come in on us, not safe at all. Only the turn lock worked. You could see where they used to be a latch or chain but it had been removed and not replaced. When we got up after a sleepless short night, we attempted to shower and THERE WAS NO HOT WATER. After a terrible night of incredible run around by the Ramadas, no shower, you must be kidding me, we needed showers! I went to the front desk where the phones were ringing off the hook with others complaining about not hot water. So it wasn't just us, the hotel in warm Orlando is without hot water. Do not stay here, there are tons of hotels in Orlando, this one and it's sister at the airport need to be run out of business.

Reviews.Title: “This place really isn't that bad!”
Reviews.Author: djw0105
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a week here and was kind of worried given all the negative reviews I saw here. We had a twin room in the tower block. Two double beds, fridge, microwave, bathroom. Room was cleaned every day. We used the shuttles from the hotel to go to Universal. They were reliable and got us to the park before 9 a.m. every day which let us enjoy the parks before it got too busy. There is no shortage of places to eat round about the neighbourhood, although it's mostly all you can eat buffets. The black angus steak house next door, however, was pretty reasonable. We found everything clean enough and presentable and would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “SHOWER FROM HELL”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl65nj
Reviews.Content: This is actually our second and last stay here. The room itself was not too bad, clean, enough space, etc.. It was more the noise and the shower. We were in the room near the courtyard so we heard the bumping sounds of wheeled luggage at all hours of the morning, were awakened by the sound of a fire alarm at 6 am..really?? and not to mention the horrible loud nightly karaoke. But the shower took the cake, it hung off the wall, there was no hook you could put it in. WTH? So we had to pick it up, wash our hair, put it down, etc etc... I have never seen anything like it. We never had enough coffee for the mornings. We had to find the maid cart to get some. So lessened learned, to save a few bucks staying off Disney property was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff- Won't Stay At Ramada Gateway Again”
Reviews.Author: AMCgal
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Ramada Gateway for 4 nights. Pros- the breakfast buffet was good, and at 8.95 not too pricey. The heated pool was nice. (There are 2 pools- one is NOT heated). Shuttles to Disney parks are very limited- the shuttle driver is very nice though. For the cheap price, you get what you pay for in the room- very basic, no frills but clean, If you are spending long days at the theme parks, and just sleeping here it is just ok, nothing more Cons- The front desk staff is VERY rude. They couldn't find my reservation upon arrival and I had to wait about 15 minutes before they could "find" it. HMM. Then, I start walking to find my room and and pass some workmen who are pressure cleaning the hotel and almost spray me. Idiots. Then, I get to my room and can't put my key card in the slot because there is tape over the lock because of the cleaning. I peel the tape off and still have trouble with the lock. This has never happened to me before. I was on my way back to the front desk when a kindly maintenance man helped me work the lock. Then, I go to sit by the pool only to find that the workmen spend the rest of the afternoon pressure cleaning around the pool area with 2 VERY LOUD machines- so loud I went to the front desk to complain which I have never done before in my life at a hotel. I was very rudely informed that because I checked in early, I had no right to complain. Yes, I was early- to get a good airfare, I had no choice but to take the early flight-that or pay a lot more money.
