By the way, the pressure cleaning around the hotel went on for 2 days- very, very noisy, and no signs posted like "Sorry for the inconvience." Not relaxing at all. Oh, the hours for the gift shop and dining room are limited. No lunch is served. There is a deli on premises which was never open the entire time I as there. Don't waste your money here- find another place to stay. I won't use Ramada again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it at any price, time to let this BEDBUG chain die off”
Reviews.Author: marielywynn
Reviews.Content: First they said they didnt have our expedia reservation, so they couldnt accomodate us, they were overbooked and sold-out. After we arranged for Expedia to phone the front desk and correct the situation, they acknowledged our reservation but made us wait for 3 hours while they "found" a room for us. While waiting in the lobby, about 10 other guests left because of bedbugs in their rooms. Finally said to hell with them at 12:30am and still no room. Why wait to sleep with the bugs. Good night don't let the bedbugs bite!

Reviews.Title: “"Good value for money considering most of your time is out of the hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Dutch1969
Reviews.Content: 1. Free (Hotel) 9.15am only to magic kingdom but if you need a sleep in just catch the 11.15 one to epcot and then catch the monorail to magic kingdom (easy as) shuttles to All parks in Disney including down town, work the system people catch free hotel bus to Disney walk to the polonesian hotel and catch the free disney buses to down town and other places. 2. walk 10 mins and go to the super market you will save heaps having breakfast before hitting the road for the day. 3. lower your expectation and if there is a problem be clear and persistant but not rude this will get you a long way. 4 if you get sick of the parks a taxi will cost no more than $18- $20 to get back to the hotel 5. buy your spirts over there 5 mins walk soooo very cheap 1.75lt tequila for $21.00 Aust cheaper than duty free 6. free wi-fi and it works... 7.people will complain about every hotel @ the end of the day this one is good value for money, close to the parks and within walking distance to supermakets and food,,enjoy

Reviews.Title: “The people that worked there are terrible host!”
Reviews.Author: Chrisaaron08
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old, nasty, and the woman that works at the check in counter at night is rude! I will never stay at one of your companies hotels again, nor any of their sister chains. Also watch out for there so called 20 fee that they can't even explain what it's for! Sorry sorry place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel, comfy beds. Great buffet breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: dpcarlow
Reviews.Content: Liked this hotel a lot . Nice comfy beds and lots a space in the rooms. Really good buffet breakfast for $8.95 and kids eat free. Free shuttle to Disney and there is walmart just down the road if you need a few pits of pieces. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location Bad service”
Reviews.Author: Jeneye
Reviews.Content: This location is ideal if you want a very affordable place close to Disney and you do not have small children, don't eat breakfast, can't swim, don't need a roll away bed or a crib, and aren't spending more than a few hours a day in the hotel. The breakfast buffet was terrible, the pool's heater wasn't working, one of our party's rooms smelled like a sewer, and sometimes our rooms were not cleaned during the day. Finally, even though I requested a crib 3 weeks in advance, and the hotel said one would be available, when we checked in there were no cribs left. One of my kids had to end up sleeping on the floor because no cribs and roll away beds were available for the entire stay. We are not going to stay at this hotel again and are going to spend more money elsewhere when we return to Orlando in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it for the money”
Reviews.Author: Kay058
Reviews.Content: Was down in FL for a few days of spring training. We stayed in clearwater 1 night and then came over to orlando for 2 days. I had stayed here before but didnt realize it till I got there. The restaurant was so good I went back when I stayed at Disney a month later. For the price this place was unbeatable. I think it came to 50 a night for a clean room, nice tv, decent location, nice staff, a pool, a nice restaurant, a nice lobby and other facilities. I just hope it is still there when I go back to this area again. It seems like this area of hotels seems to be dying out. There was quite a few closed nearby.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING HOTEL AND SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: KissimmiiMaylee
Reviews.Content: I stayed 24 nights at this hotel and during this period various members of my family visited with different reservations. During that time the service was outstanding. The manager Reinaldo Alvarez checked us in and took a personal interest that all guests were comfortable. His professionalism was superb and refreshing especially where our visits are annual events and we had a horrible experience at a different Ramada in the area last year. Our rooms were clean and well maintained the lobbies were also well kept. Mr. Alverez greeted each guest daily to insure all was well and he was always available to responds to any issues that may have arisen. My family looks forward to our vacations each year and appreciates the wonderful service received. It is a great value and conveniently located to Florida’s attractions

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget base, no need to worry or complain at all”
Reviews.Author: nickh16
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a fabulous trip to the Disney area and I am compelled to write a review on this hotel. We booked nearly a year in advance and had a long time to prepare/get excited about our upcoming holiday. This included doing a lot of research in to where we were staying, the area and the quality of the hotel. I checked this site regularly for guest feedback and was distraught to find some of the reviews of this hotel were very, very negatve. It had reached a point where we had discussed going back to our travel agent to see if we could change to an alternative hotel before we arrived at a hotel from hell.............how sheepish did we feel to arrive and find everything was what we had hoped for when we booked. From the start...: Very easy to find on the 192 highway. Close to the interstate, and literally 5 minutes from Disney property - absolutely excellent location. Checking in - Admittedly we were staying during a quiet time of year (as confirmed by a member of staff) so can not comment on busy times, but checking in was very fast and efficient, handled by very pleasant staff (a theme that continued through our stay). No hard sell whatsoever on timeshares, only had to speak to the concierge to get our parking pass, and even then he was nothing but helpful, giving us a few maps, coupon book, magazine on the local area and highlighting where we were in relation to the attractions on the map. The Room - having stayed in budget hotels in the UK and abroad, this was what you would expect, have paid for and serves it's purpose. Think of a bog standard Premier Inn with slightly dated decor. Clean, tidy and pretty comfortable. Two Queen sized beds, shower/bath, loo, sink, hairdryer, mini-fridge and large flat screen tv. The large windows are a problem with privacy, but curtains drawn/lights on and it's not an issue. Cleaning service was excellent. A lot of US citizens do stay at the hotel along with other international guests; for a weekend of our stay we had some "gangsta rap" types staying next door, could have been a bit intimidating but they were friendly enough. In regards to our room, we were on the first floor of the motel section facing the car park. I had e-mailed ahead requesting this, and whilst I did not receive a reply or acknowledgment of my request, we had what we wanted (could be a coincidence but they could have put us anywhere, so who knows). Some small issues with the magnetic key cards. The receptionist addmitted the strip was crap - get it wet or near a mobile phone and it would need reprogramming. Not ideal, happened twice, but was sorted very quickly and pleasantly. One other issue was that we could not get our door to lock one morning. Turned out the batteries in the electronic lock had gone, needed a hotel engineer to fix it. Was told 20 mins, but waited an hour. Reception explained it was due to a management meeting, were very apologetic and fixed very quickly once he arrived. Didn't bother us too much - depends on your temperament I suppose! Only stayed by the pool for one afternoon - once we did wish we had more often. Clean pool, complimentary towels for poolside and friendly guests. The pool was a bit chilly though. Other facilities.... Deli - Never saw this open duration of our stay so couldn't comment on what it's like, no explanation on why it was shut, but we never asked. Wi-Fi - Only available in the reception area, crap connectivity but we only wanted it to e-mail home. Complained in passing to the manager without realising who he was, and he commented it is something they are looking at. Management - apparently the hotels have just been bought and taken over so there may be further improvements on the running of the hotel(?). Safe - A "behind reception" safety deposit box system in place which we used everyday. This is a free, handy service; but can be a bit awkward. Receive a key when you ask to use the service, this key and a reception key are required to open your box which means you need the receptionist to be free to get in it. They leave you to it once you're in (which may mean waiting a few mins to get it locked up if they are busy). Still, better than nothing. As mentioned, the location of the hotel is excellent. There are lots of amenities close by. 2 steakhouses are within walking distance (2 minute walk), as well as a bargain world gift shop, an electronics/camera shop and a small supermarket. A couple of "gas" stations are within a minutes drive and there are plenty of other fast food, all you can eat restaurants and gift shops around. There are 2 large supermarkets (Super Target and Publix) about 5-10 minute drive away. It takes about 35 minutes to get to the far (Universal) end of International Drive (If you go the non-Interstate route. About 20 minutes via the Interstate). We were very happy with the hotel, quite annoyed that there are so many negative reviews on this site and can't really understand where those people are coming from. We will happily return to this hotel again when we return to Florida. I am also recommending this hotel to my sister and her boyfriend for the trip they are planning next year. It isn't perfect, but having stayed at both I-Drive Quality Inns, and a couple of Kissimmee area Villas, this is certainly no step down or horror show as described elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel/ perfect holiday”
Reviews.Author: Martin4040
Reviews.Content: Please do not take any notice of the negative comments- this hotel is excellent, the staff are always helpful and will go out of their to help you out, we stayed in the tower so i can't really comment on th inn but request a tower room, we had 2 queen size beds and cannot fault the cleanliness, the hotel has a games room and internet access, the bar is a slight negative as it closes at about half ten not late enough for us!, (Happy hours 5-8), The restaurant is superb clean with a variety of food and plenty of it!! There are timeshare people there but once we told them we were not interested they didn't bother us again, The hotel provide transport to all the disney parks which is also very handy but they don't go to the other parks, but you can't have everything. All in all a lovely holiday in a fantastic place. Forget to mention this hotel is situated perfectly for the disney parks only 5 minute drive, roll on next year

Reviews.Title: “Great for the value and location to Disney.”
Reviews.Author: asmph
Reviews.Content: It's not luxury but it's convenient, clean and great for the price. I've stayed here 5 times now and have never been disappointed. Tower rooms are newer and nicely remodeled if you're looking for nicer accommodations but the basic ground floor rooms lining the pool (a bit cheaper) work well for a place to sleep or relax in between trips to the parks. Staff is courteous and friendly. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I could not believe that Ramada Inn would allow the rooms to be in the shape they were in.”
Reviews.Author: hopene
Reviews.Content: At the Ramada Gateway, the first impression was nice. The pool area was gorgeous and serene. The dining area and the bar was nice as well. But once you got in the room, you could see it needed new caulking around the floor and the tub in the bathroom. The carpet should be replaced in the room. The food was good and blah. Lunch was lunchmeat and salads on both days for a buffet. Breakfast was the best buffet. The Ramada Inn in Kissimee room was alot nicer. The outside pool area was not as nice at the one in Ft. Lauderdale. The variety of food on the buffets were better as well. If I could combine the two hotels, I would place the buffet staff and design of the dining area, outside pool, jaccuzi, bar, and theater from Ft.Lauderdale with the Kissimee's rooms, indoor pool, talent show stage together to make a better Ramada Inn in both towns.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel. Would go again”
Reviews.Author: walkew
Reviews.Content: Ideally situated on the 192, close to Disney and plenty of food outlets. Rooms a bit tired. We stayed in the motel part of the complex. They have a nice pool and the staff are excellent. The restaraunt attached to the hotel is awful. There is a Black Angus next door (2 minute walk) which is great.

Reviews.Title: “Had to listen to salesperson before getting parking pass”
Reviews.Author: LodgerFromChicago
Reviews.Content: An OK place. At check in, I had to listen to a salesperson in the lobby opposite the check-in counter before getting parking pass, and he marked the pass good until 10/20/2010, which I was not comfortable with, but I did not want to raise a stink. I only stayed a few nights, leaving October 3. Terrific location, immediately west of WDW. One of the first hotels on the west stretch of route 192. No U-turns allowed to get into parking lot, but after making a real left hand turn at the traffic light, the turnaround point is not too far away. I wish food vending machines or snacks were available late at night. Noisy talkers out in the lot late at night and first thing in the morning. Had to run the fan unit to drown out the annoyance. On final morning, lady at different hotel lost Sheba at 5 AM, and she woke up the whole lodging hood with her pleas for Sheba to return. There is a different hotel just west of the Ramada - and the two properties were thankfully separated with a chain link fence. I do not know if Sheba returned.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Clean, Friendly Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: philmaggie
Reviews.Content: As I write this review my wife & I are still at the hotel in our lovely queen size bedroom with 2 double beds, a microwave, Fridge, & coffee machine & oh yes free wi fi in the room that some people has said doesn’t exist. When we arrived at the hotel, the lovely receptionist gave us a choice of rooms to view. We chose the front of the hotel overlooking the main road, there`s barely a sound to be heard. The hairdryer in the bathroom didn’t work, but within 5 mins of telling the receptionist the maintenance man was knocking at the door with a new one. Rooms are very well looked after, cleaned with fresh towels daily. They have safety deposit boxes at the reception that are free to use, The only criticism I have is that if your sunbathing by the pool you cannot get any refreshments after 1100 until 1700. All in all were having a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and close to the disney parks”
Reviews.Author: amdu
Reviews.Content: 2 March 2010 We had booked a 2 queen bed room in this hotel for 6 nights. After reading some of the reviews we weren't sure whether to go ahead with this hotel but we thought we'd take a chance and am glad we did. The staff was polite and good. The room was clean and had a mini-fridge, coffee-maker, hair dryer, television and dining table. There was no microwave as our room was in the inn and not the Tower. The housekeeping staff were good and did their job well.The hotel has a complimentary shuttle to the disney parks and back at different times( in the day/night) which worked well with us. we therefore didn't have to rent a car and pay for the parking which would have cost us a lot. The hotel has a restaurant too but we didn't have time to check it out. We would sip our morning coffee in the room and then head out to the parks. We would return back only at night and so brunch and dinner used to be at disney. Overall, we loved our stay at this hotel and it was easy on our pockets too.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, room and pool ;-)”
Reviews.Author: USAIWillBeBack
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 nights, in de tower. No negative feedback everything was fine, clean room. We didn't use the restaurants. Parking was perfect too! Would stay again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Baff28
Reviews.Content: The worst experience of my life. Rooms dirty. It seems that were never cleaned. Do not stay on this hotel. I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday”
Reviews.Author: PETERJB11
Reviews.Content: Cannot understand any of the bad reviews. Reception very helpful. Lifts efficient. Bedrooms (in hotel) very adequate with comfortable beds, good air conditioning, good shower and toilets facilities and regular/good maid service. Slight criticism - the deli was very poor - not open in afternoons, did not sell what it advertised, so quite disappointing. Pool was excellent. Car parking very good (under cover!) Very handy for Disneyworld turn-off from Highway 192. All in all very little to criticise. Note that the concierge service gave a hard sell for time-share - I could do without this!

Reviews.Title: “Walked in room, walked right out, turned in key cards.”
Reviews.Author: TBRays78
Reviews.Content: We purchased a room with a pool view online, check in date 7/24 and check out date 7/25. When we went to check in, he said he didn't have any left. Strike One.. So I looked him in the eye and said that is what we paid for, I want a room with a pool view, he found me one. Our room (#168) didn't have a pool view from the window, we had to open the door and look to the right to see some trees that were blocking the view of the pool. Not to sound racist, which I am far from, but we were the only white people in sight and felt a little uneasy. Strike Two. As soon as we opened the door to our room we were overblown by the stench as if rotting corpses had been baking in there. It was disgusting. Strike Three. So we turned the A/C on full blast which helped a little, and I fired up my laptop to enjoy the free wireless internet that I made sure was an available amenity when searching for hotels. No signal strength whatsoever. So I called the front desk to see if there was something I could do differently, and he said oh, the wireless only works in the main lobby. Errrrrrr. So we were extremely frustrated and went to dinner at pizza hut to get some fresh air and clear our minds. My GF said "honey, I don't want to go back there." Me either! So I called up the young man that handled my check-in (Pablo) at the front desk and said listen, the room smells, there is no internet as advertised, and we don't have a pool view, I'm leaving my key cards on the table. He said OK, but we're still charging you for the entire night. I said fine, I'd rather pay another $70 elsewhere while the night is young than waste it away in that dump of a hotel. Customer service for this place? Grade: F- My advice to people considering this hotel....STAY AWAY.

Reviews.Title: “Do not waste your money at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trice1977
Reviews.Content: My extended family traveled to Florida, to have a family reunion at Disney. We used this hotel. The pictures of the hotel online are not accurate. This hotel is very dated. Once you leave the lobby the hotel is awful. There was NO air conditioning in the hallways. The air was off in the rooms when we checked in. There was hair in the shower on our arrival. WIFI only works in the lobby. We stayed three nights, and were consistanly asked to take tours of other westgate properties. Someone was shoving flyers under the door everyday. Our rooms were never vaccumed and there were no clean towels left one day. By no stretch of the imigination is this a nice hotel to stay in. It is a dump. I was very dissatisfied with this hotel and would not reccommed it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING ADVENTURE FOR THE FIRST TIME IN DISNEY WORLD”
Reviews.Author: DoskaWindsor
Reviews.Content: My family was extremely satisfied with the stay in this hotel. Our maid was marvellous, everyday the beds were made, fresh towels ect. She made sure that our room had everything we needed. The hotel it’s self was very clean, free of any kind of bugs, swimming pool cleaned everyday (closing at 10 pm, all of us wished it would be closing later because after all day walking it would be nice to jump in the pool and relax ). The hotel is providing transportation to the Disney World, be aware of the bus driver with the glasses (very aggravated), it is very close to the restaurants and gift shops. My family already recommended this hotel to friends and relatives. I’m planning to come back to Florida soon and for sure I will choose this hotel. PS. Please DO NOT order any thing from Antonio’s Pizza (the flayers were slide under the doors), the most disgusting pizza we ever ate and chicken wings were dry with out the taste, it looked like they were sitting a whole day in the deep fryer. The stuff member that was taking the order wasn’t professional about his job, it seemed he just wanted to get rid of me, my order was not finished yet when he hung up the phone.

Reviews.Title: “The worst”
Reviews.Author: orlandoadman
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. Arrived on A Friday to find out that they charged an additional $10 per day for their so called " resort fee".They only wish they we're a resort. They never cleaned the room till Sunday after going down to the desk 3 times on Sat Evening.Went down again on Sunday morning and the person at the desk showed disgusted face when I told her about it. She then offered to refund the resort fee. When housekeeping finally did come on Sunday early afternoon I had to ask for things to be done. She told me that she would bring back fresh towels and never did come back with . so had to use the same towels for the entire length of the stay. I had to ask for them to replace the coffee she did but never replaced the coffee cups. so they stayed dirty for three days as well as the water glasses. STAY AWAY FROM THIS DUMP!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a great price !”
Reviews.Author: flint70
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried after reading some reviews but I needn't have been. We had asked in advance for a quiet room as we were going to be there for 2 weeks and so we were towards the back of the hotel, facing inwards from the car lot. So we didn't get the noise from other people coming and going, or from the pool. It looks like they put most people near the entrance to the hotel so perhaps these rooms are a bit worn but we were further down so much quieter. The room was great, 2 double beds, fridge, tea/coffee machine, iron and ironing board if you need it, and was very clean - no mould or damp. Only downside was no nets on the windows so curtains had to stay closed so quite dark. But the the price-great! Great position, 1 stop down to entrance to Disney and close to I4 for Universal. We had a late check out at 1pm with no charge !! All in all we had a great time ! Also we got to see Harry Potter and my son was chosen by the wand keeper - excellent. The Forbidden Journey is brilliant. Just need to save up now to go back. Would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: xyberq79
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for the price. Hotel was no Ritz-Carlton however, for the price was def worth it. Was close to Disney and in the middle of everything. Hotel was clean and well kept. They have two full size pools on property. If you are wanting to get away from the kiddies you can walk back to the INN's pool further away from lobby and get some privacy. They have both Tower and Inn rooms. We stayed in the Tower and had no issues. We had a kitchenette with mini frig and microwave with coffee pot and sink. Great place!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location. Great Value. But you get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: tiktok4321
Reviews.Content: This hotel is actually best described as two distinct properties - the Towers and the Motel. The Tower, though a bit pricier, perhaps offers a better quality experience. But for the purpose of this review, we will focus on the motel portion of the property. Since value is the predominant reason why folks would likely choose this property, I will offer some trades of what you get and what you don't get for the price. First, what you do get is a relatively clean room with two queen size beds (rather than the "norm" of two doubles). You can book up to five guests in this room which is great for a family like mine where most properties tell you to get another room. Other amenities include: single-cup coffee maker, ironing board and iron, desk-top-size refrigerator, alarm clock, 27” LCD TV, and a Gideon Bible. There were also no hidden fees, like resort access fees or extra person fees. We paid $31.20 per night and were billed $31.20 per night plus 13% tax. What you don’t get is a microwave. You also don’t get a continental or any other sort of breakfast included. There is a restaurant and bar on site. Not too expensive, but it’ll set a family of 5 back $45 for breakfast. It is something to consider when pricing other properties. The room experience was lacking. I did keep reminding myself that I’ve spent more money on rooms not so nice. But it was a bit difficult to keep convincing myself. The drapes were heavy and dark, but didn’t close off all the light. The door stuck on the jamb and required a bit of force to close all the way. Light could be seen around the door when it was closed. Housekeeping was generally pretty good, but there were dust bunnies if you looked for them. There were substantial cobwebs above the doorway and dust balls in the bathroom vent. Mold and mildew were almost completely non existent. Maintenance was also a bit lacking. The toilet had a leak and would refill about every 20 minutes. The faucet handles on the sink at the vanity also leaked, and were very difficult to shut off all the way. My thought is that with the money saved from energy costs between the door and the leaky water, they could really step up the housekeeping. Shower temperature was adequate but not overly hot. The beautiful 27” Samsung LCD flat screen TV was unfortunately fed a poor TV feed with most channels (except the hotel channel) coming in fuzzy. AC worked great and offered us consistent sub-70 temps during the night and helped keep the humidity at bay. The pool seemed nice, but we frankly didn’t have time to enjoy it. Over all, this was a nice property that we wouldn’t mind staying at again. Though, maybe next time we’ll try the Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and super close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: harris2007
Reviews.Content: Been here four times, every time we go to Disney. Will never stay in the motel rooms (poolside)again, but the tower rooms are just fine. The motel rooms, by the pool are very loud. Kids running around at night ,up and down stairs, made it unplesant. However for the upgrade of a few dollars more, made it worth it the next few stays. The tower rooms are quiet, cleaner and newer than the poolside rooms. Great place to crash for the night after a long day at disney. Save your self cash and stay here. We find that it is nice to stay in disney, but a hefty penny is paid. Staying at the ramada gives us extra cash in our pockets to spend at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Served a purpose”
Reviews.Author: littleshell32
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as part of a cruise and stay package. This hotel was clean and served a purpose. We were only sleeping there and not spending quality time there. The location is ideal, its a lot better than International Drive. Our only problem was the noise, it sounded like we were sleeping on top of a generator, it was noisy, and the walls were thin, but the hotel staff were very accommodating and put in a room with no neighbours. The rooms are cleaned every day, the decor is a bit dated but overall if you want a hotel that is cheap, close to the parks (not walking distance), clean and friendly then you should stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, will return next time!, Overall A-”
Reviews.Author: Jennyrae21
Reviews.Content: Hotel is at a great location. Easy access to I-4 and all the parks. For the majority of our stay we stayed at the Inn section. They needed to repair a water main and offered to upgrade us to the towers. We didnt move bc we werent going to be in the room when the repairs were happening, but a few days later a large group of teens moved in. Then we upgraded.. I wish we would have done it sooner! Try to get a tower room as soon as you check in. They are much larger, have a closet and a microwave and kitchenette. Hotel staff was friendly. You do have to sit at the conceirge desk in order to get your parking pass. They will offer you a timeshare presentation, but weren'ty pushy. I just said "no thanks", and that was it. Weigh you options with the shuttle: If you take the shuttle it picks up at 8:10, and the earliest you can return is 5:45. Not so great if you have little ones needing a nap. And the shuttle makes *several* stops on the way back to the hotel. It took us over an hour to get back and the park is a mile away. They have 2 pools, but 1 is always closed. They also have a pool table and game room.They arent much to speak about. Our room was clean, no issues there, and ice is Free :o) Overall , we would go back. It cost us $221 for 8 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal at $33 per night, but had some issues.”
Reviews.Author: jbdusf
Reviews.Content: First off, I can't complain too much since I paid only $33 per night. I mean, what was I expecting? The location of this hotel is GREAT! 5 mins to DIsney! The room they gave us was in the old "motel" part of the property. Room was very dirty, lots of long black hairs everywhere! That night, the A/C kept blowing the light cover in the bathroom creating a very loud crashing noise that woke my fiance and I up several times. The next moring, I went to report the problem and they were very helpful. The lady was honest and said Im not sure if the repairman would get to it that day so she offered us a much nicer room in the Tower section. MUCH MUCH nicer room. The hotel has lots of great ammenties. Bottom line, for the price it was a great deal. If you need something super nice, don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “recomended hotel”
Reviews.Author: toviiiii
Reviews.Content: Been there for 5 nights in March 2010. Close to Disney parks, and many restaurants around. Had a parking view room and it was fine. Large clean room, nice bath with a lot of towels. Service and staff were o.k. We had a very good price with easyclicktravel.com.

Reviews.Title: “Annual Spring Training Trip”
Reviews.Author: roperjax
Reviews.Content: This is our 14th year coming to the Orlando area for MLB spring training. We have stayed a several different hotels over the years, and this is our third year at this hotel. They offer good value for the money, especially in the tower rooms. Their Florida resident promotion during this period is one of the best deals around.

Reviews.Title: “The best choice!!!”
Reviews.Author: joshdegel
Reviews.Content: Really good ubication, close to everything, nice people on service, very clean rooms, secure. We were 8, 3 adults, 2 child, 2 teenagers 1 baby!!! We havea great time here!!!! My only recomendation is do not eat at the hotel, there are a lot of better options around and cheaper!!!

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: kerry1323
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel last august for 2 weeks with my boyfriend and all in all felt we could have got a better hotel & location for the money we paid. The room was a bit dated and was clean on arrival although we found the cleaning staff to be a bit lazy (beds only made up daily changed every 2nd or 3rd day unless you took the time to catch the maid and request the beds be changed). The air conditioning was nice and cold although very loud and there was something in the hotel room making both of us come out in a rash and feel very hay feverish. The pool was clean & quiet and there was never a problem getting a sun lounger. We only ate at the hotel restaurant 1 night and it wasnt really anything to shout about and not great value your better off walking along to the ponderosa. The concierge were polite and friendly but not very helpful and must have been working on commision from the taxi firm operating from the hotel grounds. I was only 20 when I went so I couldnt hire a car and my boyfriend doesnt drive so getting to the shops & theme parks was a bit of a nightmare. the hotel had a shuttle to disney run my MCO express (3 trips to & from magic kingdom per day) which was always crammed full with people having to stand if you got the last shuttle home at night. the driver was constantly on his mobile phone speaking in spanish not really paying attention to the roads. The attraction tickets sold from the hotel are fairly priced but if you ask about transport for example to premium outlets, universal studios or discovery cove they concierge will advise you can only get to anywhere by taxi which is kinda expensive. We found our way round using local transport using Lynx buses (the stop is alligators bluff opposite the ponderosa restaurant) the drivers are so helpful and will tell you the right buses to get on/off and where to get your connections etc. cheapest way round is the lynx day pass for $2 each or they do week passes as well. overall the hotel is not bad value but unless you have hired a car you will struggle to get to any attractions except disney. Good restaurants, gift shops, nightlife a short walk from this hotel, we felt perfectly safe strolling back after a meal in the small hours All things considered for a basic quiet hotel on a budget it was ok but I believe there are better hotels in the area with shuttles to other theme parks (universal / sea world etc) would be less restrictive if you have a hire car

Reviews.Title: “I would stay at this hotel again, they were very helpful.”
Reviews.Author: tammeadam
Reviews.Content: We stay with Wyndham when we travel because they offer a great rewards system, plus they are always very clean and nice rooms. We booked our room ahead of time, so when we arrived we had found that our room was in the low rise part of the hotel. We went back to the front desk and asked to be put in the high rise rooms of the hotel. Juan Pablo who was on the desk that night, said he didn't have anymore rooms in the high rise like ours, but he did go ahead and give us a suite that was open in the high rise. It was another great stay with a Wyndham hotel on our trip to Florida.

Reviews.Title: “true gem in a sea of choices”
Reviews.Author: ctmallman
Reviews.Content: awesome hotel,awesome staff,everything exceeded my expectations. only gripe,if i had 2 point 1 out would be wireless internet refused to work properly in my room.was a very small inconvienience to go to the lobby to use my laptop. other than that,ramada inn is recomended to all

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price, helpful staff - we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: RonMcD0
Reviews.Content: We originally stayed here in 2009, but in the 'motel style' rooms overlooking the parking lot. We found this to be very noisy with people coming and going at all hours, so this time we asked to be put in the tower hotel. The check-in staff were happy to oblige. We were really pleased with our decision - the room was on the 4th floor and very peaceful. I think the rooms are adequate - you're not paying 4 star prices so won't get 4 star quality! What you will get is clean well-equipped rooms with a great daily maid service and towel change. We found the staff a little sullen sometimes but generally they were happy to help. Like most people we didn't appreciate having to go and see the time-share sellers to get our parking permit, when you've been travelling for a day and are feeling tired and jet-lagged it's the last thing to you want to deal with! But we were prepared this time having had to do it the previous year, so just politely said no - they looked a bit annoyed though! I don't recommend the Smokehouse Bar and Grill - it's OK if you get back late and can't face going out somewhere, but is very over-priced and the food's not great. My kids eat anything but didn't finish their food, which is a great indicator! We tried it for breakfast on our first stay, but found there was a very poor selection compared to somewhere like Ponderosa, and was more expensive. Needless to say, we didn't eat there again. Location-wise, it is right on the side of a main road so sometimes have to queue in traffic to get in/out of the car park, but the plus-side is that there are lots of restaurants etc very close-by. Walt Disney is only about 10 mins away, I-Drive about 20 mins but very straightforward to get to. We're thinking of returning in 2010 and would definitely stay here again - we found it to be clean and well appointed, don't recognise the place from some other reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive should be the price to pay”
Reviews.Author: alejandrovai
Reviews.Content: I PAID $31.00 a night, for that price the hotel is excellent., was clean, was comfortable, was very close to all the parks, ' BEST LOCATION FOR REAL" just don't be fooled by the breakfast, not worth it, you can have better elsewhere for less or the same money, the hotel breakfast (((((((((((((((( S U C K S ))))))))))))))))) The service people was A+++, they kept the room clean day by day, really good service. Not worth more than $31 a night, over $31 you might as well look to stay in another place, I would even go as far as $40 a night and its well paid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but...”
Reviews.Author: weinbers
Reviews.Content: Our room was pleasant, but we had asked for non-smoking and there was a slight smoke smell tot he room. Also, requested a king bed and got 2 queens - but can live with that. Black Angus Steakhouse next door (within walking distance) was a nice plus.

Reviews.Title: “RESORT FEES????”
Reviews.Author: christinek28
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked into the hotel at 10pm. It was a last minute thing. They told me it was going to be $89 per night. Since we were only staying the night I did not feel up to going hotel hopping. So we booked it. The next morning I get a bill for $111 - they charged my an addtional $10 resort fee. I would not care if I used that part of the hotel but I was there less then 12 hours. Why did I get changed a resort fee when I checked in at 10pm and check out at 8am? I know it is only $10 but really why?

Reviews.Title: “OK for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: Home24
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been around for over 30 years. There are 2 sections to it: a tower and a motel. I stayed in the tower and was told I got a good price thru expedia. They have made an effort to keep it updated but it is tired-looking. The dryer did not work, the security clasp was broken and a tile was loose in the shower. If you're a light sleeper, forget about it, the AC unit was VERY loud! It was clean and in a great location. WIFI only in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: 51elvis
Reviews.Content: Just returned for our annual visit to Disney World. This was our third time staying at the Ramada Plaza Motel, 1 mile from the Disney Parks. We had the ground floor, parking lot view. The room was clean, and it smelled clean when you walked in. Every day fresh towels and bathroom supplies were left. We had a mini fridge in our room which was handy for keeping soft drinks cold. It was quiet at night, convenient to all the local attractions, many restaurants and we will most definitely stay here again. Check in and out was easy. No problem checking in early. We only needed a clean and safe place to lay our heads at night and this Ramada fits the bill. No need to spend your money at a Disney Resort when the Ramada is just as good.

Reviews.Title: “Only just a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: stace1945
Reviews.Content: this hotel is fine if you do not want a drink in the bar after 10.30pm you do not want any food between 11.00am and 5.30pm you want to talk about time share you do not want to take a taxi(waited 1 hour ,then walked to nearest eating place)

Reviews.Title: “fairly good”
Reviews.Author: etammps
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located. You can go for all good nearby atractions, like Disney World, Universal Studios and go shopping. There is a parking lot. They don´t have a incredible staff. My oppinion is that they could wash the bathroom with a disinfectant . I took some fungus on my foot when I was taking shower.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: SheffieldBrenda
Reviews.Content: My husband and I with two friends have just returned from Orlando, we were on a cruise and stay. We first stayed at the Ramada for three nights then took a Caribean cruise and returned to the hotel fo a further four nights. Following reading some of the comments on trip adviser I was concerned to say the least but have always tried to follow the positive comments rather than the negative. Remember this is a three star hotel. The room that we had was large bright clean and comfortable. It had two large beds ample storage, mirrors and table and chairs. There was a small kitchen area that had a sink, microwave, fridge, coffee maker, bottle opener, Iron, ironing board and cupboards. The bathroom was clean and bright and with a bath and overhead shower , there was a good supply of lovely clean white bath and hand towels plus least four face cloths towels every day. The water was hot and the air con worked well. Check in was efficiet and most helpful, I asked if we could have two top floor rooms in the tower area as they were reccomended on trip adviser. We were promptly changed at no extra charge, the rooms were on the front with views of Disney. The pool area was pleasant with clean towels available all day, we did not try the pool but spent time sunbathing round it in comfort. The reception staff were all really pleasant and helpful without exeption. Safety deposit boxes are in the reception area and are free . The only downside for us was the bar was mostly open open from 5.30PM to 10pm. We would have welcomed a lunch time drink and again at bedtime. I must stress the bartender Chris was first class and more than helpful with local advice. The consiege desk was always open and I believe staffed by Westgate the time share company, unfortunatly the staff on there did not offer the the same level of service as the hotel reception staff. We asked for a taxi one night and was told that they were only allowed to ring one company, after 45 mins we gave up and walked instead. ( the two on the desk were busy playing computer games) We did agree to visit the timeshare site which we were not over impressed with and had to listen to really loud music while the salesman tried to talk to us. It was not a hard sell and when we told them we were not interested they were polite. These negative points in no way spoiled our enjoyment, When I had a couple of minor problems they were dealt with immediatly by the reception with good grace. For a three star I think this hotel does well and I congratulate them on their efforts I feel that the Ramada has had some prety unfair feed back. If you want 5 star the pay for it if not this hotel in our opinion is very good value

Reviews.Title: “Staff don't care, dirty, Big on trying and trying to sell you a timeshare and shun you when you obviously don't”
Reviews.Author: NewyorkerUk
Reviews.Content: Wasn't expecting much because we hadn't paid much but, staff can't be bothered to do there jobs to the point of being rude. I went to Florida a few years ago and loved the friendliness of everyone, non of that here ! they seem totally inconvienced at having to be there. Rooms ok but not that clean. Location is ok but there are better locations for the same price. They have a hotel that sells timeshares, we went on the promise of free tickets to a dinner show, which we got but when we said we didn't want to actually buy a timeshare they turned quite unpleasant. The bar only opened if they had staff !

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the price paid”
Reviews.Author: vacaplanner1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this motel with our two kids, mom, and cousin. The place was okay for the price that we paid. The bathroom could of been cleaner. The water coming from the sink faucet and bath tub spout had a weird smell. I'm not sure why that was. Also, the walls are very thin. I could hear our neighbors every morning and people walking outside our motel room. So, if you are a light sleeper, don't stay here or get ear muffs. There was no wireless internet access in your room. You had to walk all the way down to the lobby to get access (which was a separate building from the lobby). We only ate at the restaurant in the lobby once which was for breakfast. The breakfast was cheap but you could pay close to the same price down the road at Ponderosa or Sizzler which would have been better. I don't know how anyone could mess up breakfast. Put it to you this way...everyone in my party had an upset stomach after that breakfast. The only positive thing about staying here was that it was very close to Disneyworld. However, I don't think we would be staying here again. I would rather pay more for a nicer place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: jverge30
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed two nights for an anniversary getaway and we had a wonderful time. The room was beautiful with a gorgeous view and most importanly it was CLEAN! The employees were kind and courteous and the buffet downstairs was excellent. We were very close to all area attractions making it easy to plan our days and maximize our time there. We would totally recommend this hotel to friends and family...you won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: cazzafe
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel at the tart of December 2009 for 10 nights. The location is good for the parks, and has easy access to the I4 highway for trips further afield. We emailed ahead to ask for a tower room which we had been allocated, and would advise others to do the same. It was busy over the weekend and seemed pretty quiet during the week. Reception staff were ok. Concierge staff a bit more friendly. Cleaning not very thorough but there were clean towels and hoovering every day. We didn't eat in the restaurant in the hotel, but do try to avoid the buffet places along the 192 as the food is pretty poor quality. Go to the area called restaurant row on Sand Lake Road (about 10 mins in the car) for much better quality food for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it”
Reviews.Author: Cutieabracadabra
Reviews.Content: Ramada inn in Kissimmee is a big hotel with beautiful pools. Its very busy. The service is good. But the room we booked had smoke smell (I guess the previous occupant was a smoker). But they did come with room freshners upon our complaint. A decent and comparatively cheap accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “We've found our favorite place to stay in the Disney World area”
Reviews.Author: PhillyWDWFan
Reviews.Content: We travel to Disney World often, and have always searched for deals on hotels that are affordable, clean and safe. Over the years we have stayed at many different places, some good, some bad. But after finding this hotel last year, we won't be looking any further. We have stayed at the Ramada Gateway 3 times within the last year and have found it to be perfectly suited to our needs. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the service is very good. This past trip, our room was upgraded to the tower and we were extremely pleased with those accommodations...especially the kitchenette. Housekeeping did a wonderful, dependable job. The room was always clean and fresh smelling, and we had a nice view of Disney property, which is only minutes away. We had good internet service and the air conditioning worked well and quietly. The pool area is nicely kept and the pool is clean, large and refreshing. Our only regret in that regard would be that there is no hot tub. The hotel has a buffet restaurant at which we had breakfast, which was good with excellent, friendly service. And the on-site laundry room is clean and pleasant. All in all, we found this to be the perfect place for us and we would recommend it to anyone looking for a clean, comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Never going Back, EVER!”
Reviews.Author: PPapercut
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there beginning of August, and it was by far the worst experience / hotel ever. Just to start with the staff, they were plain simply RUDE, when we asked questions about the hotel or shuttle service, they could not get us away from the front desk quick enough. The room was not to bad, if you look beyond the air-condition falling out of the wall, the rust all over, the bath tub getting blocked after a shower, the electricity cutting out most of the time etc. etc. etc. We have traveled all over the world, and usually stay in the budget hotels, but in this case, it ended up costing us mush more, because we had to check out a day earlier and book into a different hotel. We definitely are not snobs, but to all out there, rather pay your $10 more, and at least get some sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: QSC
Reviews.Content: Simply Put, This hotel surpassed our every expectation. Customer service on every level is simply the best. When you travel problems will arise. When they do, you want this hotel on your side. It is hard to find a hotel that actually understands the importance of REPEAT BUSINESS!!! We will definately stay here again... Soon.

Reviews.Title: “Bed hard as concrete, unfriendly, smelly”
Reviews.Author: tallahasseefamily75
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 2 nights. The beds were as hard as concrete. Half the hotel was empty but they put us in a room right next to the dumpster which smelled terrible. The bathroom door in our room wouldn't lock. I asked for a wakeup call and was told I should use the alarm clock instead. After I said I would use the alarm, they said they would also do a wakeup call but they messed it up and did it at 5:30 in the morning, the wrong time. When you first check in, they send you to a timeshare desk where you have to listen to a salespitch before they will give you your parking permit for the hotel. There are hotels all around that probably provide a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: viklo445
Reviews.Content: I really had a great experience at this hotel, i reserved two rooms and i requested them next each other and also conecting, when i went at the front desk for check in, my request was not available,but we were very lucky because the front desk agent was very helpful and efficient, his name was Dario, Him and the rest of the front desk are very friendly people. I also liked the rooms,clean and confortable. Without doubt i would recommend this hotel to family and friends and anybody.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: kpalomino
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not fancy. Just a place to lay your head at night when getting in from the parks. Staff not very friendly. Lots of kids running around unsupervised. Fire dispatched twice while staying there (6 nights) because kids playing in the elevator. Smokehouse Grill not very good. Food very greasy. Our room was not cleaned until late in the day each day which meant one day we were taking a nap and didn't get cleaned at all. They never replaced our toilettries or toilet paper the entire time we were there. Had to check out at 5:30 a.m. to catch our flights back to Texas, and took 10 minutes for the front desk clerk to come to the desk. I know it was early, but they didn't even have a bell to ring. It is close to the parks. But, I recommend renting a car. The shuttles only go a few times a day, and you are at their mercy. It says Animal Kingdom is very close, but that is not true. Took at least 10 minutes each day to get where we were going by car (to the parks). We plan to go back in the Winter, and won't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A Definite shock when you first arrive, not the best emotion when you've paid for a nice holiday!”
Reviews.Author: sunshineel33
Reviews.Content: I want to give people an honest review of this hotel as when i was reading them before i went i felt nobody gave a detailed good review. And if i had had this info before i went it would have made things a whole lot easier. When i read the bad reviews i just ignored them thinking it was people being snobby. Im a student so used the not the nicest of conditions but i was surprised when i arrived. One review said it felt like being in a horror film such as Vacancy. I do agree with this. That was exactly what we thought when we arrived it just seemed really dodgy and the rooms were identical to a motel in a horror film. However after being there a few days you do realize that it is completely safe place to stay. I did think the other bad reviews were making it out to be worse than it was, but the room is pretty bad. Like it smells pretty strange and the bathroom is just gross. There were hundreds of dead ants in it every day when we arrived home. The bed and sheets were clean thou - so just the bathroom and smell really. Also was the odd bug found. The maid service was excellent thou, made the room feel alot nicer to come back to. The staff are pretty rude as mentioned in a review. Like when arriving and checking in they spoke in spanish (obviously about us). We were not made to go to the concierge desk before given our room key, probably cos we were a young couple and obviously couldnt afford to buy into time share. However older couples and families in front of use were. So thats a pretty bad thing, When all you want to do after traveling is get to your room and you have people shoving time share at the promise of cheap tickets down your throat. We chose to stay in this hotel over a villa as we did not want to hire a car and thought people would help. However nobody would help us with anything. The hotel reception and local tourist info points know nothing (apparantly) about the public transport. Yet conveniently all are friends with this guy that runs a shuttle to universal for $20 each, each way. Anyway getting around was OK. not the best but ok. The shuttle that the hotel runs leaves at 7:35am, 10.15am and 12.05 am. With return times being at 6pm, 8:15pm and last one at 10pm. Which is the time the fireworks start at Magic Kingdom. The ones at hollywood studios are 10.30pm. So if your wishing to see the fireworks you will have to pay aroun $25 dollars fare in a taxi back to the hotel. Yet many of the drivers we experienced did not know where our hotel was. And it is not easy to direct to either as all the roads look identical. Anyway to get to places such as universal studios here is the way to do it - without paying for a taxi (which cost $40 each way). You get the the Links buses from the disney transportation centre. (which is where the hotel shuttle drops you for the parks) So you catch the links 50 to Sea World, then the 8 to Wet and Wild and then the 37 to Universal. (dont believe someone when they say its a 10 min walk from wet and wild!) To get to and from the disney transportation centre (the disney transport system place) you can also get the links buses. To get from the Ramada to the centre catch the 55 (the stops near the hotel) then the 56 to the transportation centre. So if you go to universal without using the hotels shuttle you will have to get 5 buses in total to get there. Kind of annoying really. But after youve done the journey a bit you get used to it. Just make sure you know the last times for all the buses. (the 55 stops at 9 so doesnt help if your planning on staying in the parks late) We never went in the hotels pool so cannot comment on that. The reason being it was very crowded and we were intimidated by the big groups in and around it. Anyway i hope this helps somebody as we were very stressed about how to get around the first few days. And as i have stated none of the staff will help you as everyones interested in selling you something. We only paid £200 each for this holiday as it was extremely last minute so we were pretty satisfied at the end of the day. But if your planning on paying a large sum i strongly advise you to look elsewhere for accommodation. We would have been so angry if we'd paid much more than that for what we received. And that price included the flights - so the hotel much have cost hardly anything. Do not pay much to stay here. And do not think my review is exaggerating. Its telling it a it is. There were ants and funny smells. Yet we just saw it as a place to rest and didn't spend much time there. :o)

Reviews.Title: “!!!!!!! Great for the price !!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ayers2404
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 3 nights is this hotel and the staff is a bit slow but it was really nice for the cash. We loved the game room and the all around feel. The tower rooms are where you want to be due to the noise from the pool area. All around the staff the room and the hotel is a good deal for the MONEY and after all that what most trips come down to. Spend the extra money on some shows and in parks. AND DON’T EAT AT THE GRILL IN THE HOTEL!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Part of Magic kingdom!”
Reviews.Author: sgych25
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money, concerned by reviews we requested a tower room which was given with no problem. Room was clean and with new matresses. Fridge with small freezer in room. Bathroom was a bit dated but was clean and linen was changed daily. Hotel was 30 mins from Airport by car and the most it ever took us to get to the Magic Kingdom was 12 mins by car - buses available but we had hired a car. We felt very safe with 2 small children in our party. Pools were also clean and not crowded. No time share was ever mentioned and I never saw anyone being offered this. We had breakfast there once - ok but cheaper and better options a short walk away at Ponderosa. Launder facilities on site which we used whilst kids in pool which meant no dirty clothes to return to (woo hoo!). I believe that you could also use the facilities at the Ramada across the road but we never did. Over all clean, cheap, family friendly, parking not an issue with security on site. I will return and will happily recommend to friends and family...and also a little quieter than that of the rat race in International drive!

Reviews.Title: “cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: jayjaymcd
Reviews.Content: just returned from our two week stay here at the ramada plaza gateway inn. i booked it fairly last minute and after reading the reviews was failry worried. i had nothing to worry about. we had a car park view (nothing special but quieter than been at the pool) it had a fridge that was small but perfectly fine, two double beds and a tv with 16 channels on. it was cleaned dailly with 4 clean towels replaced along with soaps/shampoos and coffee for the coffee machine. it also had a ice machine around the corner from our room. for the price you pay what more can you want. it was clean and perfectly located to disney and food places for evening and morning meals. also noted that rooms where getting carpets relaced for those that did complain that they were dirty. the pools were clean and fresh clean towels provided at the poolside too. our only complaint was that they turned the water off for a few hours during the day and didnt inform us but that really wasnt a major thing. we didnt get hassled by the timeshare either as we avoided eye contact and told them we were students...seemed to work. all in all would recommend this to anyone and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Cheap! Clean rooms - Free Shuttle Bus!”
Reviews.Author: Broka
Reviews.Content: I stayed tehere for 6 nights in a pool view room. Each room has 2 double beds. And i paied only 47 dolars/night for the room! It can sleep there 4 persons! They have a free shuttle bus at 3 differente times in the morning 7:15, 10:15 and 12:05 (to Magic Kingdom) coming back 20:15 and 22:00. They have Restaurant with reasonable prices, free wifi, 2 pools outside and one of them have hot water. The staff are friendly and helpfull. Best things: Free Shuttle Bus and Big rooms (very clean every day). If you have a car, they have also a big parking place. It was perfect (and very cheap)! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1885
Reviews.Content: Hotel is extremely close to all Disney attractions. Helpful staff. The first room we were put in was noisy because it was close to the ice machine and elevator. Went back to the desk clerk who moved us to a quiet room, which was important as we were staying 10 nights. Hotel was very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient. next to many restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Buttercorn
Reviews.Content: PROS - Everyday the room is cleaned to high standard, and toileteries are replaced. - Very close to animal kingdom, from there you can get transfer to anywhere in WDW. - Free shuttle to MK around 7:15, 10:15 and 12:05 in the morning, coming back 20:15 and 22:00. Shuttle very clean and tidy. - Cheap! We only need a bed to sleep at night so the room is more than enough - Big room. It can sleep 4 people. Even we were facing the carpark, it was very quiet. - Nice and helpful staffs. They can always answer our questions. No timeshare at all! - Free wifi if u have ur own laptop. CONS - Soap is the worst I have every used. Make skin really tough. Water literally stay on ur skin instead of running down during the shower. So bring your own - One of the shuttle driver is not very nice to us. I found out that he is just not very nice to all Asians. He shaked hands and talked to other ppl, but when we say thank you he never even look at us (everytime). He never check others' hotel key for using the shuttle, but only us even we have been travelling with him for the whole week. And he shouted at us for getting on the bus too slowly too. - Air conditioning quite loud but we were so tired so we slept thru anything. Afterall this is a very good experience and I would stay in this hotel again for a budget holiday. Already missing Disney :P

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Paula73
Reviews.Content: This Hotel/Motel is excellent value for money and you couldnt ask for a better proximatey for the Disney Parks and Interstate 4 to Universal and others. Room was clean and a good size. Maid service was excellent everyday they check to see you are okay for towels etc. Reception staff again attentive and friendly. We used the Smokehouse Grill for Breakfast, food and staff excellent. We used the pool a few times both of them where clean one was heated and loads of towels at hand. I was very scepticle after reading some reviews but my family and I where very happy staying here and hopefully will return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice no frills motel”
Reviews.Author: duaned
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there February 22 and again on the 27th and 28th. Employees were very courteous, there is a lot of things right on the grounds in the event of poor weather. There is also a nice courtyard that is covered if it is raining. Front pool is nice size, clean, could have used a few extra degrees. Rear pool was unoccupied and didn't seem as clean, not sure if it had to do with the time of the season or what. Overall I think it was a very good value for the cost. Also there is a restaraunt on site, very good food and reasonable prices. I would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place !”
Reviews.Author: Jenn823
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice to stay at the room was very clean didnt smell bad at all very comfy and alot of room cute little kitchen and very nice view i did ask for a tower which i did read that at one of the reviews thanks.. My husband and i stayed with my two year old for two nights she loved it to bad we didn't bring swim wear to go into one of there many pools and by the way they looked super clean. Only bad thing is look at for the time share people lol don't do it.. I didn't they offer free breakfast and a trip arund with 100.00 which sounds to good to be true. Don't forget to use the shuttle it's great saves money on parking at the theme parks. Well hope my tips helped have fun and enjoy!! P.S. Old Town is right around the corner great place to hang out at night kids will love it from stores to rides and bars.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay here again- Awful experience!”
Reviews.Author: rddw
Reviews.Content: We had to wait past check in time to get our room. I think that the staff was just lazy. They said it was because of housekeeping, but after the shift changed we got our room in five minutes. The room smelled musty, the air conditioner was loud, the faucet leaked, and thepool was filthy! I will never stay in this hotel and possibly never a Ramada hotel again! We asked for King sized beds and got two double beds. The only good thing about this hotel is the location and the fact that I did not have to pay full price! Sincerely, Debbie and Richard

Reviews.Title: “Clean, and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: monyhngry
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend "won" a free trip to DisneyWorld and this was the hotel they put us in. Mind you, when we got to the "welcome center" he was infomed that this was for a timeshare presentation, but that was the only time we were approched about timeshares. They also gave him a "pass" on the actual tour after he told them that he won the trip on the radio and that wasn't expecting to spend two hours on a timeshare presentation that he knew fully well that he wasnt intrested in purchasing......from what we hear, that is a FIRST for that. After reading reviews on this site and a few others, I didnt know what to expect, but went in full of hope and great expectations. I knew from the reviews also to request a TOWER room, and I have to say that I thought it was great to have this info. We were given an non-smoking room facing Bronson Hwy on the eighth floor. We were able to see the Tree of Life and Expedition Everest in Disney's Animal Kingdom from our window. The hotel was clean, and the guest services employees were very helpful as far as printing out directions to the area. I will admit that twice they sent me out the way to Bank of America and the post office, but I guess I its customary to tell travelers where thing are that you are accustomed to than what might be closer. There were pooltables and games in the courtyard and those are closed off at 10pm. Also there is no daily room service so we had to request clean towels the second day. There is a resturant located downstairs but we didnt eat there. One drawback for me was that there are NOT ice machines on each floor....the closest one for our room was on the 6th floor Overall, I say if you are looking for an economical way to do Disney, then there is nothing wrong with this hotel. We didnt hear car alarms, kids running, or anything annoying. It was a nice place to stay for 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Crowded and loud in the parking lot”
Reviews.Author: traveliteVA
Reviews.Content: To book the hotel, I searched on Expedia for deals that crossed with good reviews on Tripadvisor. The problem with relying on TripAdvisor is in trying to find a current review for your hotel. (It's really helpful for people to review hotel stays promptly and consistently.) There were reviews for the Ramada only a couple of weeks old, so I booked here. I stayed Dec 28th thru 30th and will leave the morning of the 31st. Yep. WILL leave: I'm there now and had to write. I looked for a room while we were in Orlando visiting family. I drove up to the attendant's booth at the Ramada's entrance to find out about rates and he said that they had rooms starting at $49. I parked and went into the lobby and they directed me to the house phone. The lady on the phone said rates started at $79. When I asked about the $49 rooms, she said I had to go to the concierge desk for those rates. That was a "Come listen to a short spiel about our timeshares in the morning and we'll give you your rooms for $49 each night." No, I said. "Ok. how about we give them to you for $45?" No. "Ok how about we give you one night free? What about tickets to a show? Discounted Disney tickets." No. I'm on a tight schedule and I'm not interested in buying a timeshare. So I hopped on the internet and booked the rooms for $71.95 per night at Expedia. The room was fine and they let us check in early, so that was a small plus. Contrary to popular belief, not all hotels have a minimum free continental breakfast. The Ramada's was $6.95 for adults. As an earlier reviewer said, the parking lot view is a disaster for quiet evenings or sleeping through the night. With cars beeping on and off, pulling in and out all night, we could hardly sleep and add to that the loudmouths a couple of doors down that had the party in their room... well not "in" their room - more like on the sidewalk spilling over into everyone's room, and you have an aggravating, frustrating and unhappy experience. Gosh. By a TIMESHARE here?... you couldn't give one away to me!

Reviews.Title: “Ramada Review”
Reviews.Author: merchspu
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a week in Florida, staying in the above hotel. Have no complaints, only a few tips for those considering staying there: * the hotel offers a free shuttle to Disney but not Universal. However, the Ramada opposite offers free shuttles to all major theme parks whereas we forked out $40 for a cab (each way)!! If you're not driving, check out other hotels for their shuttle services. * the rooms are great, no problems whatsoever and the maid came in every day. However, we had a room facing the parking lot and were frequently woken by cars in the car park. Most cars beep their horn when the central locking is activated/de-activated and considering the times people arrive, this could drive you mad! Perhaps ask for a pool view room. * there are two pools in the hotel, one is empty as they don't allocate rooms around that area so you can get the whole pool to yourself. * the breakfast buffet is worth giving a miss. Better and cheaper just a short walk away. For any young people looking for nightlife and so forth, skip this area as it's very family orientated and head to International Drive instead. Check out Howl at the Moon, that is one brilliant bar!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Nothing wrong with staff,room and security”
Reviews.Author: Dutch-Florida-lovers
Reviews.Content: This was our second time in the Ramada Gateway. Both times we stayed in the Inn section. This year we stayed for 5 weeks. When we checked in there was nobody trying to sell us timeshare. And I was never bothered with it during our stay. Staff at check in was very helpfull and friendly. Our first room was clean, had a new fridge and the beds were perfect. After a few days the free WiFi broke down so we asked for an other room which was no problem. The second room was a smoking room, we don't smoke, but didn't smell like an ashtray at all. The WiFi worked and the room was clean but the fridge was old and small. I asked if they could move the fridge from our first room to this room and that was also no problem. All 5 weeks the staff was very friendly. Room was cleaned every day, got clean towels every day and clean sheets every 3 days. Housekeeping was very friendly but should learn English so they understand you when you talk to them. We felt safe in the hotel, security staff walked around all day and at the gate was a security guy every day. They also drove around the parkinglot frequently. There was a small problem with the carpet and a guy from maintenance came within 5 minutes and fixed it. He also was a very friendly guy. So if you want a good place to stay in Orlando near all parks and don't want to spend a lot of money, I highly recommend this hotel. I cannot say anything about the restaurant in the hotel because we didn't eat there. The game room was clean and all the games worked. Nothing was broken down. The only thing we complain about are some of the other guests. Why can't people think about the our guests when they come home late at night. People scream to each other in the middle of the night. Let their children run around at 6 am and put the volume of their TV at maximum. So people please, when you stay in an hotel, think about the other guests as they might be asleep at night and early in the morning. One time there were some guests 4 rooms down from us and they were very loud 2 nights in a row, so I called front desk and they send security and there was no more noise coming from the room during their stay. A BIG plus for security staff !!! Next year we will go to the Ramada Gateway again.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!”
Reviews.Author: RustyOhio
Reviews.Content: We had the misfortune of believing that (according to their website) this would be a great place to hold our annual reunion. So we, and quite a few others, rented rooms which included a suite to gather in and webcast from (for those who could not attend). To begin with, we had asked for early check-in yet had to wait for hours in the lobby so they could "clean the room". When we got to the suite it reeked of chlorox, yet it wasn't clean. There were ants all over the place (this was in the "newer" section). When we told housekeeping about the ants, they just came and sprayed more chlorox which did nothing to the ants. The refrigerator was dirty and wobbly, and the cabinet doors wouldn't close because they fit so poorly. The kitchen area floor was dirty, and housekeeping did not give us clean glasses each day, instead they just rinsed (no, not washed) the ones we had from day 1. We had to use the shampoo samples to wash our cups and glasses ourselves. The topper for us came when we tried to hook up a laptop, and discovered no wifi connection. Wouldn't be a problem, except that we had only taken the suite so we could gather to webcast to those who couldn't attend. The hotel staff lied to us day after day saying that someone was on site working on it, that it would be fixed later that day. Well after 6 days of waiting we were finally told by the company that services the internet for Ramada Gateway/Westgate that the internet was down due to a broken part, which for some reason was not available. Had we known, we would never have taken the suite, in fact we would not have taken the hotel. Seems we are the ones who got taken. They only gave us a credit of $20 a night. Seems strange to me that they would charge us $.25 a minute to use the lobby computer, yet not credit us for that same amount because it was not available in our suite. Stay here again?? Not on your life!!

Reviews.Title: “*****Nothing wrong with this hotel*****”
Reviews.Author: mubsie
Reviews.Content: I have recently come back from staying at the Ramada Plaza and i stayed in the Inn part of the hotel. After reading the reviews on here i was a bit wary of what to expect. I went with my boyfriend and we are 23 and 26. When we checked in we asked for a tower room but none were avaiable so we stayed on the second floor on the inn. The room was very big with 2 double beds, fridge, tv, iron & ironing board and Coffee maker. As some people said before a blind at the window would have been better than the curtain but we opened ours when we were in the room. The room got cleaned every day, towels where changed and the bedding changed every 3 days. This hotel has 2 pools, 1 heated and 1 shaped liked micky mouse!! The pool area was very clean and they was a laundry on site. The hotel also had secuirty at the entrance when you drove into the hotel car park and a few times when we were round the pool area we saw a security guard walking about which we found to be reasuring. There is nothing wrong with this hotel.. We had a great time and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Value”
Reviews.Author: zodiac6573
Reviews.Content: This hotel seemed to be undergoing some slight renovations but I'm not complaining because we got this room for $30 a night. It was just what we needed - clean, quiet and convenient. The rooms are generously sized and was a perfect base for exploring the Disney parks. I can't comment on the restaurant or the facilities as I didn't use them but for a stopover in Orlando, you cannot beat this value, for a standard, safe and CLEAN hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Overall good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nicola34
Reviews.Content: After hearing so many bad reviews on this website about this hotel we were very worried what we would find, but have to say, it really isn’t a bad hotel at all – don’t expect 4 – 5 star luxury, but for what you pay it is good value for money. The rooms were clean and maid service very good with everything you need and the hotel is located near to most of the theme parks and there are plenty of good restaurants nearby. The reception staff were really friendly and helpful despite other reports I have read on this website. However, there were a few bad points but not too many…….. Three days after arriving at the hotel we found out that our flight operator XL had gone bust and as there was no information anywhere, no one to call or talk to!!!! we decided to see if our reception might be able to help us or at least point us in the right direction, they didn’t have any information so we turned to the concierge desk (directly opposite the reception) and all they were interested in doing was selling timeshare to us!! we were not at all impressed with this, purchasing a timeshare was the last thing on our minds, we thought this was very bad taste indeed!. So warning to watch out for this these people they are very very pushy, best to not make eye contact!! The only other minus is the internet access at the hotel – it was not cheap to use and the internet connection was so frustratingly slow, it is not worth using, you are better off finding an internet café instead! There were two pools in the middle of the motel section, we didn’t dare use them as they looked really dirty, like they hadn’t been filtered in ages!

Reviews.Title: “What do people expect for their money?”
Reviews.Author: shaun5797
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews before we arrived for our 14 night stay, my friend and I (both 21) were both a little dubious to say the least.
