However, when we arrived we were more than pleasantly surprised. Ok, so it isn’t 5 star luxuries, but then again, we didn’t pay 5 star prices. After all, when you’re in Florida there is so much to see and do that it is only necessary to have a base to sleep in at night. The room we got allocated could have easily been the one in the pictures on their website- clean and spacious. It had all the amenities such as:- air con, iron, ironing board, cable TV, mini fridge, hair drier, soap, shampoo and conditioner, shower gel, shower caps and a coffee machine (which got replaced as soon as they were used and no they wasn’t charged for at the end of our stay) The sheets were changed regularly and they checked to see if we needed clean towels when we were there (more often than not, the two of us didn’t require another 4 bath, 4 hand and 4 face cloths every day) or replaced them when we wasn’t. We thought that the free safe was a nice touch, as everywhere we have stayed at previously have charged an additional fee (and for air con for that matter). We found all the staff really friendly and couldn’t say a bad word against them. In our opinion, they always seemed to be surprised when we used our good old British manners, may be they aren’t use to people being nice back to them. The only negative that I must agree with regarding previous reviews is the privacy issue. It is true that if you have your curtains open in the motel rooms people can see in. However, in my opinion it is more of a design flaw of a typical motel. Fair enough, some blinds wouldn’t go a miss but even then I’m sure our curtains would have stayed shut. But to be honest I can’t say it posed a massive inconvenience as neither of us are in the habit of sleeping with curtains open. During our stay, when we used the pool, we tended to use the “heated” one as it was more central to our room and can safely say that it was very clean and tidy. I don’t recall seeing any insects floating around in it or around the complex in general come to think of it. However, do people really expect every insect in the grounds to be eradicated? We can’t really comment on the food because we never ate there, especially as there are so many other gut busting eateries a short walk away like Ponderosas for example. As for the time share issue, we didn’t experience or see anything to suggest that was happening. Maybe they can pick out two students a mile away! :-) Having stayed there, I wouldn’t hesitate in staying there again or recommending it to friends and i urge people not to take too much notice of the reviews- make your own mind up or pay for 5 star. But then again i expect some people still wouldn't be satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “OK for short stays”
Reviews.Author: TIFFNewcastle
Reviews.Content: We (family of 4, with kids 10 and 5) stayed at this hotel on a stay and cruise holiday with travelcity direct on 23/7/08. This meant a 4 night stay, followed by a cruise and a return to the hotel for a 3 night stay. Having read the poor reviews before we went went we decided to book another hotel (Renaissance - Sea World) 4* for our return stay. (a good move) On arrival as expected we were put into a motel type room overlooking the car park. The cars were only feet from the windows making you feel very vulnerable. My 10yr old felt scared and we barracaded the door to make him feel secure. The room however was clean and towels changed daily. The wardrobe area was a simple rail next to the sinks which was too small. You can't open your curtains or the world sees inside your room (so you live in darkness). The hotel provides a free safe behind reception which we always used and would recommend. A positive - The location turned out to be great, a simple short drive to Disney World and the free shuttle bus was fine. Just up from the hotel is a fantastic Black Angus Steak house as well as a Ponderosa and sizzling grill, plus various shops etc. We discovered later that the hotel attached to the Steak house has a booklet called "Enjoy florida" - near the back is a 15% discount voucher for the steak house. We had breakfast one day in the hotel and it was Fine, the staff were lovely. One night we wanted some food in the room but the restaurant closed at 10pm which was annoying. The only advantage of the motel room is the quickness to the pool (behind). I worried about the pool at first as it was a bit cloudy but the kids had loads of fun in it without any problems. The smaller pool at the bottom of the hotel was full of insects etc, and looked horrible - we wouldn't let the kids in. I never saw or spoke to any timeshare people, and it was never mentioned when we spoke to staff who were polite and helpful. If your staying for a short break, the hotel is fine. but I wouldn't want to stay there for a long holiday. Overall I had an amazing 2 wk holiday which wasn't spoiled by this Hotel. (the steak house saved the day)

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Drinny
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at the Ramda Plaza Gateway. We were aware that this hotel was not a 5 star hotel, but you do expect certain standards. We have two children aged 4 and 9 and after arriving in Florida we were extremly tired and could not wait to check-in to our hotel. Upon arriving at the hotel we were immediately pounced upon by hotel staff trying to force a time share meeting down our throats (which would have lasted at least 1/2 a day) in return for discounted Universal tickets. This was the last thing we needed as we had two very hungry and tried kids. We said that we were not interested and that we would like to check-in to our room. We were horrified to see that we had been allocated a room in the Motel side of the hotel. It was terrible. We had been given a ground floor room which over looked the car park. The room was dark and dingy, you could not even open your curtains as you were overlooked. (There were no blinds). We did not feel safe staying at this hotel. It was like gangstervill. There was not a safe in the room, so you would not leave any personal belongings in the room as you felt that as soon as you left your room your belongings would not be there when you returned. The wiring to the television was not safe. There was pubic hairs in the bath. The fridge was dirty and rusty. It looked like there was mould on the floor. There was no way that we could stay for two whole weeks at this hotel. We went to speak to Pablo, the hotel manager, who said that if we attended the timeshare meeting he could upgrade us free of charge to one of his villas, but within one minute one of this offer his staff immediately said that all of the villas had gone!!. He then proceeded to offer us 100 dollars to attend the timeshare meeting for our inconvenince. All the hotel staff were interested in was selling you a timeshare. It was getting really late now and was too late to sort anything else out so we stayed for one night and thought maybe we could get hold of the holiday rep from COSMOS to try and sort something else out tomorrow once we had a good night sleep. There was NO WAY that we could stay at this hotel for two weeks! The following day we spoke to the most unfriendliest receptionist and we asked her if she had a telephone number of the COSMOS Rep, she gave me a number, which turned out to be completly wrong. She then commented that we had only arrived yesterday and that it would be 2-3 days before a rep contacted us. We found this to be completely outragious that a rep was not even there to greet us at the airport, you would at least expect a welcome pack at the hotel, but then to be told that it could be 2-3 days until someone saw us. There was no way that we could wait another 2 days, so we therefore checked out of this awful hotel and booked into the Disney Carribean Beach Hotel and then proceeded to have the most wonderful two weeks holiday. I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND THAT YOU DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL. THE STAFF ARE NOT HELPFUL AND THIS IS THE WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED IN IN MY LIFE. PLEASE TAKE MY ADVICE AND DO NOT STAY HERE. If anyone would like to contact me for advice, I would be happy to speak to you.

Reviews.Title: “Ok ....not a 5 star hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: 11sammie
Reviews.Content: I was very scared to stay here after reading some of the reviews, however I did ask for a Tower room and was granted one. The only reason we stayed there was because of a timeshare and that is where the accomodations were. The room was ok and cleaned each day we left.However one day they did not leave wash cloths and the next day they did not leave towels. We did not eat at the hotel, so I cannot comment on that. Thank goodness, we did not see any bugs in our room.In my opinion, it is about 1 1/2 steps above a motel 6.It was okay since I was not paying to stay there. All in all, it was better than I expected after reading Trip Advisor but if I was paying my money, I would have chosen another place to stay. I did not feel unsafe.... P.S. I did not have a computer with me and I did not like the fact that the "business center" charged like .25 cent per minute to access the internet.In this day and age, I think that should be standard for travelers...

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: chas999
Reviews.Content: Having booked this hotel several months earlier I was concerned by the bad reviews it was getting on this site. But I need not have worried as we found it to be a good basic motel which was clean and fairly spacious for the money we paid, and we even got a fridge in the room which we weren't expecting. The hotel staff were courteous and efficient, and the hotel is conveniently located for Disney and also not too bad for I-Drive area. It is wise to use a safe deposit box at reception as no hotel room is 100% secure and also make sure that no valuables are left in the room when you leave for the day and then you should have no worries about security.

Reviews.Title: “Rent an SUV and sleep there - Worst hotel in Florida!”
Reviews.Author: QueenTravelLady
Reviews.Content: Overall I felt as if I was in a budget motel or an inn. This hotel is falsely represented on their website. This is the worst Ramada in the world. Maybe my expectations are higher than those who settle for this dump but to me a family vacation should not include bugs! If you are looking to save money please rent a large vehicle and sleep in your car. The service at this hotel is not fit for wild animals. I chose this hotel for the "view" and "tower room" as well as the reasonable rates. My view was of a wall! When I requested a room change I was told that they were sold out, however a few hours later a friend called and was able to make a reservation. The rate that I was quoted online, mysteriously did not show up when I checked in. They managed to fix it however upon checking out they system still charged me the wrong amount (too much of course). The sheets and comforter did not feel fresh and my 5 year old would have done a better job of cleaning the bathroom. The glasses in the room were dirty - bringing memories of the news report showing how glasses are cleaned in hotels in Atlanta! Internet in my room was essential and I confirmed that I would have it prior to my arrival. Coincidentally they were having internet issues for my entire stay. Ramada staff at this hotel need customer training! They are awful. Maybe its the Westgate Resorts policy to make guests feel terrible because when I visited the Westgate Timeshare My experience with the staff there was horrible also. Overall I give this hotel a -10. I wouldn't advise my worst enemy and definitely not my friends. I used to love Ramada but this particular hotel gives the whole brand a bad name! There are other hotels that may cost a few bucks more that are even closer to the heart of everything and where the staff know how to treat you like a paying customer. Thank God for Mickey Mouse and the wonderful staff at the attractions...the best part of my Florida vacation.

Reviews.Title: “a clean, basic hotel. did the job for me...”
Reviews.Author: Irenethetraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights at the start of May 2008. I had been surprised with a trip to Disney, so I suppose if I had been in a tent I could not have complained. Still, I cannot in all honesty complain about this place. I found it clean, comfortable and as to the breakfast mentioned in a previous review - it was fine and was replenished twice while we were sitting. I have stayed in many hotels from 1 - 5 star in a couple of countries now and would put this one on the same level as a holiday inn. The beds were big and soft and clean, the bedclothes were the same. We asked for extra towels (we were a party of 4 women) and got a huge pile without question. Have to agree with one other review, they really should put net curtains on the windows. It was a little disappointing to have to keep the drapes closed while we changed etc. Would cut back on their electric bills.... The hotel is very close to everything, cant complain about the location and they had a comfortable shuttle bus that took us to Disney every morning and brought us home every night. The drivers were great and friendly. The staff in the hotel were ok but found one at the desk a little unhelpful. I had wanted to use the internet but the ticket machine you needed was broken. "Its broken" she said. "Yes" said I, "thats why I am here talking to you! !". "When do you think it will be fixed" said I. "Dont know" she said. End of conversation. She walked away and left me standing.!! Apart from that, no complaints. A budget hotel which is fine. Dont be scared off by the other reviews. I would go back anytime. Oh, and check out 'Capones' restaurant/bar down the street for a nice evening out if your party is adults only.

Reviews.Title: “don't belive the bad press”
Reviews.Author: bill1000
Reviews.Content: I have read the reviews this place gets and this could put alot of people off staying. We stayed in november 2007 for 7 day. We booked through travelcity direct so stayed in the inn rooms overlooking the parking area. The hotel is much like a travel lodge but bigger in size, the rooms have two king size beds and a bathroom. We found the rooms to be very clean and tidy no frills but for the price your paying you would be hard pushed to find better accomdation for the price in the uk. The staff we met were very friendly and on the one instance we found our door lock faulty were very quick to responde to our call and fix the problem in less than 5 minutes. The hotels best asset is that you are on the doorstep of disney and that the ponderosa resurant which is just 10 minutes walk away.(buffet breakfast for £2 quid you just can't go wrong). Overall the hotel is good value for money and if your doing florida on a budget then this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for $50”
Reviews.Author: freshee61
Reviews.Content: Great bang for your buck. no complains here. Cant beat the price! swift checkin and out. thanks

Reviews.Title: “Security issues”
Reviews.Author: tomocb
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel. There is a serious issue with security there and several rooms were broken into within a couple of days. Strangely, all the rooms that were broken into were due to check-out the following day. I was fortunate enough for our room not to be broken into, however we were using a safety deposit box in the back office. There are no safes in the rooms as advertised on some websites either. These problems were compounded even further when I asked for advice about what was being done about the break ins only to be laughed at by one of the senior members of security. One resident had told me that they had received a few phone calls they were not expecting, as if they were checking that someone was staying in the room. However, after I mentioned this to the duty manager he was not suspicious of a phone call which was put through to my room at 06:35. Obviously I did not answer it. I eventually had a brief look at many of the doors to the rooms nearby where we were staying and they all had markings made from possibly a crow bar either recently or some time ago. There is no security at the front gate of the resort so it is completely open access to anyone to any part of the buildings in the complex. Neither the managers or head of security advised any of the residents of the issues they were facing or even asked them to be extra vigilant. The staff responsible for ensuring that this sort of thing shouldn't happen are completely incompetant at this hotel and I strongly advise that you do not visit there until they significantly overhaul their security.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Trekker5211
Reviews.Content: This hotel was NOT a pleasant experience. When we checked in, we were told that even though we had booked a tower room, the only room available was a parking lot view motel room. Complained to no avail. The room temperature was either 80 degrees or 60 degrees, neither of which was pleasant to sleep in. There were bugs in our room often. The main problem I see with staying at his hotel is that you can get a much cheaper (and better) room at one of the Disney AllStar Resorts or Pop Century.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have stayed at in Kissimmee TBH”
Reviews.Author: lyke2snype
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a family of 5 in August 07. Would I recommend it to you - sadly NO. As we had booked with Travel City Direct (our 3rd booking to Florida with them) it states in the brochure that their clients are housed in the low rise building (basically cattle class - the Inn not the Hotel). The room was OK but certainly no better than a travelodge style, There was a fridge under the sink & minimal hanging space, Drawer space OK but nowhere to store 5 suitcases. The thing I found worst is there was no net curtains even though I asked 3 times if the room could be made more private it was not done during our 2 week stay. The high rise blocks do have nets but nobody walking past their windows. As you have a huge picture window looking out onto the corridor everyone can admire your items as they walk past. The whole time you were in your room you had to have your curtains drawn with lights on OR be on show to everyone walking past. As our room was one near the stairs & our holiday was mid August there were plenty of people walking past. The view of the car park was not great either but we weren't there to admire the view. The 192 is very busy but at least these rooms were not as noisy as some we have stayed in during frequent trips to Florida. The pool is nice, the laundry useful & being close to Disney is useful. There hotel could be massively improved at little cost by adding privacy with net curtains. Also the sink is in view of the bedroom the bath & shower are behind another door. My youngest had a roll away bed which was very uncomfortable. (She has slept on rollaways round the world so is experienced to comment. This was definitely the shabbiest room we have stayed at in Florida & the staff were not at all interested in making our stay more enjoyable. We did have 1 breakfast at the hotel & I must say the waiter was brilliant but the food hadn't been restocked so choice was limited.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Minzplaying
Reviews.Content: My son and I checked in after being in the area for a week, for one night. It was the last night of our Spring Break vacation and had been prepaid. We got there at 3:30, and they would not let us check in until 4pm even though the front desk clerk said that rooms were available. We went into the gift shop to pass some time, and before my son (age 11) could even reach his hand out to look at a toy, the clerk literally screamed at him to "TOUCH NOTHING! You break, you buy!" He said sorry, I asked her what he had done, she said nothing yet, but boys break things and you have to pay then. I told her not to worry... we would not be back in. When we finally got to check in, we were placed in the back at the motel section. I had reserved the tower section, but it wasn't available. We then had to wait to get a parking pass, and that was nothing but a ruse to get you to listen to a spiel about doing the time-share presentation. It took us until 4:45 to get out of the lobby and back into the car to drive to the back where our room was. The room was awful. The refrigerator leaked and the carpet was wet. There weren't any light bulbs in the lamps or bathroom. I was told it would be a while before someone could bring us any, but I was welcome to go get them myself. The beds were ok, but one bed had dirty sheets on it. Again, I was welcome to go get sheets, or wait. The food at the restaurant was not good. We didn't have to pay for our meal, because we didn't eat our pasta. We did pay for our drinks. We left the next day, having slept in the same bed together, the clean one, still no light bulbs in the room, and will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Now known to us as the dirty underwear hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanadaBruce
Reviews.Content: When booking this hotel I read reviews of other travellers and decided that this hotel would be a good budget choice if staying in the tower or plaza section. When we found dirty sheets and underwear in the bed after check in and it all went bad after. My family of 4 including kids 8 and 11 years old checked in about midnight after a long day of travel. Things started off bad and just got worse. When checking in my quoted rate was questioned but fortunately I had all my paperwork in order. Upon getting into the room we immediately checked the beds and bathroom for cleanliness as we always do. We noticed a small stain on the kids bed sheet but did not persue it further. The kids got their PJs on and climbed into bed. When tucking the kids into bed we noticed that there was another stain on the sheets and got the kids out of bed to check further. Pulling the bedding back revealed dirty sheets and we immediately called the front desk. They said they would send up new sheets but we would have to make our own bed. Tired and just wanting to get to sleep we agreed. When we pulled off the sheets to our kids bed we were horrified when we found a pair of womens dirty underwear at the bottom of the bed. We then called the front desk and asked for another room. The night clerk told us there was no other room and the manager would do nothing more for us. We went to front desk to discuss further and were told if we did not want this room or another room in the poorly rated motel section we could just check out. At this point it was almost 1 am and in an effort to just get some sleep for my weary family we requested 2 fresh sets of bedding to get through the night. Upon returning to the room we were called by the manager, who would not talk directly with us until then, and told we could have another room in the plaza. We moved ourselves down the hall to the new room which was very clean and more of what we were expecting in the first place. The day staff the next day was very accomodating but our experience was beyond repair at that point. To add insult to injury when we moved to the new room at 1:15 am we lost a pair of running shoes with a set of $250 orthodics that were never retrieved. Thought booking a Ramada would have been a more dependable customer satisfying experience but can not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not As Bad as Expected”
Reviews.Author: ape1261
Reviews.Content: I was expecting the worse, but it wasn't too bad. We arrived in Orlando at midnight a day earlier so when we were about an hour away, I called to see if they had a room available for an extra night. The girl at the front desk checked with her supervisor and he said yes, that since I had a reservation for the next day to come on and they would have a room for me. This was at 11:00 pm. We got there around 12:05 am. They had already switched managers and this one said, no, we have a negative 27 booked. He sent us to the (Motel) next door. It looked nice in the lobby but the rooms were horrible. As soon as we opened the door there was this GIANT roach on the wall, ants on the counter. We figured all the rooms were like this, so we just brushed our teeth, slept in our clothes and got up the next morning and went back to the Ramada to see how early we could check in. The girl at the desk said that we could check in at 12:00 pm. Great. We went to Downtown Disney and messed around for a couple of hours, went back at noon but guess what? No way, can't check in until 4:00. They did let us leave our luggage and go to the park. We got back around 11:00 pm and we did have a room available but I had asked when I made my reservations for a pool view room and for a roll-away bed. Well needless to say, I did not get a pool room view. My room was on the end facing the "well house" or something. That's o.k. though b/c the only time we were in our room was to sleep anyway. I was pleasently surprised at the room though. I had heard so many bad things about the rooms in the "Motel Section" and I was about to change my reservations, but didn't. The room was clean, spacous and updated. I did have to go around and around about a roll-away bed. The first night they said that they did not have any available. Told us to check back after check-out the next day. Still no beds available. I was getting upset at this point. I started to walk back to my room defeated but my little girl said "Mama, why don't you just ask for some extra blankets?". Great idea. I turned around, went back and asked the girl at the front desk for some blankets and guess what? They just happened to find a roll-away that was available. We had 5 people in our room and it was plenty big enough but I still can't figure out why they only left 2 towels and 2 washcloths each day. We had to call room service daily to get extra towels and washcloths or I chased down the cleaning ladies in the morning to get more. I would stay here again though. For the price it's not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended unless tower room then be cautious!”
Reviews.Author: decsmile
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 week - just came home. We would not recommend this hotel to anyone. We thought we were getting a good price and were prepared for a decent place as promised. What we got was an old room nicely looking over the pool in their older motel section. The carpet was stained and not well cleaned, bathroom in poor shape and the promised internet connection after calling tech services we were told it had been down in the motel section for a long time with no intention of repairing the connections. Our motel door also had to be forced closed to be secure and the handle would only open the door if you pushed and pulled up. Very unsafe. We booked through a timeshare program and the program was awesome but while there we complained about the room and were moved to the tower section of this hotel. The rooms are much better but the service at this hotel is the huge complaint. We came back from the Disney parks one day to find the cleaning staff had left an empty drink bottle and cookie package like our room was the break room. We had no clean towels, nothing else picked up only our beds made and their trash left. Upon speaking to the front desk they didn't even ask for our room number and just said what do you want us to do about this? So unprofessional. We then found where they left the trash bag and requested new towels and to speak to a manger - we got a young man with towels, questioning again rudely about what happened and what we wanted done. They didn't care at all and no call was returned from the manager after being told he was dealing with another angry guest. We never once got an "I'm sorry" from any of the actual hotel staff. That was unbelievable! On a positive side it is a good location, the conceigre service was great and the food at the restaurant was very good although they were short handed so be patient it was worth the wait. The gift store had good prices and was convenient, their staff was very friendly. The pool is nice and seemed well kept. It truly was the uncaring staff of the front desk, bad attitudes that made this stay horrible once we were in the Tower section of the hotel that is. Be sure to book in the towers for a better room and expect little from the actual front desk. If you ask for a tower room facing the main road it will also allow you a wonderful view of the Disney firework displays!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Checking Out”
Reviews.Author: SJMMT
Reviews.Content: -Nasueating bleach smells, damp brown carpet from a lackluster steam cleaning, and old rusty appliances are a few of the awful things I experienced at this motel. -Rude and inconsiderate customer service. Will never return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Value for money.”
Reviews.Author: K`sGran
Reviews.Content: Stayed for week as part of package with cruise and no choice of hotel so went with open mind. Easy to find on west side of 192. As mostly motel type rooms we were able to park outside our room which was a real bonus; obviously not everyone can. One complaint - not enough Reception Staff, so long waits to check in & out & to gain access to safety deposit boxes. Pleasant & helpful receptionists but seriously overworked. Lots of staff on Concierge Desk but they may be employed differently as offering Attraction Tickets / Timeshare visits (which we avoided) Non-smoking rooms are clean, pleasant & well maintained as are the pool areas- one pool heated, we used other as nice & quiet. We tried buffet breakfast which was on a par with others in the area ie basic breakfast fayre & quite adequate. The shuttle service to parks was poor, only Disney ones & very few. Some other hotels appeared to be offering shuttles to all parks . The "selling" point to us & the reason we would stay again was the closeness to good eating places, so not needing to take car & supermarket very close.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: emschick9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week with some friends and were very surprised by how good the hotel was. We had great service everytime we went to the front desk. We stayed in the "motel" part, the rooms were clean, the beds comfortable, bathrooms were clean and we had no problems. The pools both looked clean and well taken care of but we did not take time to swim. The bar in the lounge area had good service and we had no probelms with the gift shop. The only time it was closed was late at night. I've stayed in a lot of hotels in Orlando over the years and this is one of the few where I would stay again with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid At All Costs”
Reviews.Author: JoelandNess
Reviews.Content: Couldn't believe the lack of service. We caught the not so direct red eye from LA and arrived at the hotel at 11am after having being awake since 6 am the morning before. Our travel agent had made prior arrangements for us to check in early when we arrived but they would have none of it. We were told that check in was at 4pm no exceptions. When we asked if we could perhaps have a room when one was available they refused. There was no seating and we were expected to stand around for the next 5 hours for our room. All the seating was already occupied by people who had recently checked out. Being in the middle of no where there was no where to go while we waited. We ended up cancelling our room and going to a much more accommodating establishment. Absolutely appalled and disgusted.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory stay”
Reviews.Author: lindyloo-2007
Reviews.Content: Trip Advisor member - norfolk, UK Stayed at the Ramada Plaza for three nights from the 28/12. Having read a couple of reviews on TA site I was dubious about the accommodation, however, on arrival the receptionist was friendly and gave us directions to our room. We were in the motel section on the upper level. We parked below our room and there were not too many stairs to climb to upper level. Room was large with two double beds. Checked sheets, matress, etc and all were clean. Bed was comfortable with enough pillows and bedding. Air con worked well, tv and all lights worked. Coffee maker provided, as well as iron, board and hairdryer. No safe in room but I believe they were available from reception. Bathroom clean and provided with enough towels and products. Close to Disney and all restaurants, etc on I192. Overall, my daughter and I found this accommodation satisfactory and good value and would use again if visiting Orlando. No resort charges.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I thought”
Reviews.Author: SheffieldPip
Reviews.Content: This hotel was part of a cruise and stay package with Travelcity and Fast Track Holidays (which is another story!). We were, in fact, not looking forward to staying there, having read the previous reviews. Yes, it is a motel-type building, with the usual layout. However, we were pleasantly surprised by the interior. It has obviously recently been refurbished, with new furniture, carpet, beds and soft furnishings. It had two queen beds, and a table & chairs, the bathroom was clean, with a new shower curtain and had been recently grouted. I would suspect that we were the first guests after refurbishment. The wardrobe was a hanging rail in the bathroom area. A nice touch was the small filter coffee machine and plenty of shower gel, shampoo etc. The staff at reception were very helpful. It was very close to International Drive and Disney attractions and I guess that people visiting the attractions don't spend too much time in the bedroom and just need a place to rest. We didn't eat in the hotel and so are unable to comment. All in all not a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Needing a revamp.”
Reviews.Author: Stewartytosh
Reviews.Content: Tower rooms okay for a couple of nights. Would not advise staying for a week or two. Bar closed at 10.00pm which is a bit daft. We stayed in tower rooms for 3 nights & 'outside' rooms for 2 nights. Everything is dated. Needs a deep clean & redecorated. Black Angus restaurant next door was good for food & drink and you can walk to it, otherwise a car is needed.

Reviews.Title: “Gross and not worth it”
Reviews.Author: peacelovemusic
Reviews.Content: The bathroom smelled like urine, ants everywhere. The pictures were deceiving. The picture was of the tower, and the lower rates were for the motel side in the back. Our lock was broken and we were asked to leave our things in it while maintenance was called. The light switch didnt work either, the deli closed early on all the days we stayed so after we returned from the parks we were unable to get food.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: disneyl0ver
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time. I stayed here with my husband and daughter, 10. We had booked the hotel in advance through AAA and then based on reviews we requested an upgrade to a tower room upon arrival. For an additional $20 a night it was well worth it. The room was beautiful, the tower side was beautiful. Our room was cleaned every day except for a day that we chose to stay in and a supervisor came by to ensure that all was well with us. She also asked that we sign off on our request not to have the room cleaned and gave us fresh towels. The pools were clean and fun. The staff was more than pleasant. No one tried to sell us anything even when we requested directions to the parks. We stayed for 8 nights and enjoyed the stay so much that we are going back again next year. The only negative I have is not even my own. I heard complaints from one woman who was staying on the Inn side about the noise at night and how she had to call the front desk a few times to get results. I would recommend this hotel to any and everyone, just request a tower room. It's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not great”
Reviews.Author: JHG22
Reviews.Content: I definitely agree with the other review which says that this place is more motel than hotel. If you are looking for a luxurious hotel then this is not it. However, the room was a good size and all staff were friendly and helpful. The location is great for the Disney Parks and Universal but is also a good base from which to explore beyond the more touristy places. The hotel offers plenty of free parking and the pool is a good size. We only ate once in the hotel and it was terrible but since there are so many restaurants around the hotel, this is not a massive problem and you certainly won't starve. If you are looking for a good location at a reasonable price then this is the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “More Motel Than Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kilgoar
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this website before we made our trip to FL, we made sure to request a Plaza room. They are right, the motel behind the Plaza looks likes something from about 1965, with orange doors on the outside and rusty bars for side walls. We were first put into a smoking room and requested to be moved into a non smoking room. They were very accommodating and the non smoking room was great! It had 2 king size beds in it! The AC worked great, no concerns. The maids did get a little confused with the towels. After the first day we never got anymore washcloths, but the last day, we got about 6 bath towels! Everyone was very friendly when we checked in and the place is swarming with Westgate Resort sales people. My husband and I always do timeshare tours for free tickets, so it didn't bum us out. The only thing I can say about all the sales folks is that I can totally see how it would make someone feel uncomfortable, because they all have that "car salesman air" about them. Be prepared to answer "Did _fill in the blank_ take fabulous care of you?" about 100 times! My husband and I had a great time and didn't have to bleed the bank dry in the process. Stay in the plaza and be prepared to be invited on a timeshare tour and definitely go, it's worth the free tickets and a great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Such a Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: hootowl23
Reviews.Content: This was part of a package deal for our honeymoon. We had other choices, but chose this Ramada for the lower price and because the website made it look nice. Boy were we disappointed. When we got there they tried to talk to us about time shares, which we blew off right away. The first room they had us in was down a very long, hallway with water puddles and we ended up in the room at the very end of the hall, (next to a closed off portion of the hotel) and right across from the laundry room/game room where there was a pack of yelling kids. The room wasn't even the king room we had reserved. I immediately sent my husband back down the long trek to the front desk to tell them this was unacceptable and that no one should ever be put in that room. They did promptly move us to a nicer room upstairs in the tower portion, but like another poster, we resolved to spend as little time in the room as possible. What made it worse, was that since we had booked a package deal we could not just change hotels without losing a lot of money. I will never stay in this hotel again and do not recommend it to anyone. Next time (if there is a next time) I book a package deal I will definately upgrade for a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “got what we payed for”
Reviews.Author: bremnerLeeds
Reviews.Content: Me mywife and the little un have just got back from florida and stayed in the afore mentioned hotel.Before we set off we read the comments posted on this site and were quite worried with what we read.However it was not that bad ,there is no point in writing about checking in as we spoke to different people and experiences were varied,on our two previous visits to florida we have stayed in a villa but this time we thought we try a motel/hotel.So when we got to our room we were in a state of shock and wondered what we had let ourselves in for.But the fact is if you remind yourself you are not in a top of the line hotel and have booked somewhere that is close to all the attractions and amienetes the area has to offer it really is not that bad. The room we had , had two queensize beds made everyday,fresh towels supplied everyday,coffee machine restocked evryday,bath, shower,hairdryer and a mini fridge all of which worked and were kept reasonably clean.there are ice machines all over the complex(and they all worked),the staff are very helpful and friendly. Like i said earlier this is not a four star hotel and i dont think it tries to be one.But if you do all the things your meant to when in florida when you come back to your room absolutley shagged out (tired) then it becomes what we booked for which somewhere to throw your suitcases in and get enough sleep to do it all again tomorrow.One little gripe was the aircon in our room was noisy but we were too tired to be bothered.

Reviews.Title: “Hair on the shower wall!”
Reviews.Author: hd112596
Reviews.Content: We checked into the hotel at 2:30am due to a late flight. When we arrived, the check in area was very nice and the restaurant, although closed, looked clean. We got to our room, it was the last building about 200yards from the office. There was no elevator so we had to lug our bags up a flight of stairs. The room was disgusting. The floors were filthy, the tile looked like it hadn't been mopped in months. There was hair on the shower wall, there were live bugs crawling in the corners, the small refrigerator in the room was nasty, the blankets on the bed were stained, and there were electrical cords plugged into a surge protector laying in the middle of the floor. I stayed up until 4am making other hotel arrangements for the Radisson across the street, which we checked into at 9am.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Disappointed07Ohio
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from a Disney vacation. Our travel arrangements were made through a Time Share Property my daughter had invested in previously. When we arrived we were greeted in a very nice lobby area and it looked like a very nice hotel. After we checked in we were directed to a room on the other side of the "HOTEL' that was a MOTEL!!!!! We had to drag our heavy luggage up 2 flightd of stairs. there were no elevators and no bellmen! After we saw the room we immediatly decided to transfer rooms because t loked like a place someone would take a hooker!!! It smelled moldy and mildewy as well. We left our luggage and went to eat. When we came back we attempted to get a room on the HOTEL side but were told that it was booked for three months. We took showers and went to bed only to find a bug crawling up my daughters bedspread. Then when we picked up the phone to call the front dest to demand another room several bugs were crawling around under the phone! It was the most discusting thing I had ever seen!!! We moved out of the hotel the next morning!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: eminefl
Reviews.Content: My prepaid reservation was for July 28, 2007 for two rooms. When we arrived at the hotel at 11:20 pm there were fifteen customers ahead of me, all with confirmations but without the rooms. We were all overbooked and were sent off property, but they would not announce it until an hour and twenty minutes later when you got to the counter which was worked by ONE person alone!! Never again! By the time we made it to bed was 3 am and the following day we were told to leave by 10:00 am. I am equaly dissapointed with Ramada as well as [--]. As of today, I have not got my money back and I doubt that I will. The staff was rude, they would not apologize, instead we got yelled. A vacation to Disney gone wrong... So sad for three children and my husband. I felt like we were in a developing country.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with some minor issues.”
Reviews.Author: john.sowter
Reviews.Content: Having used this web page on many occasions to get the low down on planned holiday accommodations, I thought it's about time someone else benefited from my Hotel experience. My wife & I have just returned from a holiday to Orlando staying at the Ramada Plaza hotel in Kissimmee, This is our review. Reading the past reviews on this hotel ranging from 'crap' to 'good value for money', We arrived with some in trepidation on what to expect. Well generally the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Booking in was quick and we were directed straight to the 'motel' room (141) accommodation on the ground floor, (not the tower rooms, where reviews have always seemed more favourable) Our room also had handy car parking right outside the room. (Not always a good thing, as you will read later). Our room was very clean, had 2 large queen size beds, nicely made up, the bathroom had a bath, shower and toilet, plenty of fresh towels and a separate sink area. This also had a small but adequate fridge, ironing board, an iron, hair dryer, all working. There was a large TV (with free and pay as you view options). A small table and 2 chairs, and 2 adequate sized chest of draws. So we were pleasantly pleased with the room. Beds were made up every day but not with fresh sheets, these were changed once a week, but towels were changed daily. Now for the down side. Being on the Ground floor, and discovering later we were situated close to a hotel maintenance room, we found there was little regard for those trying to sleep. On a few occasions we had the need to report noisy staff congregating outside the maintenance rooms after 11 at night and on our first night a large delivery vehicle left its engine running for over half an hour after midnight outside the room, while the driver chatted with staff. A phone call to reception on each occasion did restore the peace, but I cant help wondering if this was a coincidence & It did not prevent similar issues on subseqent nights. Each morning we were woken early by the movement of maintenance and laundry trolleys being pushed along the path outside the room from 7:30am onwards, and during the 1st week our room maid knocked on the door at 8:00am to see if we were out. Not Impressed! Vehicles parking up and driving off at all hours of the night also presented a problem especially for a ground floor room, so be warned. If it wasn’t for the fact we were so very tired after the resort trips it would of been a greater issue. We should of realised that after the first problem we should of asked to move, But we were reluctant to change as the room was nice,the parking convinient and you never know what you will end up with. If I could of got a tower room, I would of done so, but these always seemed to be full. Both pools were small, clean and adequate for a quick dip. The pool surrounds were nice and the gardens well kept. There were always a free lounges to use when we were there and clean pool towels available. Be advised that there were some motel style rooms next to the heated pool and games area, which could present some unwanted noise, but great if you have kids. So in a nutshell, the hotel is generally very good for the money, its not luxury so don’t expect it. Staff were helpful and friendly. Its excellent located for the Disney Resorts, Only 10 mins from the closest (MGM). There are local amenities (shops, restaurants etc) right outside the hotel if you need them. I never went up the tower, but I would recommend a room there based on what we got and the reviews on these rooms, or at least be very choosy on what you get if they give you a motel room. I would use them again but would be more wary of my room location next time. If anyone wants any information on this Hotel or generally about holidaying to Orlando or the resorts then please feel free to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: bassman53
Reviews.Content: The wife and I arrived on the 24 th May 2007 .We had booked via a UK operator and had booked the front tower room for 3 nights , the standard for a further 11. We decided afyer two days to stay in the tower roomdue to moving which would have been easy, but the room had a microwave and fridge . reception staff found to be very helpfull , one problem with the loo flushing all the time contacted reception and the repaired it within two & half hours ,they left a message on the phone voice mail if any more problems to ring saving going to the reception desk.It is operated by Westgate resorts but no problem on being approached they have left us alone.Building has just been refurbished and very clean throughout staff always polite . I am a fussy person so am very happy with this Ramada.To be fair it is very good especially for the cost. All ice machines round the pool work that is a first for my visits to america.pool area nice and clean and the pool is heated as well.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Rob1967
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ramada plaza Gateway from May 6 to May 11 2007. The Ramada is seperated into two sections. The Tower rooms and the inn rooms. We stayed in one of the inn rooms(369). Room: The room was clean. It had working A/C,hair dryer, two large comfortable beds, color tv, coffee pot, and fridge. The shower worked fine. While it is time for new carpeting, it did suit our needs just fine. A clean safe comfortable place to unwind after a day of play at the Disney and Universal parks. Each evening when we returned to the room, the room had been cleaned, fresh towels were left, as were new coffee packs. Many of the area pizza places that deliver will leave flyers in the rooms. Pools: there are two pools to choose from. There are large towel carts at each pool so you dont have to use towels from your room. The pools are clean. Smoke house grill and deli: We did not eat at either. The smokehouse grill open for breakfast and dinner never seemed to have more than a few patrons even at peak hours. The breakfast buffett at 12$ could not compete with the ponderosa at 4.99 just up the street. On more than one occasion the deli was closed when the sign on the door posting it's hours said it should be open. I did once buy a 2 liter bottle of pepsi for 3 dollars and change. Gift shop: I attempted on several occasions to see what the gift shop in the lobby had to offer, but not once ,in 6 days ,did I find it open. There was a sign on the door stating it would re-open at 5:00PM which was on the door all week. I have saved the best for last. The Ramada Plaza Gateway is actually owned by Westgate Resorts. Westgate Resorts are really just a Huge timeshare conglomerate. But, you don't have to believe me, if you go to the lobby to take advantage of the discounted Disney and Universal tickets you'll find out for yourselves. My wife and I wanted 2, 1 day passes to Universal Studios and Island of adventure. They are right next to each other and you can do both in one day. more than a 300$ value which they were going to give us for 100$. And even a free breakfast buffett. The catch is during the buffett and for 90 minutes afterward they will put the screws to you for a high pressure sales pitch for their fabulous time share. You can refuse and will still get your tickets at the agreed upon price, but it's worse than root canal.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Ramada”
Reviews.Author: noahsark1926
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the 3rd floor in the plaza part of the hotel and really enjoyed it. I was only there for a few nights, but everything was fine. I am selective when it comes to hotels and this is a very good pick.. The room was nicely decorated and the bed was comfortable. The staff was friendly and answered any questions that I had. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: BIGcheeze
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay at the Ramada. The front desk was very helpfull and directed us to where we needed to go. The check-in line was super fast no wait at all. Upon unpacking there was a call from the front desk just asking how my room was and if everything was up to my standards. The room was clean and spacious. No complaints at all. The pool was large it looked and smelled clean although we never used it. Only a five minute drive to epcot. Great proximity to shopping and food.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for Disney at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: SuziPlum
Reviews.Content: Wasn't sure what to expect given the mixed range of reviews but we did opt for a tower room and this was a good choice as the room was very spacious, 2 huge beds, kitchen area and clean bathroom. We didn't have a view of Disney as we were on the wrong side but did have a clear view for miles around which was nice. Pool is small but ok. Restaurant good - seemed overpriced initially for breakfast buffet but as includes drinks and free children it worked out very similar to the others on offer down the road. Good selection of restaurants within walking distance. Only downside is that the bar was not open every day and it was a good walk to the next one! Very quick to get to Disney (few mins drive) and concierge staff couldn't have been more helpful (just remember to say no to the timeshare stuff on day 1).

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience!”
Reviews.Author: gansa222
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I visited Disney in December of 2005. I am shocked by all of the positive comments I have read about this and that is why I felt the need to write a review, even though it is quite some time after I visited the hotel. We had a wonderful time visiting the parks, but continue to talk about the miserable experience we had staying at the Ramada Plaza Gateway. As we booked the hotel, we were excited and impressed by the pictures shown on the website. It looked classy and clean. As we arrived, we were still optimistic--the lobby was appealing, although dead and not as large as we had anticipated. The trouble started as we were led to our room in the INN part of the hotel. We did not realize there were two separate parts, and we were booked in the back, motel-style portion. As someone who has stayed in average to above average hotels in the past, I was shocked when we opened the door to our room. I have never seen a room like it, other than in movies. The door was off the hinge, there was mildew, fungus, or some other unidentifiable disgusting material growing on the celiing, and the bathroom was unclean. I will say that after we went and asked to be moved, the staff did accomodate us and even "upgraded" us to a room with a view of a "mini garden"--one palm tree and some plants outside of our door--quickly and free of charge. Our new room lacked the growths on the ceiling, but absolutely reeked of mildew and just felt damp. The shower curtain was dirty, the bathroom was falling apart, and the matress on the bed was COMPLETELY sunken in the middle. It had absolutely no support. I would not take off my socks to walk on the carpeting. I dreaded having to come back at night, and we made it a point to spend as little time as possible in our room. My boyfriend and I laugh about the experience now, but we were absolutely miserable at the hotel and would NEVER stay there (or at any other Ramada, for that matter) ever again. It was extremely disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “It was o.k.”
Reviews.Author: hdsMemphis
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Inn side not the tower. I booked it through a web site where you pay in advance. I paid a total of $189 for three nights. I didn't think it was worth the price. It was an old beat up hotel. You can get the same quality for a lot cheaper else where. The rooms were marginally clean. The sheets were never changed, the carpets never vacumed (I could tell because there were peanuts on the floor that were there that didn't belong to me. The heating unit (yes, we had to use heat) was very loud and clicked very loudly when it turned on. Check in was fast and the staff was friendly. I had a minor maintenance problem and they attended us quickly. They try to sell you the time share deal as soon as you walk in. I told them don't bother with the speech and that was the end of it. I would stay their again only at a reduced price. I wouldn't pay more than $40 per night to stay their. The location was good. Very close to I-4 and World Drive. I felt safe at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: mouselovers
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews criticising this hotel, was a bit concerned about our 2 week stay booked through Travel City Direct. I needn't be, as it was excellent..... We had a Plaza room with 2 king-size beds (requested) on the 7th floor, with a great view of Disney, there were 5 of us, 2 adults and 3 children. Our room was huge, clean and kept very tidy by housekeeping, we had fresh towels every day. The staff were always polite and curteous and would go out of their way to help you. Yes, there were concierge staff there for you to buy tickets, etc and book timeshare viewings with, and sometimes there were quite a few in the lobby - but not once were we offered a timeshare tour or tickets - they were all very friendly and the most they said to us was good morning and good night. The hotel has 2 pools, one of which was heated, we used the pool on several occasions and it was lovely and warm, even in February. The hotel provide towels for you to use when using the pool and there was plenty of them. The laundry room was handy and at only $1.50 per wash or dry, was excellent value. The shuttle to Disney was really good, they left at 8am, 10am and 11.45 in the morings and returned at 5.45pm and 9.45pm in the evening. You were taken to Epcot, where you can get Disney transportation to any of the parks or hotels. They also do shuttles to Universal and Seaworld. There are plenty of restaurants in walking distance, the best was Angus Steak House (adjacent to the hotel) and Golden Corral (10 min walk), there was a Ponderosa 5 minutes away which was great for breakfast. The hotel's restaurant, Smokehouse Grill did the most excellent ribs. The hotel has a bar, which we used alot, the barman Jimmy was exceptionly friendly and a great host, the kids can use the games room whilst your'e having a relaxing drink ($5 dollars in tokens kept them happy for quite a while). I would definately stay at this hotel again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I'd read before I bought.....”
Reviews.Author: MaryLD
Reviews.Content: Well, I checked online and then booked directly with Ramada. I was traveling on business and booked a suite so I would have room to work. Although confirmed, no suite upon arrival. Waited until late to check in, still no room or rate adjustment - told I already had good rate at $89 (quoting others for courtyard cheap rooms $49). Finally moved to second day. This is a Westgate hotel (timeshare people) and they definitely support their sales people. Upon arrival, timeshare people overwhelmed you but once you told them no, they politely backed off and stayed off. Front desk personnel generally helpful, especially Rey. Don't expect help with the bags unless one of the timeshare people feels friendly. Don't expect to call and get any "service" oriented responses. Two calls and two hours of waiting for something in the room resulted in nothing so I stood at the front desk for 20 minutes to finally get it myself. Don't expect any help with drycleaning, they couldn't even find one that would pick up and they don't do any laundry either but they do have a washer/dryer available if you want to do it yourself. The breakfast bar was overpriced and generally greasy or stale and I should have known better than to eat any dinner where the menu is on the place mat, it was just horrible and again, way overpriced. Housekeeping was totally consistent in it's inconsistency. After three days I no longer got replacements for coffee and condiments and sheets were only changed twice in 10 days. Sometimes all the towels would be replaced and other days hand towels or wash clothes wouldn't be replaced. The suite was cleaner than the room but it was really scary to think what the stains on the furniture might be so I avoided the furniture completely. Dirt, rust and possibly mold were evident and it was obvious that a deep clean had not been done in a long, long time. Security was a joke. It was clear that on the days when they were doing timeshare tours there was a man in the booth looking for a car hang tags but that was usually on the weekends only and not for any consistent period. I kept to my room but on more than one afternoon the police were onsite, including a helicopter above for over a half an hour. I came and went to dinner at night without incident and never felt uncomfortable. I was a little concerned when one day my key wouldn't work and I went to the desk and they simply asked my room number and remade the keys, no ID required so I always locked my door and threw the latch when I was inside. My suggestion is to be clear what you are getting into, the tower is the tower and the courtyard is the courtyard and they each have their own prices. Although I wasn't going to Disney, it was really close. Ask yourself, when was the last time I saw dial knobs on a microwave?

Reviews.Title: “What's All The Fuss About?”
Reviews.Author: Matho1
Reviews.Content: First, I think all the travelers who post negative reviews about this hotel think they are getting first class accomodations. This is not true. The hotel is divided into two distinct sections, the Plaza or tower section is the more elegant or classier portion of this hotel which requires an upgrade from the standard room reservation. The Inn section is for the more economy minded travelers who want a decent room at an affordable rate. We chose the Inn section and spent an entire week getting exactly what we expected and more. Our traveling companions did not fare so well but I will explain that further below. Our room was clean, smelled clean and had no bugs or mold. We had clean towels and linens. Our water pressure was fine and the heat worked OK. (Yes, we needed heat in 40's-50's temps) Everything worked fine and the service was fast and pleasant upon our arrival. We did NOT encounter any Time-Share people nor did we have to deal with rude staff. It was too cold to swim but our 13 yr. old son went anyway and had a great time. The pools are well kept and clean. Towels are provided near the pool. There are pool tables, ping pong and a game room with about 15 machines (tokens) which kept our kids happy. The internet room provides wi-fi service with adequate work stations for several users and a laptop interface to a printer - n/c. Work station printer copies are .75/copy. We had a laptop in our room and were able to get complimentary wi-fi service in certain locations (low signal but it worked) The hotel lobby was HUGE and very nice with concierge. There is a cocktail lounge with a large flat panel TV adjacent to the open area lobby and a large area for relaxing in a couch or chair. The gift shop was open but I did not venture in there. 3 private pay-phones. We only ate in the Smokehouse Grill once for breakfast Buffet. The selection was limited but the food was good. There is a chef on-hand to make omletes to order and I found the wait staff to be very friendly. We did do some take-out from the menu, the nachos are GREAT! In short, if you want to live the high life with all the luxuries, try another place. If you want to crash in an economy hotel with some first class amenities available, you might want to try Ramada Plaza & Inn Gateway. our Pros: location - close to Disney, price, pool, hotel amenities, security (see below) FL LOTTERY retailer onsite in the Deli to purchase scratch-off tickets and on-line games was a plus! our Cons: The restaurant was closed early a couple nights, even Saturday and the Deli was not always available with wait staff working in the back and not minding the store (granted its off-season and not busy but...) Tips: Dining - Use the coupon books available most anywhere and online 1.)CiCi's Pizza - about 5 miles due east on 192, $4.49 All-U-Can-Eat Pizza/Pasta/Desert PLUS you can use a 10% off coupon! It was good! 2.) Golden Corral - about 1/2 mile west on 192, $9.95 all-U-Can-Eat Buffet with the most buffet menu items I have ever seen! It was GREAT! 3.) Universal Studios/Islands of Adventure Meal Deal - We feel it was a good deal but probably broke even and you really have to wait in line longer than most places to get your wristband. Forget the Sipper Cup deal, you gotta lug around the plastic cup all day and the straw is too big and clumsey. Avoid: Dining/Food/Etc... 1.) King's Supermarket/Liquor - Too Pricey! There is a Winn Dixie near Outback Steakhouse 1 mi. west behind the mini-golf course 2.) Outback Steakhouse - Not nearly as good as back home 3.) Black Angus Steakhouse - Simply a motel restaurant with inflated prices and average food. 4.) Gift Shops Ok, here is the rest of the story... We traveled to Orlando from Edgerton, Wisconsin as a group of nine. 3 families, 3 children and 3 rooms total. We all had airline seats together and hotel rooms right next to each other. Well, the first night, one of the rooms (not ours) had a very smelly stale urine smell and ants crawling all over the sink and toilet area. The staff was to have housekeeping there immediately but after a couple hours waiting nothing so they wanted another room and few doors down the hall, OK. The next day the heating element goes bad and they are forced out again. The room the hotel gave them had a plugged toilet and was not even cleaned. By this time, they were a bit irrate, understandably. The hotel Manager handed them the keys to a Plaza Suite, Yes, a suite! We all marched up to the new suite to inspect, all nine of us! All the doors on the way had numbers, 1200, 1250, etc... but theirs had 1300 SUITE. Upon entry we find vaulted ceilings, multiple bedrooms, two bathrooms, amenity after amenity... So naturally we had to find that the bathroom fan did not work and the shower and curtain was moldy. It is in a tropical climate afterall, right? Actually when we kicked up the heat, dust flew out from the fan and the clocks in the room were still set for daylight savings so no one has even been in the room for months. Ok, now all is well and they are satisfied with their suite, wheww! The last night before we leave we are sitting around having a few drinks (11pm) in the peon section (inn) and a guy from the neighboring motel shows up and is asking for money. HUH? He says he had his truck stolen and needs money to get to work. I quizzed him and found his story less than believable so I took his picture and called security. He left and started to wonder the halls next door watching us from behind some pillars. Darrell from Security came to our aid and we decided to call the cops because he was acting odd and who knows what he would do later. We have kids and now feel unprotected. 3 Osceola Sheriff Deputies arrive, we explain the situation and show them the picture. I think they recognize him and they call for back-up, pretty soon there are several squad cars and even more officers milling about the neighboring complex. They caught the guy and held him in custody. My daughter got close enough to the action get some info on the guy. He had just been released from jail the previous Saturday. He was going to jail that night for auto theft, possession of drugs or drug paraphenalia, possession of stolen credit cards and perhaps trespassing as the residence he said he was staying was registered to a women who was not at home. The cops were still there at 2:30 am when I went to bed and I have not heard anything about it since. I am curious though! An Interesting last night indeed! I recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Dingdongwongbong
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August 06. We had great expectations about Orlando but we were dissapointed with our hotel choice. The hotel itself is ok but we found our biggest problem was having no car. We found it impossible to get anywhere other than Disneyland from the hotel. Then trying to get out of Disneyland without out a car was a major problem as well. There is nothing spectacular about the hotel. Staff were nice (except on the desk for tickets to parks, shows, etc. Avoid!) The pools were great to escape the heat and having two meant neither were ever crowded. There is a pointless gift shop, which there was never any customers, beside the bar. There is about 3 large gift shops that are far cheaper within walking distance that carry the same items only cheaper. The room was fine (we stayed in the tower, 5th floor). Nothing amazing but not shabby. I probably would not stay here again even if I did rent a car!

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For.”
Reviews.Author: Novas747
Reviews.Content: -Staff are a mixed bunch. Half are con artists, the rest are just incompetent. If your not hiring a car DO NOT let them push Ceasers Transport on you. They're paid comission by this unreliable, over priced taxi firm. Insted look up a local taxi, which we found to be almost half the price. -Room wasn't in a good state, needed new light fittings and plug sockets were hanging off the wall. However room was cleaned daily to a good standard. -Didn't use the pools, looked clean and in good repair, but Imagine they are absolutly heaving in peak season. -Location was excellent, a half dozen eaterys within walking distance, a free shuttle to Disney and not more than 15miles from the Universal parks. As a stand alone hotel it was very poor, however from a value for money perspective it was satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Our Florida Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Madgewicks
Reviews.Content: We have just spent two weeks at this hotel. We were quite pleased with the accommodation after reading some of the reviews. Our room was cleaned every day and we had no complaints as to the cleanliness and facilities. The swimming pool was lovely/peaceful and sheltered from the breezes. We enjoyed the fact that we didnt have to drive out every night to a restaurant. We were within walking distance of a quite a number of places to eat eg. Black Angus, Sizzlers, a little bit further was the Red Lobster and the Outback. We didnt use the hotel restaurant, but a number of people did. The hotel is ideally located for travelling to Disney, we were surprised at just how close and in the evenings, we could even see the fireworks, The only downfall we felt were the Westgate staff who pounced on you as soon as you had checked in. We thought at first, what a nice welcome, but they were trying to sell us reduced price tickets if we signed up for their timeshare meeting. Not exactly what we wanted after a 9hour flight plus transfer. However, they did not pester us anymore after that initial contact. We would definitely stay here again. It was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: abac317
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the plaza part of the hotel and it was great. My room was big and looked new and was very nice and clean. We stayed on the 6th floor and could see disney and that was nice. We had a king bed and it was big and comfortable. I thought that the service was good. I did not like the time share reps but i just overlook them as i go in. I did not stay at the inn part of this hotel so cant say about that. So if you stay at this hotel get a plaza room and stay on a high floor overlooking Disney.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Base for the Theme Parks”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter52
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel, we read various reviews about the Ramada Hotel which indicated some negative comments which did concern us. However when we arrived we were pleasantly surprised with the hotel. The rooms were clean with new beds and pillows, to which we were told the whole hotel`s beds and pillows were being replaced. We found the staff extremely helpful and pleasant. We used this hotel as a base for travelling around the central part of Florida ( Not the theme parks ) and the west coast. We found the hotel`s location to be very convevient for our travels. We would stay there again and would not hesitate to recommend it to others. We booked the whole package through Travel City Direct, we found them very efficient and professional.

Reviews.Title: “"The closest I've stayed to the Disney parks. Ideal!"”
Reviews.Author: MrJohnston
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ramada Plaza at the beginning of October 2006 and before staying there I read a number of conflicting reviews so I didn't know what to expect. I really enjoyed my stay there. It was nice and clean and fresh in our room. The beds were comfortable, staff were friendly enough and the lobby was newly refurbished. I was shocked by how close it was situated to the entrance to Disney World. (10 mins drive at the most.) Looking from the window of the room I was staying in, which was on the 6th floor, the Everest ride, Tree of Life, Summit Plummit, Epcot Ball and Tower of Terror could all clearly be seen. Of a night time the fireworks from Magic Kingdom and Epcot could also be viewed from our room. Another positive point about this hotels location was the fact that it had a Black Angus Steak house (recommended), Sizzler, Ponderosa and 7/11 petrol station, all within walking distance from the complex. The only negative points I can give about my stay there would be to comment on the Westgate reps in attendance in the Lobby. Although very pleasant, and holding doors open for my girlfriend and I etc, they did, for my girlfriend in particular make it feel a little intimidating when entering and leaving the hotel, mainly due to the number of them present. The other, far less important negative was the lack of functioning drinks machines on most floors. One night I was gasping and took the lift to 5 different floors to try and get a drink, without luck. Some floors didn't have a drinks machine available at all. It must have been a good stay if thats all I have to complain about. In conclusion, the Ramada Plaza contributed to what turned out to be the best holiday my girlfriend and I have had together. I would stay there again, if not for anything else, but for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for a holiday, see review.”
Reviews.Author: akm3434
Reviews.Content: Hotel reviews are subjective are they not? We all have different standards and expectations so my review is a canid one of my stay at the Ramada Plaza in October 2006. The hotel is located on the East Bound 192 between mile markers 5 and 6 just prior to Angels restaurant. Geographically the hotel location is ideal, the reception is modern and the reception staff welcomed us, and could not have been nicer. This is a large hotel with a "high rise" accommodation block which we did not stay in and the low level two storey (ground and first floors) which we did. We were originally allocated a first floor room which we had requested but had to change to a ground floor room after one night due to the "drone" from the air conditioning units on the roof. The reception changed our room without question and the air conditioning was very noisy, especially at night when the background noise is less. The room is clean and tidy with drawers, TV, two double beds, a wash basin with clothes rail and ironing board and a toilet with a bath/shower. The buffet breakfast is great, but cannot comment on the evening meal as we ate out all of the time. There is a Deli for Pizzas etc and this was nice to use and eat from. There are two pools but we used the one nearest the reception which is basicall rectangular with depths of 1.1m to 2.4m. The pool is heated, well maintained and sun lounges and palm trees and in abbundance. The pool gets the sun all day long. They also provide towels to use pool side which is a great idea, you return the used towels to a bin when you have finished with them, brilliant. The room and hotel overall was ideal for us as we were on a budget, and use the room for storing our possessions and sleeping in only, that said it was better than expected and/or anticipated having read the reviews posted here previously. Occupancy levels were "low" at the time of our stay and at full occupancy your experience may be different from our own. My niggles are, The security guard on the main gate does not stop and check vehicles or people entering the premises, so what effect does he have? The evenings are "dead", the bar is quiet with TV and no music. Pool and table tennis can be played outside in a covered courtyard. Dont use the hotel room telephone for international calls its very expensive, buy a international phone card instead and use the phones in the covered courtyard. The room has two curtain tracks and I think (but I do not know of course) that the first could have been for a net curtain and the second for a "heavier" curtain. We kept the "heavier" curtain drawn all the time as no net curtain is fitted and also people walking by can and do look into the room, so privacy is compromised. Also without being paranoid those intent of stealing from hotel rooms can look through the window prior to gaining entry possibly? There is a man on site with a petrol power leaf blower and he likes using it a lot! When I say a lot I mean A LOT AND FROM EARLY IN THE MORNING. If you stay hear ask for a room in a quit location away from the air conditioning, plant rooms, the leaf blower, and do not forget that car parking is right outside the rooms is some examples and you get the noise from people and vehicles comming and going. Major Moan. I approached the Concierge desk enquiring about theme park tickets. Straight away we were pressurised into visiting the West gate Resort nearby for cheap tickets in return. I explained that I would not and could not afford a villa or a time share, did not want to waste my holiday time and was prepared to pay the full fee. The middle aged lady who was dealing with our enquiry was rude and is obviously not used to someone politely saying NO THANK YOU and she is obviously not used to not getting her own way! If you want this option then goon for you, but for those of us who do not should still be treated courteously I think. We purchased our tickets elsewhere and I can only assume that this part of the hotel is the para military wing of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Defintiely worth a stay !”
Reviews.Author: Stew2205
Reviews.Content: All too many reviews are purely negative, but I have to agree with the last two reviewers in their positive comments about this hotel. We stayed for 2 weeks at the end of August / begining of September. Initially we were located on the ground floor of the motel part, however after 2 nights were asked to relocate as they were refurbishing our block. Whilst initially I wasnt too impressed that soon changed when we were moved to the 8th floor of the main hotel with views over to Magic Kingdomn and Epcot. Occassionally it could be a little noisy at night (why do American Fire Engines have such loud sirens and use them at the dead of night still?) Rooms were spacious and had reasonable facilities. They do need a really good clean but were functional. Air-con worked fine as did the iron, fridge etc. Plenty of fresh towels etc were left daily. There was plenty to do at the hotel. The 2 pools were usually empty which suprised me as they were superb. PLenty of towels usually availble.There are pool and table tennis tables, a basic gym and games room. We found all of the staff to be really friendly and helpful. Any request we had from room service were met very quickly. Would recommend using the safe boxes. They are free to use.
