We also chose not to eat in the hotel, purely on price, as there are numerous restaurants within a few minutes walk or drive. There is a Publix supermarket as couple of miles up the road too. We drove to the parks each day. The hotel is situated on the main 192, with very easy access to all of them. In summary we had an enjoyable 2 weeks here. It isnt the Ritz but for what you pay it is superb value for money. Dont let all the doom and gloom stories on this site put you off.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a break”
Reviews.Author: dazbear
Reviews.Content: Was a little concerned about staying at this hotel due to reviews on this site and others, however was pleasently suprised! Give it a break - it is a budget hotel being used by most as a mere base for the theme parks. In this respect it delivers - we only paid £20 per night for the two of us. Ok, the rooms need a bit of updating, but they are clean with maid service every day. The 2 pools are also clean with fresh towels. The hotel is ideally located near Disney with plenty of restaurants within walking distance. Give it a go!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fine”
Reviews.Author: mariespa
Reviews.Content: i am only writing this review to give a different opinion to some of the other recent stays at this hotel. I stayed here in July with my elderly mother and two small children. Yes this is a budget choice, however, for the low price ( we paid around £25.00 per night) this hotel/motel is absolutely fine. ROOMS-our room was cleaned every day, we were left loads of fresh towels, shampoo,conditioner,mouthwash and body lotion. The rooms also had a little coffee maker and coffee sachets were also left each day. Downside of the rooms are that they are a little dark,slightly small and the air con is a bit noisy, but apart from that they were just average and fine. POOL- our room was at the back next to the small pool, which again was fine, pleanty of fresh towels supplied. We didn't use the pool very much but only because we we out most of the time. STAFF- i again found the staff perfectly friendly, didn't have much call to speak to them, however when i did they were helpful enough. We used the Disney shuttle bus a few times which was good, if there were to may people waiting they always sent another one. Drawback of the shuttle bus is that the last one back departs Epcot at 9.45pm, this is really to early if you want to catch any fireworks etc in the parks. So really it's easier just to hire a car. We used the hotel cafe a few times (didn't use restaurant, so cant comment) cafe was ok done nice pizzas. At the end of the day you must remember to review a hotel depending on it's star rating and price. You can't expect a top notch champagne hotel on a lemonade budget!!!! I have stayed in many many hotels all over the world from 5 star in Dubai to hostels in Capetown, and this hotel is in a great location for Disney, and is very reasonably priced....so if that's what your looking for this hotel is fine. Who goes to this area to spend much time in their hotel room :-/

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Joyisthename
Reviews.Content: Maintenance was painting bathtubs and fumes made me ill. Took me 3 days to find out why I was so sick. Had taste of primer in my mouth and major headaches. Vacation was totally ruined. Manager moved me from room at poison controls request but was offered no reimbursement or no extension of stay so i could get full use of Walt Disney hopper passes. Manager admitted the paint fumes were strong in my room and that the fumes were most likely coming through ventilation ducts. Poison control requested a material safety data sheet to know the exact product I had enhaled and it was never supplied. This hotel is not concerned about safety or health issues. After being home over a month and making several attempt to get part of my money refunded I was offered one-hundred dollars. I lost aproximately 400.00 on the Disney hopper passes I was unable to use due to the symptoms I was having. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “not so good”
Reviews.Author: ffcc
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the ramada plaza and have to warn you all , don't use the phone in the room to call the uk as i had a charge of $17.00 DOLLARS per 1 call for2 minutes, and made 3 calls in total and was charged $53.OO DOLLARS ... A total rip off. The rooms were just okay as were the staff , whom had trouble trying to understand our strange accent no matter how polite you were. The pool was the worst , the water was smelly and cloudy and probably not cleaned from last july 05 that is. Locality of the hotel was great and the food was okay, but check out some of those servers in the resturant , they can't even speak english . So come on Ramada, clean that pool and stop ripping the british public off with STUPID phone call charges . f&c

Reviews.Title: “Worst case scenerio”
Reviews.Author: crash100
Reviews.Content: The most disguting hotel I have ever seen in my life. We were out of there in 2 minutes. When we went to get our money back they did not even seem surprised. One room was even missing a bathroom door. Floors filthy, bathroom utterely disguting. I am really surprised Ramada has there name on this place. It was a joke. I have stayed at plenty of Ramada's in the past-but after this place I will never stay at a Ramada again. Plus it was Saturday afternoon in the middle of July and the pool was closed. They said it was becasue it was being cleaned. I saw no one cleaning the pool-just a foggy dirty hole with water.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a room there for three nights, but only stayed one. Everything in the room was wet, the rooms were very dark, and the service was just so-so. I got a refund for my other two nights and switched hotels. Was much worse than what I had expected and would not stay again.

HotelInfo.Name: Ramada Gateway Kissimmee
HotelInfo.Address: 7470 W. Irlo Bronson Memorial, Kissimmee, FL 34747
